jPZllHVyv6hx-oR7MRFP4g.text: Best chicken sandwich ever! I had it twice in one week and it was consistently juicy.  Although I ordered the spice level above mild, it still was spicier than I thought. Also, the crinkle fries are a must. Overall, good choice for a quick lunch.

wwhWn8K_uJpljpJCcau5bw.text: I just wanted to add that the super hot sauce is the best. I went back again and this time asked them to double dip the chicken in the oil before the powder and wow it was excellent. Highly recommend.

5IUA5DCl4a2Z2WviK18igw.text: We got medium heat and it was still spicy! Fried chicken has extra crispy skin but the meat is still tender and juicy. The ice tea was creamy.

mP1s4TQG8wT5x6WuDohPvQ.text: This shit right here!!!! this was sooo good! I got a 2 piece medium and it was still hot but tolerable and mannnnnn so worth it and amazing!!!

R5fQCVfEJ1XsXlOgC4p4RA.text: You will never be satisfied with the other guy's chicken again. Hattie Bs inside The Cosmopolitan, 2nd Floor Is a great way to get a delicious foodie lunch for less than $10. I tried the small dark lunch platter with 2 sides. The chicken, which was generously proportioned had a crispy outside and moist delicious inside. Perfect protein. I paired this with a side of pimento Mac & cheese (they had me with pimento) and collared greens. I washed it all down with some of the best ice tea I have ever had. Miss Hattie knows how to cook! Splendid. Your trip to Vegas would not be complete without a stop here.

jqMGB_iW-PJnln64N21w9Q.text: This brings back so many great Memories of living in Nashville! What a thrill to now have it alive and well in Las Vegas! Do yourself a favor and get some! You will not regret it. We got the sneak peek but come September, you can get yours.

rZwi_2JDvOe3xktRR8Rw3w.text: AMAZING! We loved it. We went to Nashville last year and didn't get a chance to eat here, so this was a cool opportunity. My husband got hot and regretted it because of how hot it was, but he still loved it. I had mild with Mac and cheese and cole slaw. Delicious!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I696dlhEPF-B0k8EWgRVDQ.text: So we ate at the original in Nashville.  This place lacked in ambiance and character greatly in comparison.  This place would be better off as a stand alone with outside seating.  With that said the chicken was good but was missing something.  Something lost in translation - as I said it may just be the setting.  Also, please offer different size beers.

4Hp8FiW7MXa61LIQsHtaMQ.text: Overall the chicken is juicy and as hot as you want it!  The french fries are excellent, but the other sides are so-so.  If you are planning to drink, pace yourself since draft beers are a whoppin' $11.00.  Atmosphere is fun and casual.  I'd go back.

bD6Rv3XFVSDO4RI7FWMhyw.text: The Urban Food Hall at the Cosmopolitan has hit a home run with this one. Hattie B's does it right when it comes to Hot Chicken. The service is great, portions are perfect and atmosphere to match. Highly recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wGgxlIb-aKvswfubwE5LFg.text: Chicken was way too salty. They forgot to give us the dipping sauce we asked for despite writing it on the container. I will say the fries were delicious and the staff was very nice/ energetic.

9ECEws4RAHyZ-e41uMbTGA.text: I've always wanted to try Howlin Rays in LA, but the wait is super long and I can't get myself to wait HOURS for chicken. With all the craze and hype around the "hot/spicy" fried chicken scene, I was super excited to see Hattie B's inside the Cosmopolitan. During our stay at the Cosmopolitan we dined at Hattie B's twice. The first time we got the 3 piece tenders in the "hot" spice level. I love to eat spicy food and I would say their "hot" was actually mild for me. We went back the next day and decided to get their hottest spice level in "shut the cluck up". As we were going back up to our room to eat, we realized we forgot to grab a drink. Oh boy! Wrong mistake! One bite out of the "shut the cluck up", we definitely shut the f*** up and were eating in complete silence. We felt the heat coming out of our ears, started to get sweaty, tears started streaming down, and even our face felt a little tingly. We tried to let it pass, because we refused to pay for an overpriced drink from the mini fridge but it was definitely an emergency situation. We ended up grabbing a $8 coconut water from the Cosmos mini fridge. That still did not suppress our burning tongues, so in the middle of eating, we ran down the hallway to fill our bucket with ice. That was our lifesaver! At this point we still had two chicken strips left between two people. In between eating a piece of chicken, we would ice our tongues. Lol! Despite the heat, the chicken was juicy, flavorful and fried to perfection. For the sides, we tried the Mac and cheese, potato salad, and the coleslaw. The Mac and cheese and potato salad was bomb, however their coleslaw was pretty bland. So to sum everything up, if you decide to try the chicken in the "shut the cluck up"... make sure you have a drink and some ice!!!

JWMih99PPBZSIDreuqrjPA.text: I've been to Hattie B's in Nashville and it changed my life! I've been searching all over for a place that could come close to it so when I heard they were opening up a spot in Vegas I was ecstatic. I decided to make the trip out to have a try and I hate to admit it, but I was sadly disappointed. The Vegas location seemed like an airport version of the restaurant I fell in love with in Nashville.  The flavor was almost there but it just wasn't right. I ordered the half chicken with fries and Mac n cheese. The sides were good, kinda hard to mess that part up. The chicken....not so much. The meat was dry and the dredge was hard as a rock. Think about a very thick, over fried, tortilla chip.  Overall, it wasn't the worst hot chicken I've ever had but, it doesn't hold a candle to Hattie B's in Nashville. If you are in the L.A. area you are much better off waiting in the line for Howlin' Rays. Now that place will not disappoint.

uaGerU1RytI5GScHaQ572A.text: I just ate here and the chicken is super yummy! I got chicken tenders and a medium spice flavor!! I also ordered mac and cheese and fries, they were really really tasty. The place is great and the atmosphere is very chill!! We stopped at District Donuts after and they were also super yummy and very fluffy and full of flavor! We will be back for sure.

Ky9sPAx7f8gdfiB-BLeWRw.text: Not only is the a failed attempt to mimic Prince's hot chicken in Nashville, they didn't even do it as good as KFC. Save your money and pass on this one.

s_UFdWqHtpRwFv4vF0Lhqg.text: I'd heard many good things about this place so we made our way down to the strip to try it out. Unfortunately, it wasn't everything we had hoped for. Everything was over salted and the sides were mostly bland. The potato salad was pretty good, and that's coming from someone who doesn't like potato salads. Overall, it wasn't bad, but I'd rather take my fried chicken cravings elsewhere.

ANlKeq87RwF6LA6LpAe2SQ.text: I lived in Nashville for 7 years and HB's HC was a must go on a weekly basis. It was thrilling to see them open one in Las Vegas -without a doubt- I hopped in and ate when I was in town chilling. Long story short, no matter you like the chicken or not, this does not taste original or authentic, not even close to the ones in Nashville (Charlotte Pike or Broadway) where long waiting line speaks to itself. Chicken was tender but not flavorful and the spice does not blended right. However, the best part was their homemade ranch dressing. That's that. Won't be back to this one in LV

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0T1q03jYN_4uPiHBIoMuig.text: While the food was excellent. I can't rate this place high. A 12oz iced tea was $5 and that is with no refills! I can't return to a place that gouges you. Not to mention the price of tea was not listed on the menu but everything else was.

IgJEzOtslEIZeN-3J41oCQ.text: Was going to get a plate and pudding, but they won't serve water! Really unethical in the desert we live in

waiOagfGen3TjdFwFVg16g.text: The chicken is really flavorful, spicy and crunchy on the outside, and juicy on the inside. I had the top three hottest spice levels.

T32LBtItiiT5RGtfPeOhWg.text: I had the mild chicken sandwich with fries and potato salad. It is all a must try! the chicken had a great taste along with the potato salad. The prices are also reasonable and about the same price as other hot chicken places I've gone to. The only reason I'm giving them 4 stars is because the bread from my sandwich was cold and I didn't think it went well with hot chicken.

BoKiOoIR1crG93q1MwtQcg.text: When I heard about Hattie's opening, I was pretty curious and excited! I LOVE hot chicken. My friends and I have even endured the crazy 2+ hour line for Howling Ray's in Los Angeles to get them!   My friends and I got to try Hattie B's on Labor Day since we all had the day off. It was perfect because they opened up Labor Day weekend -- the whole Block 16 Urban Food Hall opened up Labor Day weekend!  We decided to share two orders of their small dark, which consists of a leg/thigh quarter. Each order was $9.00 each, which is really fairly priced for them being in a casino. Each order comes with two sides as well. We got one of them in medium spicy and one of them in damn hot. For sides, we got their mac and cheese, crinkle cut fries, coleslaw, and potatoe salad.   The chicken itself is very tender, soft, and juicy. As far as how it would taste really depends on what spice level you get. The medium spice chicken was really delicious. It was a little spicy and a little sweet -- a good combination over all. The damned hot chicken, however, had no flavor besides the spice. We were severely disappointed in that. Was it too spicy that I can't taste the spice? No. I've had Howling Ray's spiciest level on the menu and they used Carolina reapers for that one. Hattie B's damned hot does not use Carolina reapers. It seems like Hattie B's is so focused on making the chicken spicy that they forgot to actually season the chicken. Spice was all it was.   To confirm that thought, I tried a piece of my friend's chicken tender. He had gotten it in "shut the cluck up" level, which is their spiciest level and it was the same. The chicken had no flavor -- all I could taste was the spice.   All the sides were pretty decent.   My recommendation is that if you're going to eat at Hattie B's, choose medium or lower as your spice so you can get the full flavor of everything. Regardless, the prices are reasonable because you get TWO sides with your order. Downside is that because you're in a casino, they don't believe in free drinking water. You would have to buy your drink if you did not bring one with you. Also, they ran out of ranch when we were there. How do you run out of ranch? Beats me.  Overall, pretty decent. I would probably say it'd be a 3.5 stars out of 5. As a local, I wouldn't come here specifically for Hattie B's though.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q4oApTbe0Oxzc0XwbCBQQQ.text: Hattie B's in Las Vegas?! Sounded too good to be True. But indeed, there is Nashville hot Chicken to be eaten. Located in the Cosmopolitan, the space is relatively clean.  The fried chicken is delicious. It is hot and juicy with lots of flavour. Medium spicy is the perfect level of hotness. One thing that I did not understand is that they force you to pay a tip but also make you pick up your own food at the counter and don't serve anything. So why am I forced to pay a tip when I'm not even being serviced? Thought that was absurd.  Hattie B's is delicious. Even though it is not in Nashville, this location is as good as the original.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. medium half chicken is fire

RD2nMbhEOeqsAM1eeYjnjw.text: I came across the food court in The Cosmo and saw everyone's yummy chicken plates from this place and had to give it a go. Looking at the menu this place gives you a deal compared to other places since you get 2 sides with your chicken plate. I ordered the 3 jumbo chicken tenders with the southern greens and cole slaw. When they say jumbo they mean it! These chicken tenders had so much meat that I couldn't even finish them myself. As for the chicken I ordered it mild with the sriracha sauce. The seasoning was too salty for me, but the crisp was perfect. Mild flavor wasn't too spicy, but good enough to make your nose run. As for the southern greens.... you can do without them. They needed some extra flavoring. The cole slaw was ok. As I was trying to be semi healthy with the sides I chose these items, but next time I would order the fries and mac and cheese. Def recommend this place! Next time I go to Vegas I know where I am going and what sides to get.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mild chicken tenders
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mild chicken tenders with cole slaw and green beans

euEtpk2aA39-BuXZ1ZlpLw.text: Oh girl. This Chicken is good like real good. We ordered the hot chicken sandwich in Hot and a side of Mac and Cheese for the little guy. The chicken was juicy and had a crispy crunchy layer of breading but I was totally expecting it to be spicier. Next time we may have to order the extra hot. The Mac and Cheese was approved by my 11 month old as were the pickles. The food court concept at the Cosmo is fun the only concern I had was seating but we were able to snag a booth which was helpful with a kid in tow.   Mom Rating 3/5 Don't bring your stroller  I didn't look for highchairs but expect to have your kid on your lap  Kids love chicken Water is $5 a bottle

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and cheese side
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1HtsmpwKBFydfedBlQTeFA.text: omg omg!  This is exactly what was needed in Vegas!  I mean you cannot go wrong with some good ole homestyle spicy chicken! I must admit this is way spicier than i like but the chicken is so flavorful and portion is amazing definitely worth the price.  We also tried the macaroni and cheese and baked beans, yes yes the perfect sides for this great chicken!   This place is located at the Cosmopolitan in a small food court area on the second floor. Cant go wrong with this spot after partying.

vf05bGl3s6MBMHYAwpshYw.text: Great addition to the Cosmo.  Located inside Block 16- reminds me of a small Chelsea market in NY or Anaheim Packing District.    Nashville chicken in vegas. For the 1/2 chicken with additional tenders and chicken sandwich.  I love spicy food so getting a medium for the sandwich- it has a good kick- great flavor.    The chicken is moist and tasty.  Got three different slides - potato salad and fries are ok.  Must get the pimento Mac and cheese- great flavor.     Menu is simple.  They offer some beer on tap.   There some seating around their booth. Got our food within 5 minutes.  Service girl where you pick up the food is very passive and not helpful- my only complain.  Another customer helped me bag my to go boxes.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8zU_8ZNtPJkO5jmN6gqooQ.text: I was so so stoked to find that there was a location in Vegas! All of my friends in Boston went to Nashville and were raving about this place. Like they legit wouldn't stop talking about this place lol. So the inner foodie in me felt like I cheated the system and had to try it. The friends that I went to Vegas on this trip also went to the original location and were excited as well.  One thing you need to know about me is that I like heat, but can't handle THAT much heat. I wish I could, truly I do. So I had to settle for the chicken sandwich with the lowest amount of spice (forgot if it's mild or whatever it's called). As for a side, I got the mac and cheese. I was a bit disappointed my the mac. I thought it would be better. The sandwich was pretty good, but not the BEST I've had. It's probably due to the fact that I was still full from the meal I had earlier in the day. It was pretty good, but I heard they're known for their hot chicken. I had a bit of it and it was better than what I got for sure.  Maybe if I build my tolerance one day, I can tackle the hot chicken.

GpRBToDI9H0lhkorpe_YvQ.text: Amazing amazing quality crunch and munch! So much flavor!  Didn't think Vegas could truly pull off some authentic food but here we are!

VPnHIXd6OP0-lqEwxf7pHA.text: The food is great. I love spicy food and ordered the hot. It was hot. If I am at a thai restaurant I tend to pick level 4/5 and my add additional spice. This was really spicy and I didn't even get to the shut the cluck up.   Sides: fries were solid. The Mac n cheese was good.  Sauces: good variety. I really appreciated the honey mustard to balance the heat.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N2Q6tGzf-D9tccmK9qwG8A.text: Great prices, big enough to to share for two! Great for lunch. The medium spicy isn't that spicy so if you're a spice lover go all the way! The Mac and cheese side was awesome. A must go to...the line is usually long but moves very quickly

YwB3Sjquj31JZkCfUOy7TQ.text: Decent Southern fried chicken with good spice level (I ordered "hot") although not as flavorful or 'incredibly juicy' as Blue Ribbon.  The skin is crispy and not soggy or greasy so that's a major plus. The problem with all these 'hot chicken' places is they tend to be more about what's on the outside than what's inside.  I would rather have juicy, flavorful meat and lightly seasoned skin than hot sauce overcompensating for dry meat.

Iyt1Ds9ikxYBnUUBldaYsA.text: The fried chicken sandwich here was good, although I'd still want to compare it to its original Nashville location. Coming from LA, I'd say it's comparable to Howling Ray's (and without the two hour wait!). I like the comeback sauce a lot and it feels less heavy. My favorite side that I tried was the potato salad although the fries were ok too. The coleslaw is just the same one in the chicken sandwich so I wouldn't get that one.  I actually think the price is reasonable ($14 for sandwich and one side) on the Strip. However, the no tap water option really bothers me (isn't even restaurant legally obligated to provide upon request?).

JQoBOZ_rTsojQRwxukT6uQ.text: Easily the best chicken I've ever had! We ordered the chicken strips with fries and Mac and cheese. The strips were seasoned to perfection; mouthwatering and the right amount of spice.  Every bite was just as good as the first and left us wanting more. The Mac and cheese was spicy and the perfect pair to the strips, it's spicy, cheesy, and not dry at all. This place is a must try if you like Nashville hot chicken or any type of chicken. You won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Jumbo tenders, &#34;Hot!&#34; flavored

CE1Bq-Yyu5WPJD6hbKe8ZA.text: The fried chicken sandwich is $14 and comes with a side. We chose medium spice level and side of collard greens. Chicken was super moist and well seasoned. It was also quite a large piece and very filling! I must say, the medium spice was pretty damn spicy. Like I had to take pauses to let my mouth cool down. I'd probably get mild next time. I also wish I could taste their sauce more. It didn't stand out, probably because my palate was most focused on the spiciness. Collard greens were decent, nothing out of this world.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $14, includes a side.

zCn9Rx_uYOd1lYZ6pznTeA.text: It's time to come clean: Perhaps I sometimes base my trips around places where I am going to eat. And I'm not ashamed. Last time I was in town, Block 16 didn't exist, and now I was looking forward to trying a couple of their offerings. Hattie B's was up first.   I show up on a Wednesday night and gauging from the other businesses, this one has a line. I'm third in line, but I remained third for quite a while, as in, five minutes. Figure it's worth the wait so I stuck with. Guy behind me was getting impatient though, which I can understand if looking from a different perspective. I'm trying to be positive here so I remain.   Finally, I placed my order of (3) tenders (southern style), fries, ranch sauce and cole slaw. Now I wasn't sure if the delay prior to me was the guy having issues ordering or if it was the cashier but I soon discovered it was the cashier. I handed her my Identity card, and she appeared confused. Then she asked if I was charging this to the room and I said if it's easier for her, yes. I provide her with my room # and ID, then she wants my credit card so I thought she was going to charge me instead. After all this, she ended up charging my room. This took a few minutes in itself for her to do.   As for the food, I have to say my favorite of all was...the pickles. I'm not kidding. Obviously that's probably not a good thing as I had more of this meal to tackle. I usually enjoy crinkle fries, but the seasoning just didn't appeal to me. Cole slaw was okay. But the chicken just didn't do it for me. I will be honest and say since I had this as mild as can be, this could have been the reason why. But it is an option, and I guess I expected more.   On the upside, although the service at the register was slow as molasses, she was nice. And the girl who handed me my food to go was sweet as well. Perhaps their Nashville location surpasses here and is worthy of a visit, it certainly sounds amazing according to other reviewers who were fortunate to compare.   This was my first meal for my trip here, and so far, I'm a little let down. Hoping for a different experience on my next trip down Block 16-

MDi4Yi5LV-ZGFHUxeVIxpg.text: Shocked by the high reviews. I ordered the chicken tenders plate, Mac and cheese, and cole slaw. The chicken was rubbery and I had to pull to get a piece off. Really? I've had a lot of friend chicken and was extremely disappointed in this spot. I'm thankful to have way better options at home in Los Angeles. Biggest complement to this place is that the prices are reasonable-uncommon in Las Vegas.

lwvPYGaMe7WVyGNB_AnM5g.text: This is a great place to check out if you are needing a good quick meal. The chicken is delicious and the mild spices are just enough heat to have flavor and not be over powering. I also had the mac'n'chesse but I was not impressed. The french fries also left something to be desired. But the chicken is really why you're going to this place and that definitely does not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tenders, fries and Mac&#39;n&#39;cheese
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

P-ZjoYeNHG3B5LJUHaYONg.text: I read the previous reviews and I understand where they are coming from.  Honestly I didn't have big expectations of this place but we love it so much that we end up going three times during our trip because so far the chicken it's so rich in flavor so juicy and it's a really good portion. I tried the chicken sandwich and it was amazing! All the combinations and the flavors are mixed with cole salad and their dressing.  The first time I went I ordered it with Mac and cheese which it wasn't my favorite but my husband loved it.  Next time I had it with the fries and they were so good. And the last time I went I had the tenders which I only had two (comes with 3 tenders) and I was so full!  The tender comes with two sides so I had the cole salad and fries again. The salad was okay and the tenders were good, not dry and they were huge but I rather have the sandwich again.  So if it's your first time try it! You won't regret.  Their staff isn't the friendliest but it didn't bother me at all, I only order my food and that's it. I can't wait to go back in town and try this place again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Hp8k8iZc2QKnZfe9hvkCDg.text: First time for hot chicken and I am sold!!!!! Where is Hattie bc I want to thank her personally! Sooooo good. And when they say hot, they mean it! I love spicy, hot food and the "hot" had me sweating. They have 2 more choices hotter than "hot" and idk who in the world can tolerate it, but more power! Anywho.... greens are real deal! Somebody's aunty put their foot in them and I want to eat them every single day! The fries were good too, but I would pass on the mac'n'cheese if I had the choice again... and I am a mac'n'cheese type girl! Also, do yourself a favor and get you a smashville lemonade! It's perfectly mixed with a little Jack and Lemonade. Did someone say delicious?!?
