Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love Hattie!
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Hot&#34; chicken breast with wing, greens &amp; mac&#39;n&#39;cheese

HWLvjhj8dgHVlu7mh8on5Q.text: Most people that are giving this place four or five stars have truly never had True hot chicken. I was disappointed in a real way with this being Hattie's B. Tea tasted rotten. Chicken wasn't spicy at all on the hot level. Coleslaw tasted exactly like KFC which means it's cheap and the chicken was cheap as well which had that rubbery texture to it. Only 4-5 star item I had was the Mac and cheese but I didn't stop here for that.

dO4Sjew4bo-Kl86szmZlqw.text: If you've ever visited Howlin Ray's crazy 2hr lines in Los Angeles, you'll be happy to know that your next visit to Vegas could satisfy your Nashville style hot and spicy chicken with all of your classic southern side dishes (Mac n cheese, collard greens, the works). Absolutely delicious!

1H0Rqi-9_UgcA83jmh4ybQ.text: The best fried chicken. Great size, sides and heat. You can tell that its good by the long line all the time. It's the best

Fj97O_6V18Os94wLJisyzA.text: Trying hot chicken in every city I visit is a must for me. I heard that Hattie's would be open around the time I was visiting so I had to make a stop. Especially since the original location in Nashville has a 4.5 star rating with 4,000+ reviews. My bf and I ordered the small dark hot plate. The chicken was crunchy and juicy and seasoned to perfection and not overly oily. The sides we got were the pimiento mac n cheese and potato salad. Both I highly recommend to order. The mac and cheese was the best I've EVER had at any chicken joint! I actually enjoyed these sides more than the ones Ive had at Howlin' Rays! We also ordered the chicken sandwich medium spice. The size was perfect and dressed nicely with just the right amounts of comeback sauce and slaw. My only regret was that i wish we ordered it spicier. Unfortunately the only downside to this meal was that the fries were a little bit cold by the time we got our food, but that I was able to over look cause everything else was so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot chicken in yo face!
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium chicken sandwich
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium

CbVjBWJc8CvPKhLFDHSDVA.text: Definitely knocking the heat down to appeal to regular Vegas folks, but nonetheless really great fried chicken and enough heat to keep you asking for water and longing for more. We had the large white meat cluckin hot and regular heat. The skin is just the best and the meat was huge with two pieces of white bread and 2 sides for $15. In Vegas this is outstanding value. The collard greens were a little dry and needed some meat flavor but still fine for your green fix. The Mac and cheese was slimy and had a nice pimento to spice - worth an order for sure. Opt for the sweet and spicy sauce as well for dipping. Overall this tastes the same as Hattie B's in Nashville and you can get it with a short line in Cosmo. Fantastic!

vJ0MxY8oIqq1Tg4nW3Q2CQ.text: Chicken is nice and crispy. Sauces are good, first one with a meal/plate is free and any extra is .50 cents but they don't tell you that. The Mac and cheese has a kick (kinda spicy). Cole slaw is good. Potato salad is cooked well but lacks salt. Sandwich is great but can get salty at times (ordered it a few times now). Fries are good. Overall value for the food is good.   Last time i ordered i paid for extra sauce and they forgot it and i didn't realize it till i got home :(  Check your orders before you walk away, but i guess that's a general rule everywhere

-gN3zus9J8yR2KYyXLgECQ.text: The chicken was perfectly spicy on the outside, super juicy inside, and the ranch was ON POINT.

kKFumaVFVM1-6O-uQGMZqA.text: Located in the Cosmopolitan Hotel, this is the BEST HOT chicken on the strip!! I got the hottest flavor and my lips were burning, but in a good way!! I love the fast service and the location in Cosmo! Such great shopping to do after, and also it is great to eat after a spa day at Cosmo or an afternoon by the pool at Marquee. I have eaten here for lunch everyday since I have been here!

lzuklfvg4VxX21APfc0XCA.text: I had the chicken finger meal with mac'n cheese and southern greens & all I can say is YES!!! Coming from SW Louisiana and craving some fried chicken, I'll reiterate...YES!!!!!!!

d7E5l6oghv3yYJKN0hFvIw.text: Outstanding.  Must try if you love fried chicken.  There is plenty options to choose from and levels of heat.  I sadly eat before posting.   Try it.  Beware.  All drinks are ridiculous price in Vegas, including non alcoholic.  They charge almost $5 fir can of Diet Pepsi.

qG9z-MaiAWI0bYHpCoYRfA.text: I've been to the one in Nashville less than a two months ago and this one just isn't the same. Food was ok, nothing special. Meat wasn't as juicy and  not as crunchy.

uvhyVpQ6ft8LW7i-FTYCeQ.text: I made my second visit to The Cosmopolitan Hotel on this trip and I wanted to make my visit to Hattie B's to have their Nashville Hot Chicken. I decided to have a "hot", I'm not prepared to have the "Shut The Cluck Up!" yet. The breast and wing was quite good, that and the chicken was plump and firm, as well as enriched. I also had two sides: pimento mac & cheese and greens. Both were excellent. I would come back for another again.

4fRmhp-QrM4ds2LdlcPwTA.text: The chicken was tasty and definitely hot.  Seating is limited at this location.  So we had to stand at a  high top  table.  The staff was friendly and the food came up quickly but it was really pricey for what you get so I removed one star.

jg_MEKW0rDqA4AX3Oliyhg.text: Hattie B's in Nashville is AMAZING, Las Vegas...... Not so much! This location makes the company look bad. The chicken was not properly spiced, the greens were overly bitter and salty. Let's not get into the Mac N Cheese...... Deff no where near as good as the original.

QWRXIuBPVfBz2bmQQcIscw.text: Dang it. I really, really, really looked forward to this meal and everything was executed perfectly - the heat was spot-on; the crisp skin was beautiful; the meat was tender and juicy - except for the flavor. There is an underlying smokiness/paprika-abundance that just overpowers the taste, and it was so nettlesome that I didn't finish my chicken. I know that Hattie B's is a legendary institution so I'm just hoping that the spice blend was 'a little off' the day I ate there. . .I will try again, hoping it was a one-off, but for now, three stars. It was just that off-putting.

_LV2A5dT5zeJal4xgAcvMA.text: I tired to 1/2 bird mild with fries and macaroni and it was good. I shared it with someone and was still full by the time I was finished. The mild does have a more than normal mild kick so if you don't do spice choose something else. I love the fries. It was  cooked just right. The mac was good enough for me to eat. It had a little kick also but maybe it was from the chicken. Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

855Hv9522bjGpa89bjKZDg.text: The food was 5 stars!!!! Absolutely fantastic, super delicious... just wow..  worth any line they have going on. However... standing in line for about 15min or so, i saw an employee reach in her pocket, pull her phone out, text someone and but it back all while wearing gloves... and yes she touched buns after.. ouch. Nonetheless AMAZING..

gaE-xV49YHj_pqlIYaiG4g.text: To be honest our friend picked up some Hattie B's after spending the day in a cabana, so we needed something to soak up the day time drinks. We each got a meal which included a large piece of chicken, French fries, and a side (we had Mac n cheese). Enjoyed everything, be warned the Mac was very spicy. The chicken was tender and juicy. The box came with a side of ranch which was the perfect finishing touch. The meal was $16, not bad for Vegas standards and a ton of food.

nT5AYjknDnjK1rQHRmavLQ.text: One word and that's YUCK! Wasn't impressed at all. Wanted to check out what the hype was all about. Mac and Cheese was terrible, fries were fries and the potato salad was gross. It's a total shame. Wish I would've spent this 30.00 in a slot machine or on a hand of blackjack.

9OL_uJi5zrhyVnxlBo45GQ.text: Came in on a busy Sunday to see if it lives up to Nashville. Top pics are the chicken tenders with comeback sauce and the pimento mac & cheese. Miss on the bland greens and potato salad, over salted fries plus the kicker-it's $5 for a small iced tea or lemonade with no refills had me saying what the cluck?!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ccz-3ZuJY45Oqt2NHgQA6Q.text: Hattie B's is a pretty good option if you are looking for something quick and casual.  Located in the food mall area in the Cosmo you can get Hattie's fried chicken.  I love that they have tons of flavor and lots of spice.  I usually get my friend chicken here at medium spice level and its perfect for me.  I usually get their coleslaw and mac n cheese as sides.  The coleslaw doesn't have as much mayo as other place's and the mac n cheese contains japalenos for some heat.  Yum!  As for the chicken it is usually served on toast with some pickles.  It is super juicy and the skin is extra crispy.  It comes with one dipping sauce and I recommend the Hattie special one.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3b-8LqRY4j1xTNMATW_qQg.text: Nashville chicken is all the craze back here in LA (the line at Howlin' Ray's is still 4 hour long on the weekends...what?). I thought Howlin' Ray's was decent but when I heard that Hattie B's is a must when in Nashville and it opened its first west coast branch in Vegas? I knew I had to check it out.   They recently got rid of their large white/large dark options - bummer (double thighs are always better). So my husband and I ended up sharing a mild half bird, sides of collard green + fries, and sweet tea. We really loved the marinade/seasoning. The skin was perfectly crisped and the spice was so yummy. The paired honey mustard sauce? Not needed. The sides were good but not outstanding. The sweet tea is a must. They do offer one free refill (they don't tell u or advertise it - my husband actually bought a second tea... only to see a regular asked for refill soon after).   Overall - I would say it actually beats Howlin' Ray's. Maybe Hattie B's should consider opening a branch here in LA?

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half bird mild with fries and greens
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet tea $5 one free refill
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No more large white or dark, asked and confirmed booooo

oaNgH4nSUAymepGYES2XYA.text: I absolutely loved this place . Top 3 greatest chicken places. We ordered the 2 pc white meat plates, medium heat,  with Mac & cheese , greens, red skin potato salad ( not pictured ) , and the banana pudding ( not pictured) .   The chicken was so good and tender . The seasonings on the skin were so good . The only thing that I could say is WATCH out with the heat . I love spicy things ... I put hot sauce on just about everything and the medium heat was pretty hot . The Mac and cheese was creamy and delicious . The pimento added a nice little kick to it. The greens were tender and had a great flavor to them . I normally am not a huge fan of potato salad but this potato salad was perfect . It had big chunks of potatoes and it was NOT sweet so I thought it was great . Lastly, the banana pudding was delightful . It was sweet but not too sweet and the banana flavor didn't taste artificial like the other banana puddings I have tried  .   The prices were reasonable and the food came out quick. Also, the guy who rang us up was nice. Overall , Great experience . If you're on the strip or even just looking for a good place for fried chicken ...LOOK NO FURTHER Hattie B 's is your place .

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 pc white meat plate

ZSqcrlDjUVYth5BqulvNLA.text: Holy smokes. I literally had smoke coming out of my ears as I ate the 'darn spicy' version of the chicken sandwich. Loved it! Quite possibly the best chicken sandwich I've ever had (sorry chic-fil-a)

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pcvEbDNsdGrAYglYAmFt-w.text: I've been to this location two times already, and both times a problem occurred. During my first visit, my husband and I ordered the dark meat plate and somehow, they 'ran out'! So they told us it would be a 20 minute wait for a new batch, or we could substitute for something else, such as tenders. We ended up getting the tenders, but I really wanted my husband to try the dark meat since I had had it in Nashville. The second time I went, which was in late April, they never made my order. I waited at the bar stool for quite some time, at least 15 if not more minutes. I had even asked if they called my name and they just responded no, so I waited longer. When I go up again, they search for my order and their response is, "Oh, sometimes the orders get lost." Definitely not my issue and Hattie B needs to fix their computer system if that's the case. This was my lunch before having to rush back to the airport, so waiting this long was horrible! As for the food, the fries and macaroni and cheese are to die for! If you like hot, get the hot chicken!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GgFANPl6gtRGJc26ILoaiQ.text: I may have gone a little crazy on Day 3 in Vegas, with brunch at Yardbird, afternoon snack of Hattie B's, and dinner at Bacchanal.  Out of those, Hattie B's was probably the best thing I ate that day. Chicken was super juicy (got the dark meat, of course), skin almost shattered it was so crispy, and the spicy packed a KICK I wasn't expecting.  Got a side of mac and cheese and greens - both were serviceable, but the star was the chicken.

zXkLNUMAPuapbOweMRvTdg.text: Finally had a chance to try *the* Nashville hot chicken spot. Located in the Cosmo, Hattie B's does not disappoint. I was moderately hungry but my meal was delicious and I cleaned up the plate.   I ordered the small dark (thigh / leg) and had it prepared hot. For sides, I had the coleslaw and pimento Mac n Cheese. For dipping sauce, I had the ranch which was perfect to cut the heat of the chicken. The hot preparation was just right - not too spicy but definitely packed a smoky heat that, when mixed with the oils of the fried chicken, was very satisfying. The coleslaw was actually very good and the pimento Mac n Cheese had a nice kick in addition to a creamy texture. The chicken is placed on top of a simple piece of white bread which absorbs the oils and spices of the chicken as you cut through the crispy skin.   Definitely a memorable spot and very reasonably priced as well! Look forward to trying the popular tenders next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7_O4N9ywo3tcAJoHKomroQ.text: The chicken sandwich was ok. The original location in TN is much better.  I would recommend visiting the TN location

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Chicken Thigh
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sandwich and side of Mac

Zb9tEj6oSywHe7G5HN18wQ.text: If you take one thing away from this review, know that the chickens at Hattie's are yuge. I ordered a 1/2 chicken, expecting a small Cornish hen. What they gave me can only be described as the Lebron James of chickens, the son of Zeus, an absolute unit with a full-ride scholarship to the University of Alabama. It cost $19.00 and is served with two sides. I ate half at the bar and then the other half at 3am. If you don't mind sharing food, share this with one other person.   I've only had Nashville Hot chicken on three occasions, including this meal at Hattie's. In terms of flavor, Hattie's was my least favorite among the three, unfortunately. I ordered it Hot, which is the 3rd highest on their spicy scale. I like spicy food and it was hot enough to make my nose run.  The chicken was cooked perfectly, real "crispy boys." The flavor was a little weird, though. I think they needed to change the batch of oil or something. No joke, the flavor tasted like Hot Cheetos. I wouldn't be surprised if they used that for breading. My girlfriend ordered the Southern (not spicy) and it was a better decision.  All in all, Hattie's is a good option within the Cosmopolitan and in Vegas in general. It's not the best fried chicken I've ever had, but it's far from bad. I'd eat it again.

iyNbGYx8i8RT8VR-CQc7pw.text: Nashville hot chicken is comprised of 3 components: bread, chicken, and pickle. You don't find a lot of restaurants around the Seattle area that offer this so I jumped at the chance of trying Hattie B's in Las Vegas's Cosmopolitan hotel.   I came here by myself torn between getting the sandwich or the plate. I love the simplicity of the menu. I ended up choosing the small dark - leg/thigh quarter with 2 sides. I chose pimento mac & cheese and southern greens.  I chose 'HOT!' as the spice level. It goes hotter too!! I do love some spicy food and the hot was perfect. Hot enough to feel it and make me sweat a little but not enough to make it painful. I was still able to enjoy to heat and my food.   Oh man, this is probably one of the best fried chicken I ever had. That crust was like a hard shell of spiced armor that you get to crack open to find a juicy dark meat surprise. The mac & cheese was creamy and smooth. Had a little bit of spicy kick from the pimento. The southern greens were tender and had some fatty pork bites to add flavor.  I drank a slushee of maple moonshine and amaretto to wash all of that down. A perfect meal that I would recommend to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small dark plate with southern greens and pimento Mac and cheese. Maple moonshine and amaretto slushee. @shelbyadventure

bEREIuHTMqqkT5lI3cI-cw.text: Soo amazing that we get to try Hattie B's without going to Nashville, the hot chicken craze really blew up with Hattie and they've been featured all over TV, so it was really cool to get a chance to try their chicken in Las Vegas! The Chicken is awesome, got Medium and it was perfect amount of heat. Slaw was also on point.   Can't compare with original Hattie's but as a LA native who waited in line at Howlin Rays for 2 hrs. Imo this was not as good as Howlin Rays, but it's still damn good! Really can't go wrong with spicy hot fried chicken.     I really love the fast casual food court concept at Cosmo! Easily accessible, affordable, delicious food.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1hANBjJuzNkrJJ_SvKMw-A.text: Who doesn't love some juicy fried chicken? If you want some fried chicken with a Southern flair, look no further than Hattie B's. With the amount of fanfare this place gets, I was surprised there wasn't a longer line. The service is pretty quick, although they don't provide cups of water. I would hit up a neighboring food stand to ask for water cups because you're going to need it.  The plate combinations are a great option since they come with 2 sides and a sauce. I got a large dark plate (2 pieces of fried chicken) and picked cole slaw and mac n cheese as my sides. The fried chicken here is juicy and perfectly crispy! It's strange how the chicken comes on top of a boring ol' slice of bread. After thinking about it, I believe the bread was there to balance out the saltiness because the chicken is a tad on the salty side. Hence why I said you need a water cup! The mac n cheese was delicious... so creamy! I'm a huge mac n cheese fan and I wish I ordered two sides of mac n cheese. On the other hand, I thought the cole slaw was your typical cole slaw.   The hit at Hattie B's is definitely the fried chicken and they fry it well here. It's juicy and crispy. If there was one knock on it, it'd be the saltiness. Get that water cup!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large dark plate with an extra tender

oQ_YSSxoXB6JPfmD55zmHQ.text: Located in the Cosmo.   Their spicy is spicy! Loved it. The fried chicken was tender and juicy. A bit too salty and oily after a few bites, but the bread underneath soaked it all up.   Mac n cheese and potato side were ok. After eating the chicken, I couldn't really taste them anymore.

4FMY66Z-8WAfK1fQC9k2BQ.text: I'm suuuuper disappointed in this place. I wanted to try this place on my first Vegas trip but didn't get time to. So we finally tried it on our second visit and it was just so disappointing   It's inside the cosmopolitan inside the food court place and so it's kind of hard finding a place to sit when you're going during rush times. We got 2 half bird combos and so we tried a variety of sides (mac n cheese, coleslaw, fries)   -Mac N Cheese: SO BLAND, literally felt like eating cardboard. Felt like kraft was way better -Coleshaw: it was literally cabbage mixed with water. All I tasted was water -French Fries: fries were normal, average - only side we could eat with our chickens  The chicken itself was unfortunately really bland - I expected WAY more from this place - we got the hot level and didn't feel anything - the chicken was moist - but there was not an OOOMF flavor or anything - unfortunately, just basic chicken with bad sides

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half bird

bfC0OVKW9ksuq4ahw3rtTg.text: Straight up five stars for the food and service. To be honest, I did not have high expectations for this place. It's inside a food court, albeit a fancy food court in the Cosmopolitan, that puts most food courts in the world to shame.   I was craving a fried chicken sandwich and decided to finally check this place out. I was happy I did. I went with the spicy sandwich and fries. The chicken and sauce were extremely flavorful, and the bun complimented the chicken well. The fries were a bonus, mainly because crinkle cut fries are my favorite from the fried potato family.   Major props to the gal working the register. She was friendly and patient, which I think would be hard to do. This was a Friday night, and she remained calm and cool and still had a smile on her face, even though she had to deal with a long line of customers with drunk munchies. Hats off to Hattie B's in the Cosmo.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy sandwich and crinkle cut fries.

17-UMiwIJowZKmdGx5KVJg.text: Terrible service, waited over 15 minutes when only a couple orders were ahead of me. Another 10 minute wait after they figured they blew it with no apology or anything. The wife had one bite and while it tasted ok it made her ill. Very pricey too

7J0kCVCh_IR6-x9S_5gREg.text: I give, I give. yeah, I give.  Had a the SM Dark Meat fried chicken plate, with Greens and Cole Slaw.   So glad I did..   Amazing, and so worth the wait. I had the medium hot sauce, which was perfect for me.  no to much heat, but just enough to enhance the experience.   I will have to say the Greens were amazing.  My first bite took me back to my roots, of southern comfort food. It was flavorful, and the taste of the pork in the greens was amazing. No need for any additional vinegar.   the Slaw as smooth, not bitter, and not sweet. Call it just right. Nice and crunchy, with a little savory flair.     Definitely check this place out if you can while at the Cosmo

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3gDTTd8kbo-zfnfhBegjSw.text: If you have ever tried Hot Chicken Takeover you will find Hattie B's very similar.  It's tucked into the new and very cool Cosmopolitan food court on the second floor.  The menu is very simple and easy to navigate. White or dark meat or tenders as well as different sizes.  Two sides per meal are included plus your choice of sauce.  You can choose the "hotness" level as well.    Prices seemed pretty reasonable for the amount of food and the fact that you're at a hotel on the strip in Vegas with the exception of the sodas.  $5 for a CAN of soda (not even a cup you can refill at a fountain) is ludicrous extortion.  The tenders did not look like ordinary tenders and were sort of weird, twisted shapes.  They were juicy and for "medium" they were plenty spicy though quite salty.  The "greens" and potato salad were pretty decent sides.  The greens had some sort of meat (ham? bacon?) inside which gave them a nice, smoky sort of flavor.  The honey mustard sauce was fairly standard.  The bread underneath the tenders was kind of gross and definitely poor quality.    Overall, this was a solidly decent meal but was honestly nothing spectacular.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tenders with potato salad and greens
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KZ_5wn8xrCiwd6IT4FWaVA.text: EXTREMELY good chicken - but bring your own water!   This is by far the best tasting Nashville hot chicken I've ever had. Every piece is served on a piece of white bread and topped with two pickles.   Chicken tenders are pretty steep at $3 a piece, while the fried chicken is a better deal as a plate, as it comes with sides.   While the macaroni and cheese is made with pimento cheese (not everyone's favorite) the collard greens are fantastic!   Water is $5 for a small bottle, and no tap water is available, so make sure to bring your own. (Would be 4 stars if not so pricey for a simple drink.)

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nearly $30 with a small bottle of water! 11/20/2018
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu 11/20/2018
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 11/20/2018

cWrI7llxyPs19VRc5WiYrA.text: Spice: I'm a wimp when it comes to heat and the mild had my nose running. Sauce: Not worth paying for extra dipping sauce. Honey mustard and Ranch are like what you would buy at the store. Nashville Comeback is the best, but nothing to write home about.  Sides: Fries are great, collard greens are great, but the Mac is not worth it.  Drink: Unsweetened tea is great! Note: I'm a smaller person and was full after one tender for reference on how much to order.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tenders with fries, collards, mac. Nashville comeback, ranch, honey mustard sauce.

bQ4JU7Gzw65SbEJoGRaxOQ.text: This chicken is sooooo good!! I'm not a fan of spicy food and the Mac and cheese had a bit of a kick to it but it was really good. It's a nice side dish with the chicken. Must try if your in the area. And if your wonder if the small portion is enough for 1 person, yes it is!! It's more than you think.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ijJDMXspPT8O-cYKebKgJw.text: Situated in Block 16 of the Cosmopolitan, Hattie B's, right next to Pok Pok. It was tough deciding which to go to but I already had the original Pok Pok, the decision was made. As mentioned, this place started out of Nashville.  Looking forward to it, seeing that it has the longest line of the small joints in block 16, It may have been over hyped for me.  Got in line, which didn't take too long, and got to the front. Looked at the menu and instantly knew I wanted bone in chicken (bone in is better than boneless) more flavor imo, so a small in dark meat in spicy or 2nd to the hottest with side orders of Mac and cheese and fries. My friend ordered the boneless chicken fingers in mild with fries and potato salad. Both orders with ranch on the side. During this whole event of ordering, the lady taking my order had other things in mind. We noticed she kept on talking to her coworker on the other register, no biggie, sounded as if she was training and asking questions. We tell her the first order. She turns, talks to her coworker, turns back to us, "hi, what is your order?" (Amerika). Thinking she typed it in the first time, we tell her again. She seemed to have been done putting another order in. Turns again and talks to her coworker. And what happens next, she asks for our order again. This went on for maybe 5 or 6 more times. We placed the same order three times and then the next order, the same thing. My friends and I are just looking at each other like what the f is going on here? Finally got done ordering and waited.  Didn't take too long to get our order as I heard my name being called. Walked over and noticed none of the orders had any sauce. Asked the guy cooking for some, since I refused to talk to the lady again, and he was cool about it. He looked at the receipts before giving them but it's cool, he was just making sure.  The chicken, came really breaded but stale. Seemed as if they may have left it in the fryer too long. The skin, which is my favorite, was unbreakable. Put it aside. The meat was very tender, almost too tender. Fall off the bone, Yes! But oil may have been reused too many times that we tasted a hint of that fish was maybe cooked in the fryer before the chicken? So I saved the rest for my dog. Actually the fingers also went to my dog.  Saved the day with their Mac and cheese. Noodles were perfect and it was a cheesy creamy. Crinkle fries were the best part. Seasoned and crispy. I'm not sure about the potato salad as I didn't try it or forgot to ask about it, but my friend said it was good.  Overall, was a disappointment. Maybe it might be different at the original joint or just in Nashville in general. Two stars for the sides, Mac and cheese and fries and oh I forgot, pricing isn't too bad here. Paid 50 for 3 orders and a few drinks (strip pricing). I ended up getting a beer across the way which complemented the fries.

GsbbDRRcw-JJPWu0OzwHxg.text: Gosh, how I dislike writing 2 star reviews.  I very seldom rate less than 3 stars, but unfortunately this just wasn't good enough to get the "A-OK" nod.  We were so excited to try Hattie B's after watching a few reviews on YouTube.  However, the excitement quickly phased into regret once we began eating.  My wife & I each ordered a Small Dark plate (1 = Mild & 1 = Medium).  The Mild had 0 flavor was oily & slimy.  The Medium had a bland spice flavor and was also oily & slimy.    Sides were 2 Pimento Mac & Cheese (= Below Average), 1 Creamy Cole Slaw (= Average), 1 Potato Salad (= Average), an order of Crinkle Cut Fries (= Good) for the little guy & a couple of each of the sauces (Ranch = Terrible - Blue Cheese = Terrible - Honey Mustard = Average + - Nashville Comeback Sauce = Honestly Don't Remember).  The sauces are pre-packaged and taste like it.  To be fair, I need to note, we liked the chicken better when eaten on the bread with the pickle.  The slime factor was reduced when eating it that way.    So, if we go back, which we probably won't since there's a few thousand places we've yet to try in Vegas, we'll get a Chicken Sandwich.

LxZMcMhbiRPdyHuOSRNreQ.text: Wonderful place to get awesome fried chicken. I chose the mild which was plenty spicy for me. The mac and cheese was so yummy and the greens were perfectly seasoned. Our new "go to" for fried chicken in Vegas.

3Yp1sGkF5Uq752RDLZ5ocg.text: We walked by and spotted the infamous Hattie B's Hot Chicken. It was a nice surprise since I didn't know their was one in Vegas and have heard about this place a lot from friends who visit Nashville and people on the internet who claims it's the best hot chicken in Nashville from people who live there. I tell my friends about all the stuff I've heard about this place and they are down to try it out too.  Looking at the menu, everything looked good, but had to go with the fried chicken, not the sandwich the first trip, so I opted for the dark meat. I asked about the heat levels and the cashier said that all the heat levels are probably one heat higher than most places would consider hot. So instead of going crazy, I went with medium heat so I could enjoy it, but also add a tender for $3 that I got SHUT THE CLUCK UP!!! so I can see just how hot it really is. As for sides, I asked her what she recommended, which she said fries and pimento mac n cheese. Instead of doing two heavy sides, I did the pimento mac n cheese and coleslaw so I can have something to calm down the heat if it really is that hot.  Dark Meat Medium heat - Damn good flavor and super juicy. This was some great fried chicken, although I wish it had a bit more meat on it. There was areas I bit into that was just breading. Also keep in mind its not two separate pieces, but both connected together. The medium heat had a good kick which was enjoyable. It was a good heat level and this is from a guy who loves hot sauces. I've taken the last dab quite a bit and can handle pretty hot, but only if it's a enjoyable flavor too, not hot for the sake of being hot.  Shut The Cluck Up!!! Tender - Damn! I cut a piece off of it about the size you would see at Costco in one of those tasting booths they have. Right off the bat you know the heat was no joke and it just builds up from there. I got the hiccups from it and ate some slaw to calm it down a bit, but still burned for several minutes. It was at that point I decided it was in my best interest to not eat any more of it. It was early into the night, we were there for the NightClub and Bar Show, about to go to the welcome party and have a long night of drinking. I feared this would either mess up my stomach and ruin the night or I would regret it later when it came out. Again I like heat, but only with flavor, and felt like it was mostly just hot.  Pimento Mac n Cheese - Ok Pimento cheese isn't exactly what I would think of adding to Mac n Cheese, but they showed me how wrong I have been. Me and my friends all agreed this was some of the best mac we have ever had. It is a must every trip from now on to Hattie B's.  Coleslaw - Let's be real here, there probably isn't going to be any coleslaw out there that someone raves about. It's good, decent, or bad. This was good slaw, fresh, slightly chilled, and a good side to go with hot chicken.   For $11 for the meal, it's pricey for a normal place, but a deal in Vegas, I honestly probably could have taken down the half bird myself or done a good job trying. I would like to try the Hot Chicken Sandwich and had several people at the restaurant rave about it to me that it's a must while we were in line. if your unsure about the heat level and want to try hotter, I recommended adding a tender for $3 and doing that at the hottest level you want to try so you don't waste your money.

BhW2oUFmKM-G-6_UnkrrmA.text: Chicken here is truly incredible. Service on the other hand is atrocious. Took 30 minutes for my chicken and wasn't even told it would take that long until I had already been waiting over 20 minutes.   Also waited forever on a long line because rather than use both cash registers, one of the cashiers thought her time was better used to count the money in the tip jar. If not for the service this review would be 5 stars easily.

0WcggCF2HfiOjbhYzdjCIg.text: This was alright. The chicken was dry but also very greasy. I got potato salad as one of my sides and while it had promise of flavor the lack of basic seasoning made it fall flat. The saving grace of my meal was the crinkle cut fries. They were perfect. I think there are better fried chicken places on the strip, try blue ribbon chicken for a perfect fried chicken.

DU5c-rnH0kHKYzfsgW3xxQ.text: I ordered the 1/2 bird hot with Mac and cheese and fries. Chicken was perfectly crispy and glad I asked fo hot and not medium as it was just perfect and not to spicy. The fries  were crispy and the Mac and cheese was creamy with a nice kick to it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NEOQ97kkox_UoqoRjQrOog.text: Best chicken sandwich I have ever had. I haven't been to the Nashville location so can't compare the two but this sandwich is soooo tasty

JoyiAgdxAe_rOuOGBuRAAg.text: Great lunch. I've always wanted to try this place and haven't made it to Nashville. I had the sandwich and Mac n cheese. The chicken is hot for sure in a great way. I'd suggest it for sure.

W5diZiPPsIh9fyjMvoxFrA.text: I walked over 60 minutes because my wife said she had a craving for fried chicken (she broke her toe the evening before). I found Hattie B on this site and it definitely didn't disappoint . Delicious, hot, perfectly seasoned...and the coleslaw was fantastic! Best value for $$ I've seen on the Vegas strip so far!

mxvprdEpQpWOn0Sq7sDEYA.text: We went on a Friday afternoon around 2PM and there was no line. The stand is located right next to Marquee and across from Eggslut. The price isn't insane considering it's Vegas and also since it's not simply just chicken, but chicken with sides.   Friend and I ordered the Hot Chicken Sandwich with crinkle cut fries to split and it did not disappoint. We got the sandwich at the medium heat level and it had our lips stinging in a good way. The heat is offset by the cool and creamy coleslaw and bread and butter pickles. The sandwich is on a soft slightly sweet bun (I think brioche) that compliments the spicy crunchiness of the chicken. The sandwich came out piping hot and the fries were perfectly crispy.   I can't wait to go back and try their spiciest level and see if I survive.

v4cj0bul0S9g4-9MvM13NQ.text: Delicious hot chicken! I'd recommend the pimento mac and cheese as a side any day!

1Z08ayrA16f5xC4gW1FUvA.text: Excellent!! Definitely lives up to the hype and did not disappoint!!  I'm in Vegas for a conference and as I was researching restaurants to try, I saw that Hattie Bs was now here!! I about lost my mind!   I decided that when I got to town, it would be my first stop after my hotel. Luckily I was staying at The Bellagio next door, so it was a five minute walk for me.  The counter woman was super nice and pleasant. Menu is not complicated. I ordered the large combo which was supposed to be two leg/thigh quarters and two sides.  I had greens and fries as my sides. I got medium spice.  The order was actually incorrect to my favor. One of the pieces was a breast wing piece.    The chicken took 5 minutes to e ready. My order was hot and totally flavorful.  The medium had just enough spice. Any hotter and I would not have been able to taste the actual flavor of the food. The greens were well seasoned and the fries had some sort of seasoned salt on them.  Overall, I give this location a very enthusiastic thumbs up!!   Also, the restaurant was kept clean. The cleaning guy came thru at least four times while I was there.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rCR4TakLebHYYNOcnpepcA.text: Very generic. The tenders are average quality. I got hot flavor and it wasn't hot. You can't customize your order. Basically I won't spend money at this restaurant again, it was my first and last time. Not worth the money. Save yourself the time of waiting and spending money.

UdjqTMM0BXVDcc1ufjXu3w.text: It's fine. I love southern and Korean fried chicken, and have been to Nashville, etc. My dining companion and I shared a half bird - it was competent for sure but nothing that compels me to return. Maybe the competition is just higher these days. In Vegas I'd pick Yardbird for overall quality but Hattie B's is still decent value relative to other choices on the strip.

MRA49UkKmwiGUXKwXj2kNA.text: Hot and tasty! Medium was just enough heat for me, hot was more than enough for my husband who gravitates towards anything with a good kick. Pimento Mac and cheese is a must! Chicken tenders are HUGE! Two people can easily split a meal here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sandwich with pimento mac and cheese.

gJWSOLZO-pubWGbqXJWKMg.text: Hattie B's Hot Chicken was so disappointing... I've been craving spicy chicken and been wanting to try this place.  Comparing to LA's Howlin Rays to this?  Definitely Howlin for sure! The "medium" chicken sandwich wasn't that great. Huge and pricey sandwich.  Not enough comeback sauce.   The pimento Mac n Cheese was alright.   Red potato salad needs more flavor and mayo  Let's get to the medium white breast and wing chicken.  I admit, chicken was juicy and good!   The people that works here needs more training or learn how to be nice and happy working at Hattie B's!  Come to Los Angeles and learn from the pros at Howlin Rays!  They'll show you customer service!! The girl at the register should be more enthusiastic instead of being so dull when taking orders   Their pretty stingy and tight on charging you extra comeback sauces! At Howlin, they hook you up with sauces cuz they know you'll be coming back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kDtnDdyPX2bM_LUsAejyAw.text: My first time having it and I loved it! I'm a chicken lover and I love spice to anything I eat! I got the   chicken sandwich spice level HOT, which was just right for me, not too spicy. You gotta eat it with the buns because it's a little to salty by itself. The slaw in it made it a little better and cools you down!

WEORGyhjxXLN-6iJdi4haA.text: If this is a slot machine in Vegas it would be called SALT we put  $27 in and we receive salty chicken, salty fries , and the greens were salt also.  Very disappointed

FpA0XVDKpi961LGNrBqF-Q.text: I'm from LA and have had Howlin Rays on multiple occasions, which they actually claim to model their restaurant after Hattie's. I had pretty high hopes coming here and I am happy to say that they exceeded my expectations! I ordered the sm white chicken plate (mild) with southern greens and crinkle cut fries. My friend ordered the same except medium spice level and with sides of Mac and cheese and red skin potato salad. In my opinion, the fried chicken was bigger, more crispier, tastier and juicer compared to Howlin's. I also liked how they also had more side options as well. The fries were of course delicious and crispy, just how I like them. Potato salad was also really good as well. If you can handle the heat, medium level will be a good level to start at. If you can't, be like me and stick with mild. All in all this was one of the best fried chicken places I've been to so I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sm white mild with southern greens and fries
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

gR23-mvJEdTDI3wWb5IWjw.text: My friend likes to eat here whenever he comes to Vegas, so I had to give this place a try!   ENVIRONMENT: This is within a little food hall on the 2nd floor of the Cosmopolitan, next to the entrance of Marquee. There's always a long line for this place! Despite the long line, the food was done super fast.    FOOD: My bf and I shared the HALF BIRD w/ MEDIUM SPICE and it was plenty of food for us. It came with bread slices and 2 sides. We were given dark and white meat. The chicken was so juicy and tender! Medium spice wasn't too spicy for us, so we could have handled the hot spice. Since we were drinking later that night, sticking to medium spice was perfect. They offer a variety of sauces but we chose their NASHVILLE COMEBACK SAUCE (made with mayonnaise, honey and their signature spice blend.) This reminded me of Raising Cane's sauce!  As for the sides, we ordered the PIMENTO MAC & CHEESE and CREAMY COLE SLAW. The pimento mac & cheese was sooo good! It had a light kick of spice to it and was super cheesy. The cole slaw was a good call since it helped lighten up our heavy meal. For dessert, we ordered the BANANA PUDDING. It was so good! I love that there were Nilla wafer on top to add texture.   OVERALL: For the quality, price (~$20), and quantity of this meal, it was very worth! The service was fast and the food was delicious. I highly recommend ordering the banana pudding and pimento mac & cheese! Compared to Howlin Rays in LA, their breading and spice flavor here isn't as good/strong but still decent enough to come back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top to bottom: banana pudding, coleslaw, pimento mac and cheese.
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half bird! Comes with 2 sides

SMVEPOV-wJlze-LC5aXKQg.text: The fried chicken here is AMAZING! I got the medium spice level leg and thigh with a side of pimento mac n cheese and coleslaw. The best $10 I've ever spent. The chicken is jam packed with flavor and each bite is super juicy/crispy. It's a little on the greasy side though. I got a grease headache after eating here, but it was totally worth it. This place is definitely a cheat meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CfL5KbpUgan9GGEiFksh5g.text: Worth $9 for dark and 2 sides.  The lemonade for $5 was hella of expensive!  Drinks on the menu had no price on it?!  Might as well order beer!  Love this place for the chicken.  This chain is from Nashiville.  Skin so crunchy, meat so tender and the hot spicy is so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious chicken, expensive drink.

rG6lb45Gu5dxVCnrMtu_wA.text: I actually got the try the restaurant in Chino Hills California. I went there twice in one day for lunch and dinner. 100%, I'm going to try the one at cosmopolitan this weekend.

bR74E2zAguqu7B3utFpdyA.text: This should really be a 3.5, but I'm rounding up and giving them the benefit of the doubt because they've only been open for a few days. I had such high hopes, but was a little let down. We got the half chicken at medium spice with a side of fries and southern greens and a sandwich at hot spice with a side if mac and cheese. The chicken was moist, but the skin could have been crispier. I noticed that the sandwich they gave us didn't include cole slaw, so I had to go back up to the counter and ask for a side of it. Not a huge deal, but also not a great sign. I mean, how do you forget one of 5 ingredients in the sandwich? Both the mac and cheese and southern greens were nothing special. They did give us a ton of fries, which were pretty good.  If you live in San Francisco, there's a Nashville hot chicken sandwich pop up called Hotbirds that is way better. Go check them out!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thigh/Leg
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breast/Wing
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sandwich with southern greens and mac and cheese.

VaFzsDz4Cusj15zNcB5y3Q.text: Excellent chicken sandwich and good value for the strip. $12 gets you a hot chicken sandwich with coleslaw/pickles/sauce and a side. Hot chicken sandwiches are some of my favorite things  to eat when done well and this one didn't disappoint. My only complaint is that the chicken ate a bit dry but all in all, I thoroughly enjoyed my experience here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot chicken sandwich

OfgodYm48OdWCTz0WKdyPg.text: Stopped here for dinner, and the chicken was fire!!  This hidden gem is located inside of the Cosmopolitan's Block 16 food court section. The menu is very simple,very easy to navigate and order. I decided on the 3 Strips and 2 sides plate which was $11. I had gotten 2 of my strips in Hot! and 1 in Damn Hot!!& for my sides,  Did Mac n cheese and fries! The price was excellent for the amount of food, i received. Now this is my only issue with this spot, and the reason i deducted 1 star. The soda was $5 for a can of pepsi. Yes you heard me right, & they dont offer fountain soda! To me this was a big let down because I knew my chicken would be spicy and I really wanted a nice soda as a compliment and to wash it down, but I just couldn't pay $5 for a 12 oz of Pepsi so if you come here stop And get you a soda before you come in. The food was excellent I really like the flavors of the chicken I don't even think the hottest one was too unbearable and the sides were really good as well this place definitely had some comeback chicken for me if I'm ever in town again this will definitely be a regular stop!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 strips Plate
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 Strips Plate $11

1gkre08MSAmYrabq7sUHHg.text: Checked out Hattie b's because we're howlin' ray lovers and had to make the comparison for ourselves. Loved that there was literally no line when we were there on a weeknight evening. Ordered ours medium spicy along with some sides and grabbed a table. Food came out relatively quickly and chicken was hot and fresh with a nice outer crunch and moist and tender interior. The spiciness was enjoyable but prefer the slightly more sweet, complex flavors of howlin' ray's. Sides were decent but forgettable, portions were a good size but priced to match, being to avoid howlin' ray's 3 hour lines is nice. Great option, nice food hall in general to go to with a group of friends since folks can enjoy different types of food in the same casual spot

f_VJDoLwdwFKODfFNl_NrA.text: Delicious, delicious, snack!  Location:  Hattie B's is located inside the Cosmopolitan inside Block 16. I love coming here because there are so many other little places to try next door and upstairs without breaking the bank.  Fried Chicken: 4/5 Not as spicy as Howlin Ray's if you've tried that. But good for people who don't like spicy. Decent portion.   Sauce: 3/5 I'm personally not a fan. The sauce tasted like a sriracha mayo it wasn't for me.   Mac'n Cheese: 5/5 FANTASTIC. Wow what a highlight. They do it right and has a nice kick.    Seating: Seating for the small area is provided just get your food and find any available seat. We went to get secret pizza upstairs and came down to eat.

W5Ko3btLY6B8Az-5eHCtIg.text: Lets just say Im a fan of spicy chicken and enjoy trying this Nashville take on things. Heard about Hattie Bs coming to Cosmopolitan and yesterday, after reading many reviews, finally tried it.   The reviews are just about correct: the meat is kinda flavorless, a lot of the meals are enough for 2 people, its really salty, the fries arent that great and its a good value for on and off the Strip.  I ordered the Tenders meal Hot to-go because i wasnt paying $7 for parking. There wasnt much of a line and theyll have you in and out in 5-7 mins. I got home and dug in. The 3 tenders are HUGE and nothing like the small three strips youll get at fast food places. The coleslaw was bland, the Ranch sauce was runny and lacked a punch and the fries were crispy but were boring! The saving grace was the chicken but even half way threw my second one i wanted water and had to call it quits. It just wasnt tasty enough to finish.   For chicken with a kick and spice i was underwhelmed. The location is great and so was service, but the food didnt carry the hype. I tried Daves Hot Chicken in LA and that has this place beat. I suppose its just something about the spice blend that makes or breaks Nashville Hot Chicken.   I would only go back to Hattie Bs to try the bone-in chicken options and thats about it. There are about 6 other food options at this Urban Food Hall and they are also on my list to try.

BEcaFYkXDKaaFK3mjaZuRA.text: A real good Nashville Hot chicken sandwich.  Not the best I have had but I could eat this every week. Good job folks.

ATM-P2rUAlQ6X9MiLtk5Ww.text: I just stumbled into this while exploring the Cosmo. I just had a friend saying they were going to try the famous Hattie B's in Tennessee on their upcoming vacation, so was thrilled I could give it a go myself.  I'm not really a prolific friend chicken eater and am a rube when it comes to "hot chicken" having never had it before. I got the the "hot" level. They warned me to perhaps go down a level, I'm assuming people complain it's too hot. But I found it just right here. It was spicy enough to sweat, but not novelty level spicy. The chicken itself was moist. The breading was crisp. My only complaint was that maybe it was a bit too greasy and salty, but then again that might be exactly what people want. I wasn't drunk at the time, but if I was I think I might have said it's the exact right amount of grease and salt.   I got pimento cheese mac and coleslaw for the sides. Pimento cheese is a bit foreign to me. A lot of times mac and cheese at southern places is disappointing. It rarely seems to be made with high quality cheese and based on a roux/bechamel and such. And okay, pimento cheese is not really high quality cheese. . .but something about it worked. It felt like a much higher quality version of the boxed mac & cheese we grew up on. It wasn't gourmet, but it was still way better than most mac & cheese one gets at a casual place.   So yeah, I have no idea how this compares to the "real" Hattie B's original location or other hot chicken joints. But it did the job and felt like a good value while roaming around on the strip. . .the chicken strip. Sorry, that was a terrible dad joke. Probably not even as good as a dad joke. But I never hit backspace when writing these things. I just babble and babble until I feel like stopping babbling. . .

_4268AWsfwtr_8Jls5yIJw.text: After the huge deception that was Yardbird, we needed to get some good fried chicken... and this was just the place! I had a fried chicken sandwich and everything about it was perfect! Clean and crispy chicken, cooked to perfection! The coleslaw was amazing, the red potato salad was super good too! Order extra pickles! I will be back next time I come to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vYhLqb1Kryu2m6liZdDgLg.text: My chicken sandwich was delicious, and so was the potatoe salad. The wait was a little long on 4th of July, but the 15 minutes in line was worth the wait. It's in a food court in the Cosmopolitan, so not a lot of seating, but that's on the hotel, not this restaurant. We squeezed in to the booth in the back at just the right time-sitting next door to the secret bar door. Funny to watch people coming by trying to find this door. But, anyway, the bread was fresh, but even the mild seasoning was a little hot for me, but it was so good, I wolfed it down. The only reason for not giving the full 5 stars is the price. For three sandwiches and drinks, it was $72. A bit much for three sandwiches, but we knew that when we were standing there. I'll definitely visit again.

AENHkurXoZRiHR31Nv2XHQ.text: I ate here during my time in Vegas. It wasn't extremely remarkable. I had a hard time finding sides without pork in them. The chicken according to the people who tried it was hot even the mild. I would also say the prices are also a little on the expensive side. I will give them another try if I return to Vegas.

TBj3ev8aPDrWBwUK1xjQxw.text: I loved the taste of the chicken. The best hot chicken I've had so far. The sides (greens and coleslaw) were also good. I was disappointed that they did not offer smaller pieces of chicken (wings), so I had to get a huge breast quarter... honestly I was skeptical and didn't think I would like it but it was delicious! The breast was well done but still juicy and well seasoned. I had some leftover and ate it cold on the road back to LA and it was still crunchy and delicious! I will definitely be a regular at hattie Bs

wjQC4TrP8J52uU7xzrfcyQ.text: Ate here a couple months ago in September, after it opened to the public. Got the hot chicken sandwich. The spice level was great, but the chicken breast itself wasn't anything spectacular. The breading was well seasoned, but the meat was bland. The pimento mac & cheese was disgusting. The pasta was so soft, it was mush.  Ate here again today. Got the small dark plus a tender. Again, the breading and spice level was great. The actual meat of the thigh and drumstick was juicy, but the taste was whatever. The tender was tasty and great. I almost think they're over salting the breading and skin, but I like salty so it was fine for me. The collard greens were yummy, and the crinkle fries were awesome (and spicy). I actually hate crinkle cut fries and tenders, so this is saying a lot.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small dark, tender, southern greens and crinkle cut fries

2_VC3Tg0ppHP-CuDudWO8Q.text: HOLY SHIT!!!! We ate here during a concert intermission. Let my just tell you.... my mouth is watering as I post this. We ordered the half a chicken with pimento macaroni and cheese and the crinkle-cut fries. We ordered medium spice level. I have no words for all the delicious-ness that was going on at our table. This chicken was so juicy and the seasoning was something I can only describe as "angels dancing on my tongue". I love pickles so those were a great bonus.. I simply cannot wait to make a trip to the Cosmo to have some more of this amazing chicken.

xFIkjr1J1bMHZrxjIuGckw.text: At Hattie B's there is no shortage of food. The sides are plentiful. You get a lot of food at reasonable Vegas prices, which is hard to come by especially on the strip. Whether you get the chicken or chicken in sandwich form, both come with the same spices. The heat isn't what you would expect, it's more of a spice dry blend instead of wet. The spice can get can get salty, it did for me at least, so I would be cautious of the the spice level. The fries were good, but a bit salty. I think they were similar spices as the chicken. I would have preferred basic salt to change up the flavor profile. The chicken sandwich was okay. I just felt the breast meat was pressed together and not a plumpy as I was expecting.

xdlXzsb70ePE0yKn4HoBxA.text: If you're coming to Block 16 for Hattie B's, keep in mind that it will have the longest line up during the weekend lunch hour. However, the line moves at a good pace. Seating here may seem limited, but if you're vigilant you'll be able to grab a spot.  For my first time here I opted for the 3 tenders. I got one hot and one mild. I only tolerate spicy foods and the mild was actually pretty spicy for me. The chicken itself was pretty good, albeit a little dry at parts. Our meal came with two sides, and we opted for the fries and the pimento Mac and cheese. The fries were seasoned, but just average. The Mac and cheese was creamy and gooey, but the pimento or any kind of heat was absent.   I also tried the sweet tea sloshy which was refreshing. It's not too too boozy. If I come again I'll be sure to try the lemonade.   Now of course people (especially those from SoCal) are going to ask: how does it compare to Howlin' Ray's? Spice is relative, but I will say that Hattie B's uses a drier rub. Howlin' Ray's coats a sauce on the chicken before the extra dry spice is sprinkled on. But if this is a battle of strictly chicken, I'd give Howlin' Ray's the upper hand.

pDDzomoKdIFj7pb1V_gPbQ.text: My chicken was WAY overcooked.  I've had Hattie B's here in Vegas, and in Nashville, so I know what it should taste like. The 2 pieces I had were way overcooked and tasted like eating spicy burned bacon. If I hadn't got the order to go I would have returned it. Not enjoyable to eat.  Also, I know Hattie's spice levels. We ordered medium because my SO was not in the mood for spicy. Pretty sure they gave us Damn Hot. Definitely hotter than "Hot!" my usual. Which made the burned flavor even worse.  The sides were great as usual. Potato salad and coleslaw were spot on.  Hey Hattie's in Nashville, please spend some time training the employees in LV as they need some attention.

u1OMF0LgrK4SP9K-2RAPRQ.text: For our two night trip to Vegas, we were only having one meal that wouldn't be at a buffet so we had to choose wisely. After having Hattie B's recommended to us by our shuttle driver and seeing all the great reviews on Yelp, we decided we couldn't miss out on this!  First things first -- the chicken is not very crispy. We were debating whether we should eat at the food hall or if we should bring it back up to our hotel room and we decided to take it back since the place was poppin', and I don't know if that affected the crispiness of the chicken. But I mean, it took like 5-10 minutes to take it back so it shouldn't have been that soggy right? So that was a little disappointing. If it wasn't for the lack of crisp and crunch, I definitely would have given Hattie B's 5 stars because everything else about it was pretty damn perfect!  Got potato salad and mac on the side which were both great. The mac and cheese was unbelievably cheesy, which is great for any cheese lover like me. I do wish the bread was toasted or something, but I guess after eating my chicken tenders I realized this place might not specialize in crispy/crunchiness? Haha. The chicken tenders were amazingly juicy and soft though. And the flavor of the chicken is great. I love flavorful things!  So all in all, I would definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a quick meal, or maybe looking to save your money for other things in Vegas. Also located in a pretty convenient area if you ask me.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 tenders plate with an extra tender, potato salad + mac and cheese on the side -- takeout, ~$17

e-DpHThkZAHbaJ7ydJTCdg.text: Was pretty excited to try the famous Hattie B's after having converted into a die-hard hot chicken fan after having tried numerous spots in LA (the most well-known of which is probably Howlin' Rays).   So how does Hattie B's fare?  The two of us got the best of both worlds: dark meat combo and sandwich combo, with sides of their mac n cheese, cole slaw, and potato salad. All of the sides were a bit bland but not terrible. But obviously, the star of the show was the chicken - very moist pieces of chicken with crispy breading that was tastefully spiced. Spice lovers be warned - even the "Hot" level was pretty tame. Next time, I'd give their spiciest level a shot.  It wouldn't really be fair to compare it with Howlin' Rays. They're two different types of great hot chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dK3THIIQIHevjq3l_uWrXw.text: Alright so I am pretty sure I did a review for this spot when I was in Vegas a few months back. Maybe I didn't. Not sure.   Good: absolutely amazing fried chicken! Great amount of spice. I really with we had one of these in Houston! I know we have one in Dallas but come on Hattie B bring one to Houston! It would be a hit for sure!   The chicken is fried to perfection. So much flavor. The sides are really good as well.   I felt cheated when I had to pay 5.00 for a soda. Luckily this was a business mean. I should drop off one start because 5.00 for a soda is absurd lol.   The people that work here are very nice though. Also the food comes out in a very timely manner. Next time I am in Dallas I'll be sure to go to Hattie b's. Do yourself a favor and give them a shot!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KUz7iC1_YBNrLj-2rbmOXQ.text: The new Cosmo "food hall" has been something I wanted to check out but it's a bit of a misnomer. It's more of a food court with a couple of restaurants and communal seating.  Since I just visited Nashville for the first time and never quite made it to the famous Hattie B's hot fried chicken, I made the trek to the Strip to try it.  The first impression was the stench of grease. My clothes started stinking of stale oil the second I got in line to order. It's overpowering and unpleasant.  I ordered the Nashville hot chicken tenders with two sides (cole slaw and Southern greens) and an iced tea. They allow you ONE refill on your drink, so it's best to ration it out because the chicken is HOT! Hubby had the classic hot chicken plate, which is obviously the thing to order. The tenders were okay, but boring. The spice level was good and the batter was tasty, but nothing about this meal was memorable. The greens were good and loaded with ham hocks, and the cole slaw tasted freshly made. The iced tea was fresh brewed and refreshing. I don't have many complaints about the food, it was just nothing special. There are far better fried chicken places in town and if I'm going to blow my carb allowance on fried goodness, it's not going to be at Hattie B's.  Prices are high (lunch for three was about $85), and it's cutthroat competition to battle for a seat. But the food is good. This wasn't my favorite fried chicken and I won't be clamoring to return because it was nothing particularly cravable, but I'd eat here again at some point.  Getting here is a pain if you aren't staying on the Strip, making it not locals-friendly. Bummer.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tender meal. Ridiculously overpriced.

dBksmqVDeKZTfsR4rwnVOA.text: I grew up in a house where my younger brother would seek out the hottest hot sauce and drown his food it. I would sometimes try these wild sauces risking death, but somehow he was able to handle the most intense heats that I could not.  I share this with you, because the place has "Hot Chicken" in its name. If you go expecting "mild chicken" (which they do have) you're doing it wrong.  Part of the Block 16 chic food court, Hattie B's is one of a few small stands dishing out delicious food. It is not a restaurant, but the idea is you and your drunk friends could grab all kinds of food and still hang out, but instead of a food court with McDonald's an KFC, you get Hattie B's, sushi, sliders, and Cuban sandwiches.  Now having some experience with Nashville hot chicken I can confidently say this is the best Nashville hot chicken I've had and at the fairest of price points.   Chicken was super crispy even after being dunked in the hot sauce, which is where other places fall short. This was the most tender Nashville chicken I've ever had as well. The sandwich was the perfect balance of sauce, heat, crunch, creamy. Balance is the key word, the chicken was still the focal point but everything else complimented it so well.   The sides were all delicious. Because I didn't want to be miserable I got the medium chicken which still had some but not much heat to it. My wife got mild, but it just didn't have enough flavor for me. She liked it, but how do you go to a Nashville hot chicken spot and get mild chicken? If I was out with my boys I would have gone with the hot chicken. I probably could have handled it, but didn't want to risk it mid-date night. Doubt my wife wants to watch my eyes water as I shoved fried chicken into my mouth. Not the vibe for date night.  Service was A+. I hope whoever runs this spot sees this review. I wish I could coach my employees to be as great as service was last night. Friendly smile, efficient and friendly. Answered the one question I had without acting bothered or rushed. They asked for my name once and everyone used it the rest of the process. The girl exposing food caught a minor mistake before my food got to me and they addressed it quickly.  I've lived in Las Vegas for decades and there has been a dearth if affordable food on the strip until recently. There still aren't a lot of options, but it is getting better. Hattie B's comes in clutch only charging $15 for a big chicken sandwich and a side. There are maybe 5-7 places you could get that much food on the strip for under $15. If you're trying to do Vegas on a budget two people could share the sandwich and fries for lunch.   Overall, I thought the food was delicious, the service exceptional, the price more than reasonable. How do I not give it 5 stars?

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pimento Mac and cheese and potato salad.
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sandwich and fries
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mild white plate and a mild chicken sandwich with potato salad and pimento Mac and cheese.

yMwuQuSWqp-C7PJ8n72crg.text: THIS IS THE BEST FOOD EVER!!! My husband and I were going to the Eggslut and the line was ridiculous. We decided to check out Hattie Bs and Baby let me tell you something. That chicken was piping hot, the skin was perfectly crisp and I've fallen in love. I'm from Detroit and I want to write a letter to ask, NO, Beg them to bring a location to Twelve Oaks or Somerset Collection malls. It's so good, I'm thinking we'll be here for lunch again. We had the small white meat chicken plate. I had fries and coke slaw, hubby had Mac n cheese and greens.

S9qMO03BAfE1QcFfKtXl4Q.text: I love Hattie B's! The way the chicken was served and the flavor kind of reminded me of T22 Chicken Joint in Austin, TX. Similar concept: order your meat with the sides; select the spice level, and then wait for your order.  Unlike T22, which is a full service restaurant, however, Hattie B's is part of The Block 16 Food Court located inside the Cosmopolitan so it's a counter service. Place your order at the cashier and they will call your name when the food's ready.   I ordered the SM White plate and an extra chicken strip along with with seasoned fries and mac n cheese for my sides. I asked for the 'Hot' spiciness and a cup of lemonade. I have to say, it was pretty pricey but I was stoked to try the chicken anyway.  After placing the order, I walked toward the pick up counter which is located on the opposite side of the order counter. All the counter seating next to the pick up counter was available despite the difficulty of finding a place to sit pretty much anywhere else inside Block 16. Not long after I sat down, I heard my friend's name called for his order so I knew that my order was coming up. But what do you know? The girl who was calling out the order looked at the slip and started laughing before going "BELLY" and then saying something to one of the guys behind the counter about my name while laughing at it before calling it the second time without realizing that I was walking up toward her. I said "right here" and the laughing stopped. I picked up my order and went back to sit down.   Enough with that. Now let's talk about food.  'Hot!' level IS spicy! At least I thought it was spicy. My friend got 'medium' and he thought it was really spicy. The chicken was good and. The spiciness just added to the joy of eating the chicken. The seasoned fries were crispy and flavorful; and the mac n cheese was delightful.  As for hot fried chicken, Hattie B's would be one of the better hot fried chicken joints I've been to. T22 and Gus's would be some other ones you should try.   As for the workers, counter service really doesn't require a whole lot from them. Be friendly for 2 minutes while you're taking the order and answer whatever questions a customer might have and maybe try not to laugh at a customer's name?   Suggestion to management: maybe provide tap water instead of bottled water only. I mean, have you tried the 'hot!' or 'damn hot!' level of your chicken? If you haven't, maybe you should and see how much water you need to cool down your burning tongue. Or, do you really expect the customers to drop money for multiple overpriced bottle water? Because that's messed up if it's True. I know it's a business, but still.   I was tempted to rate this joint a three due to the worker making fun of my name (I wasn't offended but that's still not cool business practice) and the fact that there's no tap water provided. But the chicken is delicious and for counter service, the food is what matters so I'll let those slide.

VOoqJf3iVjZ5foA8sKDdsg.text: Everything was good here. Perfect to grab and take up to your room to eat or find a spot around the district to eat it. Chicken was hot and spicy! I got mild and it was almost too spicy for me but I am a spice whimp! The pimento mac and cheese was worthy as a stand alone meal. I even liked their crinkle fries. They have boozy ice tea slushees that might be worth a try. Would eat again!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cooking it hot

jKwgcJRs4ATnZDk6LWAwMQ.text: Having gone to multiple hot chicken places in LA I was excited to find out that there was one here in Vegas. Hattie B's is a Nashville style hot chicken place on the second floor of the Cosmpolitan where the smorgasbord style restaurants Are.   My friends and I all ordered different things, one ordered the half chicken, another ordered the sandwich, and I went with the tenders. They use a sweet potato bun with good coleslaw according to my friend who got the sandwich. I ordered my chicken tenders spicy which came with fries and Mac and cheese. The chicken was absolutely delicious! It was spicy but not too spicy to overpower the quality juicy flavor the chicken had. It was mouth watering! The Mac n cheese uses pimento cheese which was by far the best Mac and cheese I've had at a hot chicken place. I will say it's not as good as angry birdz in LA but better than the others.   The only reason it loses a star is because they don't give out cups of water with a meal. You have to buy water which is ridiculous. It's a friggin casino and bar where tons of hammered people sat by us and couldn't get water. WHACK. They serve beer and wine too but no water for the DD's.

gWMi13VCsEO4JxwXjKmxow.text: I was looking to try some good fried chicken and I picked the right spot for sure. From the pictures, I didn't know that this would be a food-court type situation. I tried to call ahead and order takeout but they only do in-person orders. No big deal really. I arrived here on Sunday around 7pm and there was a line of maybe 10 people deep. It moved quickly though, ordering was fast and friendly, and my food was ready 10 min after I ordered. I got the 1/2 Bird Plate with the Pimento Mac and Cheese and Potato Salad as my sides. The chicken, y'all, was the most moist friend chicken I have ever had. I got the 'Hot' spice level and it had a decent kick. I would definitely want to try the next two spice levels to see what they're about. My spice tolerance is pretty high just fyi. The chicken definitely steals the show. And the Nashville Comeback Sauce was a tasty addition, with a nice kick as well. The sides I tried were good, nothing out of this world tbh. BUT THE CHICKEN, I will definitely order again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 Bird - Hot - takeout

rvbyssdGOdgyZ16wsjs_7A.text: Out of all the "casual" spots at The Cosmopolitan, Hattie B's is most definitely my favorite! Not only is the food fairly reasonably priced (you can get a GIANT chicken sandwich with a small amount of  coleslaw and one fairly large side for "just" $14 -- which is a deal for the Vegas strip), it's also *very* good.   I had a chicken sandwich at medium heat with coleslaw and the creamy potato salad and loved it -- even though the medium heat had my mouth burning! (If you're sensitive to spice, I suggest you either stick to the mild heat or order something like potato salad or more coleslaw to cool down the burn). The meal was delivered very quickly (within about 5 minutes of order) and was cooked very well. They don't serve fine dining at Hattie B's but what they have does satisfy!

HrlC7wsigJBAWVWouJvrNQ.text: I've been back to this place....probably at least 5-7 times now. Consistent, quick, and delicious every time. To me, there is a big difference between the sandwich and the tenders itself . Don't ask me why and I really don't even know if they use a different cut/flavoring, but the sandwich is miles better than the tenders. The sandwich was so much juicier and for the price of a meal, you get so much food. I always walk away satisfied.  I've noticed that most people writing 3-4 star reviews are talking about the tenders...so maybe I am on to something here?   I always get mild and even the mild is hot enough for me. I guess med and hot is for the adventurous.   My only complaint about this place is that they don't give out water. bottled water is over priced so you will want to buy a sweet tea. But THEN you're still thirsty. IDK. just come w your hydroflask.   I am secretly hoping that less people find out about this place so that the lines stay short.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xpUeL35mwb0z7WNDqGMMyQ.text: Just had some chicken and it was glorious. I ordered the half white, (breast and wing). I love Nashville hot chicken and this place has 5 or 6 levels of heat ending with Damn Hot and the hottest being Shut the Cluck Up. I of course had to get some Shut the Cluck Up. I also got one chicken tender at Damn Hot hotness. After about 3 bites I knew the heat level was real. It hurt so good. A few more bites in the sweats started and then my nose started running. That's when you know it's good.   The combo plates come with 2 sides. I got mac n cheese and potato salad. The chicken was flavorful and juicy and I loved the heat. My mouth was on fire for about half an hour and I loved it.
