Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9XH2GUb4k7n9AqxrSVypsg.text: No thanks. The hype is not real with this one and I think it's because this place is a transplant.  I had HUGE expectations. I've had a few friends who has tried Hattie B's in Nashville and all of them give high regards. Nashville Hot Chicken is sweeping the nation and back home in Los Angeles, I have a place in town that is killing in. So when I saw that Hattie B's moved into the Cosmo, my curious fried-chicken-loving heart pulsed with joy as I immediately jumped at the opportunity to try it out.   I ordered the SM White medium with an extra tender medium on the side. I picked the Pimento Mac & Cheese and the French Fries for my sides.  My god everything was BLAND, even the comeback sauce cannot save every dish. The chicken breast was dry (didn't seem like it was brined) and the batter lacked crispness (probably was dipped too long before the seasoning went on). The chicken tender wasn't crunchy and lacked seasoning as well. The medium heat level was weak, like weaker than sriracha hot sauce. If you can handle sriracha, go for Hot.   The Pimento Mac & Cheese sparked a glimmer of hope, but after your third bite, you were done with the overcooked pasta and you just want to move on. French Fries... were pretty much french fries. It wasn't tossed in any seasoning and if you didn't order the comeback sauce on the side for the fries, good luck eating plain fries.   There were some positives. The sweet tea, great! Just the right amount of sweetness. The staff is super friendly and I appreciate their patience as they deal with so many confused customers at the register. Overall, service is great, so hats off to everyone working there.   If you stumble upon Hattie B's while you here, JUST SKIP IT. Go to another restaurant in the Cosmo. If you really want Nashville Hot Chicken, then go to Nashville and maybe it would be better over there. If you are a Los Angeleno reading this, stick to Howlin Ray's (even if that line is horrendous), the Nashville Hot Chicken there is WAY WAY better.

gabTFxs4mSWj_Er_5Wax4Q.text: I was super down and excited to try this place after all the hype about Hawlin' Ray's over in Los Angeles. I may be the last person left on earth that still hasn't tried it yet.  Anyways, we got the chicken combo set in two heat flavors-- the super spicy and "what the pluck."   I actually prefer the flavor of the "what the pluck" over the super spicy. It was quite hot for me though, and I was sweating hard, trying to ration my $5 coke. I mean, I wasn't gonna pay $4 for water so i figured I'd get a soda out of it. Pretty bad move though, cuz that carbonation makes the heat fizzle inside your mouth even more, burning up the walls of your mouth. But I was still gonna get through the abuse cuz I wasn't gonna pay for no water.   Bring your thermos of cold water with you if you're gonna try their "what the pluck." I hear it is equivalent to the medium spicy chicken at Howlin Ray's. Also, no offense, but I don't know if the stinky tofu smell was wafting into my chicken and affecting my taste buds and senses, but the chicken had a slight pungent flavor.  Mac and cheese- 1 star.  Cole slaw- 3.5 stars. But 5 stars for use as a mouth cooler.  Original sauce- BOMB DIGS 5 STARs DELICIOUS . Puts the chick-fil-A OG sauce to shame by 100 points.   I think I'll go back and try the "What the Pluck" again, but a mile away from the stinky tofu restaurant. With my icey-cold Hydroflasked agua.

2OCUj8_2PHchf8pglnixYA.text: Holy Moley this was a good spicy chicken sandwich! I usually don't like sauce or slaw on my chicken sandwiches but this one was soo good, I didn't even mind. I like food that has some spice so I got the medium (second level of spicyness). It was perfectly spiced, but I needed a cool drink after! The sides we had were greens and potato salad. I love collard greens so this was great for me and they were savory not sweet (thank the Lord!) My husband had the potato salad and said it was tasty. The line is long but once you order the food comes up suuper quickly! Definitely a little pricey $17 for a sandwich and two sides. Definitely worth the price!!!

SxuTdgS_h7hd0HBwzEeauQ.text: Las Vegas is called the Entertainment Capital of the World. I would also call it the Restaurant Capital of the World. I think that many Yelpers would agree. Restaurants throughout the World are placing their pots in this culinary melting pot in the hot Mojave Desert. A recent arrival to the Restaurant Capital of the World is Hattie B's Chicken. Established in 2012 by Nick Bishop Sr. and Nick Bishop Jr., their hot chicken became a Nashville sensation. It grew to over six locations, expanded into Atlanta and very recently outside the Southeast to Las Vegas.    Hattie B's expanded into Las Vegas at the same time as the Food Hall movement took the Las Vegas Strip by storm. Upon its arrival the Eataly and Block 16 opened. Food lovers took to both instantaneously. This food lover would take to Hattie B's a few minutes short of instantaneously.    Last week Yelp led me to Block 16. On Saturday when my brother and I met up at Urth Caffe (in the Wynn), we decided to check out the new Block 16 Food Hall in the Cosmopolitan. Unlike Secret Pizza on level 3, it was easy to find. It is on level 2 which is the same level as the Las Vegas Strip pedestrian bridges. It is in the shadow of the chandelier near the night club and restaurants.    As expected Block 16 was very busy. The crowd ranged from young party goers to senior citizens. It was a mixed crowd that shared a long line. In similar style to its neighboring Block 16 eateries, it is fast-casual. The way it worked was that I ordered off the overhead black and white menu. Off the menu, I chose the chicken size, chicken cuts, type of chicken (dark, white, wings, or tenders), degree of heat, and two sides. Again, their specialty is hot chicken. If I wanted a beverage I could of ordered a Pepsi, bottled water, ice tea, lemonade or beer on tap. Upon ordering, the cashier took my name. From this vintage point, I had a clear view of the kitchen. When I walked to the other side to wait for them to call "Daniel", I took in another close up view of the kitchen. I appreciate being able to see what goes on where they make my food. From the clean presentation of the kitchen, I do not expect to be reading any negative "Eater Vegas" articles on Hattie B's.    Dissimilar to many food courts, Block 16 was extraordinary busy. Fortunately my brother and I landed nearby chairs nearby.    I ordered the two piece dark breast and wing with potato salad and fries. Coming out to $12.99 after taxes it includes two sides. To be honest, I expected it to be overrated with an underwhelming portion. I expected the portion to be so small to the degree of planning Ghirardelli for dessert. Hattie D's exceeded my expectations. Everything except the toast that I passed over was wonderfully appetizing. Every bite from the hot crusty chicken skin to the potato salad was excellence. The hot level seemed to be as hot as a Las Vegas sidewalk on an August afternoon. It was a generous portion of abundance that left me full. The one drawback was the beverage selection and prices. I was not up for a beer. They wanted $5 for a Pepsi. I was like, "Me thinks not." This food adventure marks the first time in years that I passed over drinking a beverage with my meal.    In the Restaurant Capital of the World, Hattie B's puts on a stellar culinary performance cooking Nashville Hot Chicken. To the time of writing this review, it is one of if not the best fried chicken that I have had on the Las Vegas Strip.

5oDWRd40HgsrgslU8l2nEA.text: Having been to multiple Hattie B's in Tennessee and Georgia, the Las Vegas location pales, big time, in comparison.  Namely, the chicken is not very good.  It was both dry and rubbery.   Deff not the Hattie Bs I remember.   And, the insane, high prices are just as bad.  My gf and I each had a meal (sandwich for me, tenders for her), a drink, and share a dessert, for the total of over $70.  Fast casual food should not cost this much.  Screw that.  If you're a big fan of hattie bs like we are, don't be bamboozled and fall for this location because it ain't it.

9g48zwxxRB_3NBCubnMd-Q.text: It was the best fried chicken I ever had that i wanna cry. I visited LV and fried chicken was never an option. But my husband bought it, and I wanna cry cry cry.. i kove the spicy mayonnaise. And the hot fried chicken was a real deal. My toddler can eat the mac n cheese and fries. Def would come back.

iS2s3f9Yj-3LkR6Lc1kRzg.text: Food was FIRE  !!! Had the Sm White medium hot, Max &cheese and greens. The hidden gym is inside Cosmopolitan Hotel and we were so glad we stumbled upon this place. Menu was easy and will definitely go back!

ddBJOTiOoygiWbUT31O0tg.text: This place has some pretty good chicken. If you go, expect to wait in line because it is busy. Food didn't take to long to make though. I got my chicken hot and it definitely was hot  but delicious. Everything else was just ok to me including the banana pudding. If you decide to get their lemonade mix it with their sweet... super delicious!!!

qrBMloVg-ETwjZb2a0-Ggw.text: Tastes nothing like Hattie b's?! Management please check the recipe because something got lost on the way from nashville.    If i am within an hour of nashville i fill up a cooler of hattie b's to take to our family. I lost my mind when i found out their was a Hattie's at Block 16. Got mild - seriously tasted like BK chicken fingers. Sigh.

LsLPSab5XBajKyizwwVxdg.text: Best fry chicken I have ever had m, when ever in Vegas I'm definitely having this. Don't worry about the line. Don't get it too spicy as you won't enjoy the flavor.

jRcK_qG7bq9S-7dGdN5DJg.text: Hattie B's is located inside the new Block 16 food hall inside Cosmo on the 2nd level next to Marquee, Holsteins, and China Poblano. Unfortunately did not live up to the hype for us. The one major positive I would say is the pricing of the food - downright reasonable for a casino food hall. We ordered a hot chicken sandwich (medium spice level) which was $12 and comes with a side (we choose fries but other options include cole slaw, collard greens, etc.). We also ordered a large dark (damn hot) which comes with two additional sides for $14. While the chicken was very moist, it was unfortunately very salty, which greatly detracted from the overall flavor. The medium wasn't terribly spicy, and neither was the damn hot imho. In contrast to the food, the drinks were ridiculously overpriced. The tea was $5 and doesn't even include refills. Also, they don't have cups of water, just bottled water available for purchase (a little mean if you are selling really spicy food imo). Being from SoCal, id rate Dave's and Howlin Rays as significantly better than Hattie Bs. If you're in the mood for hot chicken and are at Cosmo,this will satisfy your fix - otherwise, I wouldn't go out of my way for it.

rxx_Lqrl_ZsKQywPIOWtvg.text: This place was busy!!! The Cosmopolitan is very busy, so be mindful of traffic and parking before you even enter the restaurant. The restaurant was located on the second floor, and you have to navigate through the sea of smokers to arrive at the restaurant (this is information only - this doesn't impact my review)... On to the food...  The chicken was good - I went with the hot. I believe the spice is oil based, so it will have a bit of texture impact on the chicken. Mines wasn't soggy - still rather crispy even with the additional spice added to it. I thought the heat index was good. As others mentioned I was somewhat disappointed in the pricing. I live here - I get it, its Vegas, and you are on the strip, but we paid $20 just for 4 lemonades!  I thought that was a bit much. So when you consider value vs taste, overall I think the place is average - hence my 3 star review.

qM4Sn5KzRZ8VU7QP_olEyg.text: Cosmopolitan upped their game with Hattie B's Hot Chicken. Finally - Great Nashville hot chicken in Vegas!  Chicken was flavorful - crispy, spicy and delicious. Tried the leg/thigh quarter (medium spicy), tenders (hot spicy), southern greens and pimento mac and cheese. The chicken was juicy without being oily. The spice level between medium and hot was not dramatically different. Very reasonably priced, fast and no line either!   4 stars because although Hattie B is awesome... Howlin Rays (in Los Angeles) is better. Hattie B is the closest to Howlin Rays (I've tried so far). Howlin Rays has higher quality chicken, tons of flavor, more spice levels and is less salty. Note: Howlin Rays' "hot" spice level is much hotter then Hattie B's "hot."  While in Vegas, try Hattie B - it's definitely worth it and you don't have to wait in Howlin Rays' infamous 2+ hour line for grub.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tenders, chicken quarter (dark meat), southern greens and cheesy mac

1zcgNcwpdT765y62hgWnZQ.text: Omg! SERIOUSLY.. best chicken I've ever tasted. I had 3 chicken fingers in Mild with fries and mac & cheese. Every single bite was full of flavor! The chicken is soooo tender and juicy. They add the perfect amount of seasoning and spice. Even the sweet tea was delicious and refreshing (and I am picky about my sweet tea. Lol.) I also decided to try their banana pudding for dessert, but it was just OK. When I first got there, the place was empty but filled up quickly.   Overall, I give this place 5 stars! From the customer service, to the food, and atmosphere. I loved it and will definitely be back.

-GpU4ovl2lpjXmbBPaR57A.text: Oooooooooh Hattie B's Hell No!  Wet chicken was more like a dry chicken, made with a rub that may go Ok on some Ribs!  Was expecting a wet wipe hot wing, whole chicken experience, definitely not that!  Guess I got to leave the strip and adventure across the tracks to get a True Nashville Hot chicken experience in Las Vegas!  Oh & the coleslaw is missing a lot of some things & more.  Thanks "B" for making my Vegas Trip a memorable one, will never forgive you for that one!  Oh and that smell in the pavilion should have given me a clue!

VwwQXGL_xtgl6BAoYrD4Tw.text: Food: Not the same as the locations in Nashville.  Service: Not the same as the locations in Nashville.  Experience: Though the line here was shorter than the locations in Nashville, the hospitality was also not the same as the locations in Nashville.   Overall: I think you get the point. Food was too salty  and the "Shut The Cluck Up" spice level was not that spicy. I am disappointed with this location as it really took away from my last visit to Hattie B's in Nashville.

WWrlbRNl1mwONXakZUcmIQ.text: I like it! I've had Dave's hot chicken and howling rays in LA. I've been wanting to come to Vegas to try Hattie B's. The flavor is different from both of the chicken restaurants I mentioned. It's more mild, the cole slaw is creamy!   I like it because howling Ray is so seasoned it is so salty I cannot eat it anymore. It also is so big it falls apart after the first part.   This place has quick service and taste fine for a quick chicken sandwich bite.   5 STARS FOR THE SWEET TEA SOOO GOOOOOOD!!!

Q1gHXPqV6GpPEIkr5-vp5Q.text: The 1/2 bird is great for sharing between two people unless you are super hungry. It also comes with two sides. We went with their Mac and cheese which was delicious and they were generous with the crinkle cut fries. I would recommend mild if you have a low tolerance for spicy food. We chose medium for are spice level and that had a good kick. I ordered a single chicken tender for $3 to try their hottest spice level "damn hot". Tasted 5x hotter than their medium and left a numbing sensation around the lips which lingered around for several minutes. Their blue cheese dips helps Noneify the heat a bit. Our meal for two totaled about $22 which is cheap compared to many other options in vacation. Was at the Bacchanal weekend buffet the night before $140 for two. Half the buffet was mediocre. Will definitely swing by this hot chicken joint the next time I visit Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YiMAI5AsFV4hnYjNdgxrLg.text: Although their website says otherwise, Hattie B's does not serve gluten free friend chicken at the Las Vegas location.  I did my due diligence to see if Hattie B's had gluten free fried chicken. After finding that they did, my family waited all day long to try what everyone said was the best fried chicken ever.  Super disappointing, not to mention frustrating to find another restaurant on a busy Friday night.  Hattie B's-let's make that clear in the future.

AFk0D7je78Qi0DPLlDO3vg.text: Trust me people absolutely the best chicken tenders ever! I shared but I couldn't even eat the last tender! So flippin yummy.

Oi6RSsQ9ycMMWDUDB3tKJw.text: The chicken was good. Good flavor. Cooked well. A little oily but the slice of bread soaked it up (along with most of the spice). The sides left ALOT to be desired! The greens weren't cooked all the way and flavorless. Potato salad was dry and needed a lot more seasoning. The True insult was the banana pudding! If they're going to sell southern food then please get someone with soul in there!

tDp8i7_sz7jLj-dWKywQvA.text: The fried chicken was good. The French fries were surprisingly delicious crinkle cut fried with seasoning. The macaroni and cheese need salt or flavoring. There was more than one person could eat in the meal. I was disappointed with the sweet tea and my friend got unsweetened it tasted old like they hadn't cleaned the machine for awhile.

LlcgjoewTcO_9XOwrFKBTg.text: Chicken: juicy, flavorful and delicious   Mac and cheese: delicious if you're a cheese lover(lots of cheese, like a lot)   Fries: fried to perfection and seasoned just right   Sweet tea: save your money. $5 for 3 sips of tea that tastes like water

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tender combo + remains of my sweet tea

d8RRNDRNZuno_dS-Ibq21A.text: Food was ok, place was pretty cool being inside the casino and all. The cashier was amazing, was able to explain to us the menu. The level of hotness of their chicken. I'm a bit sensitive on the spicy, so I chose to not have any at all.

sQSNcJM7PCKU7W0u-UmXSw.text: Just the best hot chicken. Love this place. I got the chicken tenders with hot level spice and it wasn't that much heat. Next time I'll get the Damn Hot. I've had it before in Nashville. Great place and all the sides are delicious.

FGRhI4y-xor8jYwoOVwxqw.text: Hattie B's has some hot and fire chicken!   If you LOVE fried chicken, this place is a must try. My friend recommended this place, so we made a stop before leaving Vegas. I heard it's similar to Lowlin Rays in LA. Located at the Cosmopolitan hotel on the strip. They have different chicken plates combo and chicken sandwich here.   l My Order l  Small White ($10) - Breast/wing quarter, served with two sides, bread and pickles. For sides, you have the option between southern greens, cut fries, mac & cheese, coleslaw, red skin potato salad, and a la carte side. For my sides, I got the coleslaw and mac & cheese. Heat levels: mild, medium, hot and damn hot! I just went with mild. For my dipping sauce, I got honey mustard, it's bomb!   l Thoughts on Food l  This was such a great deal for the price I paid! Portions were good for that amount. I like how the sides were included in the combo! I had a large piece of chicken fried to perfection. The chicken skin was crunchy and the meat was tender. The sides paired well with the chicken combo.   l Service l  The food came out pretty quick right after we ordered. However, when I went to pick up an extra sauce, this girl who worked there stared at me and said "What do you need?!" with attitude. She made it seemed as if I wasn't allowed to pick up an extra sauce, which was pretty rude!   But other than that, my friends and I really enjoyed Hattie B's and thought it was a good price for the food. I would come back again when I'm at Cosmo!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small White + Lemonade

JBzegiLpsVJ_Chrfp611ZA.text: Absolutely love the new food court at Cosmo, so many great options! However, Hattie B's is where everyone was at, and it was my #1 choice too.   First off, the portions are big. Got the large dark chicken combo, and it was more than enough for 2 people. The chicken was perfectly fried and tender inside. Fries were decent. The pimento mac and cheese....such a pimento cheese fan and this was a treat! The noodles were way overcooked and soggy though.  For the amount of workers, it's a bit lacking...the worker who hands out the plates was MIA for a bit so I took my food from the cook.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large dark chicken combo

S5i6bVHL2cPwHRZ0ojAPcA.text: Was eager to check this place out as they are known for their fried chicken,  one my weaknesses. The place is located in the food court area of the Cosmopolitan, next to Marquee. I'm glad to see that both Pok Pok and Lardo were also part of the food options (representing Portland). The line was definitely long while waiting for the food.  They had a simple menu,  which made it easy to order. I ordered the 1/2 bird (Damn Hot) and a chicken tender. The portion size was not too bad. I liked the crispness of the chicken and it definitely did have some heat to it, but definitely manageable.  The chicken strips were also don't as they did not have a heavy batter to it. The mac n cheese was nice and simple, but flavorful.  Overall,  a pretty good place for fried chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3OUnrfnaKLKFt0JXRHgczg.text: Have been going to Vegas a couple of times a year, but hadn't found a new place to add to the regular lunch rotation in a while.  Grabbed a quick lunch here the other day and found this to be similar to the Nashville location in quality.  We both went with the chicken tenders and got mac & cheese plus collard greens.  Went with Damn Hot level of spice.  I thought they might tone it down a bit for the non-Nashville location but it sure didn't seem like it.  Mac & cheese was excellent, really creamy.  Collard greens were cooked enough but didn't get much of a ham hock or vinegary taste.  All in all you get 3 large tenders and 2 sides for $11.  In Vegas, that is a steal!  Quality is good, definitely recommend coming back here.

FvoAx2QX8CBCQ-_yNiwIdw.text: Came here on a Sunday morning a few minutes after opening and there was a short line to order. The chicken is not made-to-order so it moves very quickly since they already have pre-made/fried chicken pieces ready. We ordered the hot chicken sandwich with pimento mac and cheese and crinkle cut fries as our sides.  We got spicy level "hot" and it was decently spicy. If you can handle your spice, I recommend getting "hot" or maybe even "damn hot." The sandwich comes with a cut of chicken breast drizzled with hot spices, cole slaw, a generous amount of pickles, and their Nashville comeback sauce which is like a thousand island type sauce. The chicken is super juicy and the sauce complements it really well. I like how there was a good balance between spicy and savory.  The pimento mac and cheese was super cheesey and really good. I really liked the peppers in it, it gave it a tiny kick of spice. Definitely above average mac and cheese. The crinkle cut fries were average, they came with to-go sides of ketchup but very little.  Overall, I really liked the chicken sandwich and mac and cheese! Its a pretty fair price for hot chicken and food in Vegas. Very similar to Howlin' Rays in Los Angeles, CA but different in a good way.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot chicken sandwich
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot chicken sandwich with side of mac

dVU9qB1Cl-oyi2XCUW1NzA.text: I'd stay at Cosmo again just for the convenience of being close to Hattie B's Hot Chicken.  The fried chicken skin is so crispy, the meat is moist, and the Medium spicy level is perfect for someone wanting just a little heat. And those FRIES. Crinkle cut fries here are as good as it gets. The mac n cheese is thick, creamy and you can pick up on the bits of pimento. The potato chunks in the potato salad keep their shape. No over-mixing here. It's extremely cooling when eaten with the chicken. Just get everything!!  I did prefer the chicken alone versus the sandwich. The fried chicken stand alone is too good to hide within bread.   I didn't think the Nashville Comeback Sauce was necessary for an extra $3. It basically tasted like mayo and seasoning. Probably great and more suitable for the hottest spicy level.  Located on Level 2 in the new Block 16 food hall of the Boulevard Tower.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large dark
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large dark, fries and potato salad

JYPA96ll4jjJs6yYYWweIg.text: A shadow of its Nashville brothers...   Hot barely tickled. The chicken tasted unseasoned except for a sprinkle of cayenne. I was hoping to relive my Nashville wonderment but the chicken was sorely lacking in taste and heat. The cook on the chicken was ok, crispy but overdone (I pulled on the drumstick and the bone came out while the meat was still attached to the thigh). The fries tasted old too, barely a crisp, warmed only by the lamp. Maybe I shouldn't be ordering fried chicken with fries at 10pm and expect everything to taste fresh... Is my bad experience due to inconsistencies in the kitchen? Unlikely since all chicken is flavored using the same hot pepper and oil for a given heat level.  Hattie B's is hands down my favorite fried chicken even when compared to Willie Mae's from Nola. Unfortunately, the Vegas branch just didn't make the cut.

lxQ6UGX2EM9EgKSmtS5lKg.text: Banging Chicken!  My tastebuds had the pleasure of tasting Hattie B's hot chicken while visiting Vegas.  The Nashville based family business did not disappoint.   Great Location - 2nd level of contemporary Cosmopolitan   Wait Time - Approximately 15 minutes total (including time waiting in line and waiting for food to be prepared)  Food - My "hot" jumbo tenders were amazing.  My sides were decent (Mac & cheese & collard greens)  Price - Reasonable Prices  Hattie B's even sells bottled Fiji water (woot woot).  Service - Pleasant   I've been talking about this chicken since returning to Atlanta.  I was pleasantly surprised to learn we have a location in Atlanta  I'll be visiting REAL SOON.

SaxTO1t5sSQVc2pRzUiCaA.text: I was surprisingly disappointed. Being a southerner and fried chicken expert I was really expecting this chicken to be amazing. Firstly because the lines are always wrapped around the corner and secondly because the prices are so high. $20 for half a chicken!?! Anyways I chose that southern flavor because we don't really like spicy food and it was just ok. Not really better than Publix chicken. The service was kind and polite especially with all of the pressure of long lines but it still wasn't worth the money. I had the collard greens that needed more seasoning and hot sauces and the macaroni was really different... not sure why there was pimento I'm there. I didn't either more than two bites of either. Bottom line is I will not recommend or return to this restaurant. Follow me on instagram sweet_maloy. Thank you.

Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Restaurant
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Restaurant

v_D_iwXA5yd4ao4AUR_DZA.text: Great price point and portions! Quick tips:  1. Hattie B's is located across from Holstein's burger and Poblanos.  2. Each plate is served with two sides.  3. The hottest sauce--shut the cluck up--is made with ghost peppers and the damn hot sauce is made with habaneros.  After checking into Cosmo this past Wednesday, I walked past the urban food hall and saw that they were putting the final touches on the construction. The next night they had a soft opening for workers and they opened today!  When we arrived around 10:45, there was already a short line forming up. If you've ever been to Howling Rays in LA, then you know that there's the definite wait. However, on the plus side the wait was very manageable.  The food was very reasonably priced. I recommend getting a plate so you can try some sides too. You can get a large dark meat plate (2 legs and 2 thighs) for $14. The large white meat plate is $15 (breast and wing). They also have a half chicken plate for $17. You get to choose your spice level from mild, medium, hot, "damn that's hot," and "shut the cluck up."  The damn that's hot is made with habanero peppers and the shut the cluck up is made with ghost peppers. You should be careful with the heat and not let yourself get too carried away!! We chose the mild and the damn that's hot.  There are several sides which include collared greens, fries, coleslaw, and fries. We chose the crinkle cut fries and the pimento Mac and cheese. The chicken came on two pieces of toast to suck up the hot sauce.  The chicken was well cooked and very juicy on the inside. The skin was crispy, but seemed a little over done and a bit hard. The chicken though was very big and very nicely seasoned throughout. The damn that's hot lived up to its heat. It was face meltingly hot. According to my wife the mild was still too spicy for her. Thankfully, the inside of the chicken was not spicy but at all for my wife.  The fries were very dense and cut fat. The portion was very generous and the fries were seasoned slightly. The Mac and cheese was a big miss, we barely tasted the pimento and it reminded me more of a regular Mac and cheese you could make yourself. Not as innovative.  Overall, the price point makes this such a great deal especially in Vegas! I would definitely come again to get more next time. Hope you all have a chance to visit :)  Edit:  I forgot to add, there was one part of the service we weren't so thrilled about with the large pack comes a choice of sauce from blue cheese to ranch to honey mustard (highly recommended) and Nashville's comeback sauce. We love honey mustard so we got that and we also asked about the Nashville's comeback sauce too.   The thing is apparently a sauce is $3.00, and our order taker definitely didn't let us know when we picked two sauces. If the menu said that each dipping sauce was $3.00 we would have definitely ordered only one. If you're going to charge $3.00 for a sauce, you should really let people know that an extra dipping sauce costs that much. The sauce is in this small container, which would hardly be worth that much.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hattie B&#39;s Large Dark Plate one is mild the other is damn hot :) with pimento Mac and cheese and crinkle cut fries $14.00

wCJWjUcMZTJAFoU_pNf7Dg.text: damn good late night munchies!  i flew in to vegas after midnight...wanted to get a late night snack...the family and i walked over here (open till 2 am!) to get some chicken. we ordered the white meat plate (hot) and the tenders plate (mild) to share amongst 4 of us. ..to go. Sides ...mac n cheese x 2/coleslaw/potato salad.   kids shared the tenders (and we tasted it)...even with no heat...it was still very flavorful and moist.   we shared the white meat...spicy...OMG was it spicy! loved it (there is a step up that I hesitate to try...but i know i will next time). mac n cheese was delish!  there was a line but it moved pretty quickly ....pickup wasn't too long of a wait. Decent amount of seating (but we took it back to room)  yup...solid food....that being said...i've never been to the original locations...but this made me happy

py6lqKL4oYdNu9WfbNV2Kw.text: Hot Chicken indeed! I've heard of Hattie's after watching them show up on the TV cheering on for their Nashville fried chicken. This location is just opened a couple days ago in the Cosmo food court and I'm so happy it was the weekend I was in town. Even though it's new the wait was manageable. We came 10:45ish and there was already a line, but it went by fairly quickly.   I opted for the 2 piece dark meat chicken combo plate (medium) for ~$14. My oh my was this chicken good. The order we got had two large pieces of chicken - enough to share between 2+ people in my opinion. The skin was perfectly crispy and after the first bite I definitely felt the heat because it was seasoned really well. The chicken meat was moist and fall off the bone as well. I love how they pair it with white bread as a nice palette cleanser between each bite. Wish they gave more than 2 slices though. haha. We also ended up getting the mac n cheese & french fries for the side and they help balance the heat. The mac & cheese was nice and cheesy but not overkill with the pimento cheese. The french fries were crinkle cut and honestly you can't go wrong with potatoes.   Hattie's is in the food court so seating is self-serve/first-come so be sure you come early to grab a seat to dive into your meal.

GcGkth4G0LyGxDI8C972pg.text: I thought that the chicken here is very flavorful, juicy and I really enjoyed it! Located in the hip new food corner at the cosmopolitan. The service was super friendly and accommodating.   I would say this place is pretty similar to Howlin Rays in LA. For good food and good service, 5 stars!  However, I do admit is a little pricey for some fried chicken, but I do recommend people give this place a try!

MyW89qumGAQqbYbTy-Ag8w.text: Discovered this place via Instagram so I had to run there as fast as I could to try it out! It's located in the small food district of the cosmopolitan. I ordered the small dark plate combo for $10-11. Perfect amount for one person! It comes with a leg/thigh piece and you choose your spice level. I chose medium because I'm a wimp, but it goes up to 5 levels. Shut the cluck up is the spiciest and it's made with ghost pepper and habanero. I also ordered a banana pudding which was $6. Total price for everything came out to $17 which isn't bad at all for being on the strip. I got my food to go because I wasn't sure if there would be any seats available because it gets fairly packed.   The chicken was VERY good. It was seasoned so well and the spice level was enough for me. The plate came with two sides so I got coleslaw and pimento mac and cheese. The Mac and cheese brought on the heat as well but super good. The Cole Slaw was just there. It wasnt bad and it wasn't fantastic. The meal also comes with a slice of bread and two pickles.  The banana pudding was amazing! The crunch of the vanilla wafers were the best part.  I'm definitely coming back and I want to go up a notch on the spice level. If you like southern food then definitely try this place out! It's great comfort food and you get your moneys worth.

Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VZBmMKcWHI8eaZ3wpGrDnA.text: Mmm.. how I wish I could have given a higher rating. I found this place on Yelp and the pictures of the fried chicken looked soo good. And there was a constant line behind the counter too. Who knew. Unfortunately the chicken was quite a disappointment. It was dry and not tasty at all. But I guess you don't have much choices in Vegas if you want don't want to pay $$$$ for your dinner. Oh the alcoholic drink was good though :) albeit quite expensive, but what isn't in Vegas. Lol

k7y5Fjhf3wr9OyxLZeavoQ.text: Pros: One of the best chicken sandwiches I've ever put in my mouth.   Cons: The only American restaurant that's ever told me I couldn't have a glass of water with my beer because they only sold bottled. Also, absurdly expensive - my chicken sandwich (which came with a side) and beer was like $27. But then everything in Vegas is absurdly expensive, so...   I'll still give it 4 stars, because it really was delicious.

hRPwSc2a6cKTZq_FulTdfw.text: Now you haven't experienced life if you have not eaten this chicken. I am not sure what they put in the sauce but it's addicting. I was in the cosmopolitan hotel looking for a quick bite and I noticed the long for Hattie B's was wrapped around the corner in the block 16. I knew it had to be good, I waited about 30 minutes and it was so worth the wait.  The portion sizes are amazing the two piece was my breakfast the next day. The sauce they dip the chicken into is just out of this world, simply incredible and the comeback sauce takes it to the next level. You can choose from southern, medium, hot, or damn hot. My mouth is watering writing this review. The chicken is crispy on the outside and moist on the inside severed over a slice of bread that soaks up some of the sauce.    I wanted to try the greens but couldn't because they contained pork. Instead I had the cole slaw and the pimento Mac and cheese. I enjoyed the cole slaw but I do not recommend the Mac and cheese. To me the Mac and cheese lacked texture. I also tired the banana pudding, the banana pudding was okay to me again I felt it lacked textured and layers banana pudding typically has.   Overall Hattie B's is worth the price and the wait. You definitely get your money's worth.

6ylvcOx8EL06ozB2Ky_dNQ.text: Hattie B's was really good. I had the chicken sandwich in medium sauce. It was really good. The medium definitely had some kick to it. The chicken was seasoned well inside and out. Probably one of my top 5 best chicken sandwiches. The pimento Mac and cheese was good also. I would definitely try Hattie B's again.

6alHi-WiobHFZxxo-Hqacg.text: A for effort, but that's about it. Have not had the Hattie B's in Nashville so can't compare, but Los Angeles is blowing up with hot chicken joints, namely Howlin' Rays and Dave's Hot Chicken and sadly Hattie B's was very disappointing. I didn't like the breading, the chicken wasn't really juicy and the flavor was not there. I have gone to Howlin' Rays and Dave's Hot Chicken 50+ times so this is a fair comparison. Maybe it was a bad batch for that particular day but there is zero comparison to be made. The french fries were good however, but that's really the last thing that comes to mind when you come to a hot chicken joint.

N0L4TkqWVIjDlyAmvVUV5Q.text: Everything was good except the potato salad. Chicken was nice and crispy. Right amount of seasoning. I can't remember the mac and cheese but I do remember eating it all. Like I said, don't waste time on the potato salad.

913H5seFJMKOlzKdBs7hzg.text: I had never had hot chicken before. What a mistake! So happy this was the first place I had it because they exceeded expectations. It is one of few food joints that require a visit when I'm in town. Such juicy chicken with just the right amount of spice and great crunch. The portions are great as well. The hours and location are great as well. Can't wait to go back.

zwpG-INEHnjmYuAUufiMBQ.text: Inedible food do to salt content on chicken tender breading. The table next to us also tossed all food after one bite and verbally complained to us and others. The crinkle fries were also painfully salty and the Mac n cheese came out like warm. For $15 bucks my husband and I just tossed the food and left vs. attempting to get a credit behind a long line of other victims of this food. The chicken was also extremely large which leads me to believe it was pumped with hormones. Quality control is in order.

fgRebeMtlt7p5DBQzZSeeA.text: Too bad I was hungover and couldn't stomach much of it, but it was freaking delicious!!!! The crunchiness, the flavor, it was bomb.com. I will definitely be back. The only downfall is the location, it's hard to get into, but what isn't in Vegas? lol

5G8LChrJGmKCVRg9jXk9_g.text: If you like southern style chicken eat here. The chicken is covered in a medium thick breading that is crunchy and spicy according to the level you choose. Once you take the first bite you will notice that the chicken is very moist and juicy. I got a side of the super spicy sauce to drizzle on my hot flavored chicken and it gave it the kick I needed. Authentic.

j6AOtIycocs-usIAnU6Yyw.text: Loved the hot fried chicken here! Never been to the originals in Nashville but this definitely hit the spot! We got there at 1030am before there 11am opening. Had only 2 people in front of us! I recommend getting the medium since the hot was a little too much for me!

ueyNZnfUn779T5CzCfLvmQ.text: Excellent fried chicken . The side dishes are amazing also, I had the Mac and cheese and greens.

g4ASousXR5FHsz4Tvtvoxg.text: We saw this place on the Cosmopolitan food list and instantly was interested. The food was cooked to order and wasn't a long wait. We got the medium flavor on a half chicken and a single tender. Service was good but the three stars are based on the fact that the chicken was not that good. Once you eat the spicy skin from the chicken.  The meat itself wasn't seasoned and was pretty bland. To confirm this I went back a second day and ordered a dark plate. It was the same taste the second time. Three stars are based on good service and nice people. Good macaroni and cheese but bland chicken once passed the skin.

qtj0Gv4xWSc4opH6TvM9fQ.text: I really enjoyed this place.  The chicken is pretty spicy so go with mild if you just want a hint of heat.  Consider ordering the half bird if there are two of you.  The chicken itself was really good.

yafefTIOoMsx9c75-u6ctw.text: Really good chicken! I just wish it were a bit spicier since the other Nashville hot chicken I've had is always super spicy. I love how tender and juicy this chicken was. And you have to eat the Mac n cheese, it's soo gooey!

0HIO6wC7LG6sn2B4kln9fw.text: The food was okay.. but I'm more concerned about the fact I was charged .58 cents for a ranch after already spending 60 dollars. I don't feel as if the owners or manager would've charged me and caught an attitude about me asking why..

R8G1JyYtIoxw1ubdvqwBNg.text: Nashville hot chicken favorite Hattie B's now has a location inside the fantastic Cosmopolitan resort in Las Vegas. I have never been able to try this restaurant in Nashville because of incredibly long lines and was thrilled to only wait in a very short one to dine there in Las Vegas. I was incredibly pleased with the final product. I opted for the jumbo tenders.  The tenders were huge, much larger than those offered by other hot chicken restaurants I have visited. The hot chicken flavor was impeccable. On a future visit, I would like to move up a heat level. I opted for a conservative approach for my first visit in the hopes of not ruining my entire day. Sides were very conventional, but extremely well prepared. The fries were of the crinkle cut variety, but we're so well-seasoned that they stood out. The macaroni and cheese was similarly extremely creamy and perhaps best of all, prices were reasonable by any standard, and incredibly reasonable by Las Vegas standards. This is a must visit for me on any future trips to Las Vegas.

IEk00s_WcMyJWWUKWbgyyQ.text: Damn hot and damn tender! I'm leaving Vegas tonight but wish I had time to eat here again! I ordered the tenders, damn hot, they were plenty spicy and very tender strips of white meat. I want to try the hot fried chicken but it may have to wait until my next trip here. It will be my first stop!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h4dVdJUaMMggw5EUFad11Q.text: Still just as good as the original, maybe even better since it's here locally, saves a plane ride. Love the chicken sandwich hot with a Arnold Palmer on tap, super cool!!!

RUCFTpF2KocDHN773yoDfw.text: Sweet mother clucker.  PERfect. Fried Chicken. Crisp moist perfect amount of heat. Love this place totally worth the price and I know now why the line is alway here.

RQyoCPly9R01sXem1DbQbw.text: Nowhere near as good as their Nashville locations. Flavor is off. Plus, no baked beans on the menu... Crazy!  Found it annoying that I couldn't swap out the white meat on the 4-piece for dark meat.  Glad I didn't have to wait long in line! If you love the Nashville locations, be prepared to be disappointed.

xxEU84JBcK7hPrmxzNB-bA.text: The chicken was great! We also got the pimento Mac and cheese and the potato salads. Both were delicious.  Their sweet tea was the !  Will definitely be back the next time we're in Vegas!

t3uOjROcnavq87nNB0CS9Q.text: Chicken sandwich was great, big. Lemonade slightly bittersweet, loved it. Mac and cheese, I was really looking forward to it but was quite disappointed. Very spicy couldn't even enjoy it. Bummer. Potato salad was ok.

EcAPMoVRdG_Lng0fRYAcEA.text: Every time I have gone to eat at Hattie B's they weren't open yet.  This time, I stepped in to the Cosmopolitan right as they were opening.  Finally got to try Hattie B's.  I kept hearing how amazing their hot chicken was and I was dying to try it. My husband and I shared the small white meal.  t comes with a breast, wing, Texas toast and two sides.  We got french fries and the pimento mac n cheese. It was a ton of food! Perfect for sharing. I like a good amount of heat but not overpowering the flavor, so we went with medium heat and that was just right. The skin was the best. Tons flavor and crispy. I could eat a bowl of that skin. The chicken was on top of the toast. Some might be mad about that, but the toast soaked up juices from the chicken and made the toast even better.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium heat small white meal

nJpWXBdPXqnHqs0jR3CBrA.text: Love this chicken! The "find your own seat and pick up your own food" situation is a bit hectic in this food court area of The Cosmopolitan, but it's worth the effort. Inexpensive food but bottles of water will set you back $5 each. It IS Las Vegas after all. I didn't think the sides were anything to write home about but the chicken is moist and flavorful. I've had medium and hot so far. Both are good but not too spicy. Grab extra napkins and wet wipes and stake out your table!

0kocnoOO-8OshCkbxjArxw.text: This isn't my first rodeo when it comes to Nashville hot chicken.  Ive heard of Hattie B's but never had the chance to try it.  I'm sure the one is Nashville is better but the one in Vegas delivers.  The compact size doesn't effect the taste.  It's good and worth the minimal 15 minute wait for your order.    I got the sandwich which was on point flavor wise, crunchy and very filling. I just went medium spice level which wasn't hot at all.  The chicken also wasn't very oily like other hot chicken places.  So the flavor was a little less pronounced.  I ordered two chicken tenders on the side and they were good.  However over kill because i was full after the sandwich. The crinkle fries were also excellent and they give a lot of them!  I'm from LA and I know Howling Rays and Dave's hot chicken doesn't have roots in Nashville but I believe their recipe is better.  However, the 5 minute wait was much better the 30-45 minute wait at Howling it Dave's.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6uID_CTCUOxIw-mIBhrJCw.text: Got the SM dark meat. Unfortunately, not as tasty as the original location in Nashville. Also, the spicy level wasn't really comparable. The chicken meat itself could have used more seasoning. Was a bit bland under the coating.   Got the coleslaw and greens on the side. They were solid sides. Just wish the star of the meal, the chicken, was better.

cLkcURNRd5WVPp2xBGWWLQ.text: If you think you can handle spicy food, like I thought, don't test Hattie B's might.  I ordered the 3 Tenders Meal($12.50) with flavor level 'Damn Hot!', what I didn't know was that the cook was about to literally soak the chicken in black spicy oil and then hit it with powdered cayenne. My god...the burn; delicious  I somehow managed to eat the entire plate even though I was on fire. The chicken was fried to order, the sides were solid, the service was quick, nothing to complain about.   *Unaffiliated; I had to pound two chocolate milks immediately after to restore function of my senses

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 Tenders Meal($12.50)
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

q1mXdQSQB31cIOud2fPS1w.text: I was super super excited to try this because their hottest sauce is supposed to be ghost peppers and habanero - yummmmm!!!! However , it was NOT that hot . I know I know , I am not like most people - I enjoy hot sauce so this review is a bit biased. But if you're anything like me - an avid hot sauce eater , their hottest sauce can be passed up on. The service was great ! Overall , everything was fine . I was just disappointed because I wanted to try something extremely hot .

eYw9nfFu_sKqykRV30l2Cw.text: Newer food court has a favorite from Nashville--Hattie's! Six level of heat is presented on a limited menu. This is fried chicken--all of it. Sides are southern style, and two sides come with each chicken order. We got the collard greens, pimento mac/cheese, creamy cole slaw, and baked beans. Our friend got the big fried chicken sandwich and fries. There is plenty of food. The chicken is not heavily breaded and it's crispy, not greasy. Order at the counter and wait to pick up. They're quick. A few booths and tables are nearby. The drinks are water, lemonade or sweet/unsweetened tea. There are no sweetener packs. A few beers round out the choices. This is the real southern deal. Delicious.

8NKoP3k7KrfyHxKev2_u-g.text: Great location and even better hot chicken ! The line was pretty long but they managed to get food out rather quickly. Average pricing and actually when you compare to Vegas pricing, it's inexpensive. I got a chicken sandwich with fries and it was $13. The slim can soda was $5 ! Spices are on point and very fresh !

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slow line
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sando- hot level $14 with fries

WynXcPUZ78WUAzeGNw9XMA.text: Hattie B's Hot Chicken!  Get it while it's hot Hot HOT!  In 2017, Hattie B's was ranked sixth on The Daily Meal's list of America's 75 Best Fried Chicken Spots but this place caught my eye while watching Ugly Delicious so tada! Here we are!     Shared a Small Dark Plate [leg and thigh quarter] at mild spice with some Southern Greens and Pimento Mac & Cheese. I also got a side of the Nashville Comeback Sauce and some ranch just in case things got a little spicy. Oh man, if we weren't trying to save our stomachs for dinner, we would have ordered more. It was SO good.   The chicken was amazingly crispy. Don't be one of those types that passes on the chicken skin to be healthy. You're eating lard-fried chicken that is drenched in spicy oil, okay? The meat itself was juicy and the flavor was spot on. At mild spice, it was more than easily manageable. I think I should have gotten it medium spicy but I wasn't sure how spicy hot chicken gets and I wasn't tryna ruin my Vegas trip with my first meal of the day. The mac & cheese was creamy and basic. If I hadn't forgotten my Lactaid, I would have destroyed this side dish. The greens were stewed to perfection, although I bit more bitter than I'm accustomed to. We washed everything down with some sweetened iced teas.   All in all, I'm hot for that Nashville hot chicken! Burn me up, baby!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love me some hot chicken!
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One last look at the Small Dark Plate.
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Small Dark Plate and some tea.

oAwfzg8x6gyAC9-c0ZCpPw.text: Heard so much hype about Hattie B's, so we went there at 1am when not much else was open.    Ordered the spicy fried chicken and fries.  Omg it was so salty!  Both the fries and chicken.  The actual patty was soft and not crispy and the bun was soggy.   Hard pass on Hattie B's.

u2KsjW68haxgrinxP9XqSg.text: Nothing but great things to say about Hattie B's! This is definitely a popular spot at the Cosmo as both times I went the line was pretty long but, it moves rather quickly so you're never waiting too long. The food was delicious and the portions are huge! Nothing else to say other than I will most definitely be back next time i'm in Vegas.   P.S- I don't eat cole slaw but, my friend who does wouldn't recommend it. That's my only negative.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tenders with fries and mac and cheese
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tenders with fries and mac and cheese

8c1LpB9d7ToWVx3HyjtWmg.text: WOW. This chicken is BOMB. It's seasoned so well and the portions are big.   I wanted to come here to try the chicken. My favorite chicken spot is Howlin' Rayes in Los Angelos which is also from Nashville so I wanted to see how Hattie B's compared. Hattie B's did not disappoint! I can handle spice way more than the average person. The 'hot' was not hot to me. The 'damn hot' was just right for me. I think the hottest one would have had me crying. I wish I had tried it but I was so full off of the plate already.   This is definitely a must try when in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yhTd2GtlJRYUcC35wj35Tw.text: I saw Hattie B's on a Netflix series so it was only right to try! Hattie B's is located in Cosmopolitans's new food hall. It was ranked top 10 fried chicken in 2017 in their Nashville location. I am a fried chicken lover and try it anywhere it's offered.   I opted for the tender plate, with fries and pimiento mac & cheese. For the spice level, I was told by the cashier that mild was pretty spicy. This was spicy enough for me!  Mac & cheese was very unique with the pimiento cheese. Not the usual I'm used to but it was good! The fries were a bit stale and very salty. I went late at night so that could be why. Now for the chicken. Not the best fried chicken and I have never been to the Nashville location so I can't compare. Chicken was a little salty, not as crispy as I like but all in all it was great and prices were fair. Plates are served with your choice of sauce, a piece of white toast and a few pickle slices. Iced tea's are bottomless!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VtDdMf7p-k4wFilqaMq05Q.text: First time I had Hattie B's was in Nashville and the chicken blew me away. It was fried to perfection with the crispy crust and the flavors were beyond delicious with the right amount of heat (a range of choose from), the fragrant spices and the wonderful sauces.  So seeing Hattie B's at Vegas was like a dream come True. I ordered the small dark, which consists of the leg and thigh, with the collard greens and the red potato salad.  The interesting part about my meal was that both the collard greens and potato salad were absolutely tasty. As for the chicken, I was a bit disappointed. It just did not taste the same as what I had remembered back in Nashville. The crust was also very thick and a bit overcooked. Something was definitely off.

Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small dark chicken with side of collard greens and red potato salad.

vOTfS4WqwkY57qfj8wTGpw.text: This chicken spot is pretty bomb  If you're craving for chicken, this is the spot  expect long lines because it's that good 15-30 mins  Crunchy Flavorful Moist (not dry at all)  9/10  Not to mention that they serve Jack Daniel lemonade smoothie too :) 8/10 Great to drink it right away, once it starts melting it will be very sweet and at the bottom of the cup

8TJdCLxkjQpGq6EwVA30mw.text: In the last six months, I've been making Hattie B's a Saturday ritual. Not only am I racking up those Identity points, I'm also racking up my cholesterol.   The first couple of times, I ordered the small plates. That was too much for me, so I can't imagine what a large would do. Those are fabulous options to share between 2-4 people!  This time, we ordered a chicken sandwich with two tenders. It's a good option considering the tenders are large and the fry portion is also sharable. The spices are always adequate. I don't go above medium hot, though.   Cleanliness is always 5/5 stars. The upkeep is always reassuring.  They're open late! 5/5 stars from the night owls! The service provided by the staff either nonchalant or very friendly. I'm happy with it.   The only thing that is off-putting are the prices, 4/5. They're "strip" prices. I'm always deterred from purchasing their slushy beverages because it gets so expensive between parking and buying food.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sandwich and two tenders. Medium hot.

KNnq8oCzIqdNwBMPwPT3FA.text: HANDS DOWN THE BEST FRIED CHICKEN SANDWICH EVER!  It was sooooo freakin juicy and delicious! For about $16 you get the sandwich and a side of your choice and coleslaw. You also get to choose the level of spice for your sandwich. I got the regular spice I think? With a side of mac & cheese. I seriously loved every single bite!!! It was the perfect spice, perfect crunchyness, and it was huge. Highly recommend checking this place out.

JAQ1YyJb8FmbfZfGIbFDdg.text: I was so happy to see that they opened a Hattie B's in Vegas.  And the hot chicken here is just as good as in Nashville except without the line down the street.  I got the quarter white with medium heat.  It wasn't too spicy at all, just the right amount.  My husband likes mac and cheese but not with pimientos.  I had to remind him how he picked through it while in Nashville.  So, we ordered double Crinkle cut fries.  There was too much seasoning salt on ours so next time I would ask for the fries without.   Service was fast and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Close up of the breast and wing
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quarter White with double fries

owxPpgfzEY5zlk6Cj4RBLg.text: Wolfed down some fried chicken before heading over to Jay Chou's concert!  Allen and I came here on a Saturday around 8:15 pm, and we waited about 10 minutes before we got our food.   Pro tip 1: get an iced tea! You get unlimited refills! (ie: $5 bottle of Fiji water or endless amounts of tea?!)   Pro tip 2: Allen can handle pretty spicy food, but the cashier told us that "shut the cluck up" is too hardcore. He went down a level, and said it wasn't spicy enough. For me (someone who can barely tolerate spicy), would advise getting the lowest level of spice to flavor up the chicken a bit.   Pro tip 3: Allen and I can eat a decent amount, but after we each got a plate...it was way too much food! Would recommend splitting a plate, and then adding more chicken as needed.   We both ended up ordering platters. The menu is simple: type of chicken (white/dark, which part, and in which form) and you can just add on stuff after (ie: sides).   We ended up trying: 1) Plate: SM White ($12) x 2 // +/-1 You get a dipping sauce for free with each order! Each additional one is 50 cent more.   +1 Huge portion size! But.... -1 Chicken too dry, and  -1 The batter was flavorless unless you add some sauce to it.   2) Sides: Crinkle cut fries, pimento mac n cheese, creamy cole slaw, and red skin potato salad ($4 is the original price) // +1 Would recommend getting fries and mac n cheese. +/-1 Everything else was okay!  3) Iced tea (sweetened) // Yum! If anything, I'd probably mix it with some unsweetened, since it did get a bit sickening after 2 cups.   Service: great! Seating: a decent amount in the plaza! It was somewhat prime dinner time, so you might not be able to find a table if you come with a big party.   Overall, giving this 3.75 to a 4 because of value and service! I look forward to trying the OG one day!

Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu 2/8/19
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ad1UyXDkk5xoCmuPVYgfPA.text: Every time we go to Vegas, this is a must have. It's located in the Cosmopolitan (where all the good food is). We love the chicken sandwiches and my husband loves it real hot (that's why he married me jk). I stick to the medium which still has some heat but plenty of flavor. As for sides, you can't go wrong with their fries and mac and cheese. Their lemonade and sweet tea are the perfect drinks to wash it all down.

lhFaESC1cpQvwsXK7W26FA.text: Unfortunately I have been to Howlin Ray's in Los Angeles several times. I have to compare the sandwich to Howlin Ray's.  Hattie B's is just okay, I got the  medium heat and it had a nice kick. The inside of the chicken was bland, the outside had nice flavor and good crunch.   I stood in line at Howlin Rays for 2 hours several times, I don't think I will get this sandwich again, even if I don't have to stand in line.   If I never had a Howlin Rays sandwich, I would bump this rating up to 4 stars, but my taste buds are already spoiled, sorry.

rNIu6wP6nXrBTOZISP3_ew.text: While Block 16 Urban Food Hall currently contains five individual concepts that will eventually grow to six it would be impossible to argue any was more anticipated than Hattie B's Hot Chicken, the Nashville concept from a father and son team that has been burning up locals and tourists near Vanderbilt since 2012.  Originally visited in May 2015 and at that time already sprouting a second location despite fierce competition from nearby Gus' and Prince's, the more convenient location and classier environs of Hattie B's no doubt part of an appeal that often spawns 2+ hour lines, it is partially hidden behind District: Donuts. Sliders. Brew. that guests will notice cursive red neon signage, though in reality as of day two the line forming by 10:30 in anticipation of an 11am opening should be all anyone need see to find the place.  More focused than the original and slightly inconvenienced by a lengthy queue that runs parallel to that of District, the combination making Hattie's counter seating quite uncomfortable and thus overflowing guests to other parts of Block 16, it is after slowly progressing to the register that orders are placed with an average check for one well below $20 including two sides, Bread and Pickles.  Offering five spice levels, several Sauces plus Banana Pudding and Boozy Slushies in addition to the fried Bird and Sides it was with two 1/4 servings plus three Sides at a cost of just $21.70 that two diners dug in, the southern-style Breast and Wing possessing good crunch and complex aromatics that penetrate deep while Medium Leg and Thigh were expectedly more juicy and tangy rather than 'spicy.'  Recalling that even "Hot" was not particularly traumatizing in Nashville, a situation most certainly not the case at Los Angeles' Howlin' Rays where many visitors in line will likely draw their comparisons, it was with Bones picked clean that attention turned to Mac n' Cheese given a kick by Pimento as well as creamy Cole Slaw and Collards, the latter offering a rich porky sapor not commonly found outside the South and definitely worth checking out for both fans and those unfamiliar.  FOUR STARS:  Even when originally tasted not quite as intense as Prince's, and now likely to become a direct comparison for Angelinos who've braved Johnny Ray Zone's line, Hattie B's nonetheless offers top quality Chicken served in a manner rarely tasted in the 702, though with many Restaurants including Slater's 50/50 and SkinnyFATS recently adding versions to their menu the competition certainly seems to be warming up.

AZk9HHbls0sLtgQ7qGz4bA.text: Located on the 2nd floor of Cosmo in their food court. I'm a dark meat ONLY person and was hesitant to order their chicken breast sandwich but I'm glad I did. The chicken was moist and had a lot of flavor. I had to check it again just to make sure it wasn't dark meat :p

mHTzLbBTTVFdf3C75YhZQQ.text: YUM! This was delicious! Get in their line and be ready to feel satisfied with your decision. The servings are huge! If there's two or three people, you can share 1 meal. Seriously some of the best food I've had in Las Vegas.

2DhW1yaRpx7Ht7cgjUwErw.text: Not bad hot chicken, but I've definitely had better (Shout our Howlin' Rays in LA!!)   The chicken itself was good and the spice definitely builds so take that into account (we got the sandwich with the second to highest level of spice.)  Couldn't really get any flavor from the cole slaw and sauce though so that was disappointing. Sandwiches also come with a side so we got the pimiento Mac and cheese. Again, couldn't really get pimiento flavor in it, but still delicious Mac and cheese. Wouldn't mind hitting it up tho if I'm in the mood for chicken - servers were nice and not much of a wait!

6lSCvV5E9H_dpRSzu2ogDg.text: Welcome to one of the gems of Block 16.  Let me cut straight to the chase, we ordered the small white plate (damn hot) with Mac and cheese and fries.   The chicken was spicy but not too spicy. I actually wish I could get a little bit of sauce on the side for dipping the pieces. The seasoning definitely has a bit of sweetness to it. The chicken is moist and flavorful.  The fries are typically frozen fries. They are super salty, which I appreciated.  The Mac and cheese is great. It's super rich and like a good southern Mac should be.  The bread under the chicken is amazing once it soaks up all the flavors.  The price is really great. For a meal on the strip, you can't beat it.

64c6jBw4AOyOcA0g-zpEhg.text: Pretty good chicken... seasoned very well I loved the mac and cheese... Wasn't disappoint at all.. will go back very soon. If your in vegas go enjoy Hatie B...  The cooks were awesome friendly and helpful..

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1st time visitor, customer service was excellent.. the food reminds me of the spot in Nashville.. the mac and cheese on point.. Yes indeed

-jqY5idaLk2u9ZurBPmleQ.text: Love this place it is amazing wish I lived closer to Las Vegas the chicken sandwich and the Mac are my favorites

sqQbtI6VoxxnTYEcJf1ldA.text: HOT dang! Visiting from Dallas. I've had my share of good hot chicken. Or so I thought! If you have a collection of hot sauces, get the Damn Hot. If you easily know the difference between a jalapeno, habanero and ghost pepper, get the Shut The Cluck Up. It is FIRE. I recommend getting a dipping sauce and a beer. This is HOT chicken. Best food court meal I have ever had.

pVv9gZa61MltpWnFSj5Hxw.text: Epic chicken, a huge surprise! Went to Nashville last year and waited over an hour for this chicken (which is normal for Hattie B's in Nashville) So I was so excited to see it was here! It was exactly the same! And a 5 min wait!!!!! So happy to enjoy their food on a second vacation! You must get the lemonaid - it's homemade. And if you normally get mild make sure you get hot, it's more mild with a hint of flavor. Otherwise you get flavor with no "hot" at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half chicken mild, fries and potato salad... get Mac instead of salad.

GoJ7AQfSJRF-hNo-a_gCqw.text: This place is legit.  I came here on a Sunday afternoon and there was a few people in line already and it moved along quick.  This is my first time trying Hatties and it did not disappoint.  I order their chicken sandwich mild with a side of Mac and Cheese.  $12 for a chicken sandwich is a bit much but I understand this is Vegas and the strip premium.    The chicken sandwich was full of flavor on each bite.  The sandwich consist of their a fried breaded chicken breast with slaw and pickle between two buns.  The Mac and cheese was also really good.  Plenty of seating.  Hattie's is located in Cosmopolitan.  Recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CRON-EWXfUu8FBPipuV1bQ.text: We had the half bird, which is the breast, wing, thigh, and leg. It came with some sliced white bread and a few slices of pickles on the side. Wish there were more pickles! We had the 3rd level of spiciness, which was not bad. It was spicy, but had that numbing taste instead of burning. For sides, we had the collard greens and mac n cheese. The mac was pretty creamy. The collard greens were fine, but nothing too special. Definitely try the Nashville comeback sauce. Overall, the value is not bad for the Strip.

9wqdH9JmTRFbmdcymf8rEQ.text: SO GOOD, one of the best spicy fried chicken sandwiches i have ever had in my life... Highly highly recommend for anyone looking for a cheap casual delicious lunch.

lHZXftSsM1nMH9RzG02IBA.text: Yummy!!! Went here while in Vegas.  Their pimento Mac n cheese  is fabulous!  Also had their potatoe salad and chicken tenders.  Their portions are big size and flavor is yummy.  A deff must have.  Also their tap sweet tea is excellent!!

ooNxiJ70Db1R5WH1-LNXvw.text: A friend of mine recently had the pleasure of eating at Hattie B's in Tennessee and told us about how great it was. We figured we'd get to it some day on a foodie adventure, but later that day we discovered that there was a Hattie B's in Cosmo and it JUST opened. Naturally we decided to go see what it was all about.  Hattie B's is located on the 2nd story, the same floor as the entrance to Marquee. My girlfriend and I haven't been to Cosmo in awhile, so when we arrived, we noticed they had turned the 2nd floor into sort of a dining hall (Block 16), or sort of like a mini Anaheim Packing District for those of you who are familiar.  We ordered a large dark plate which is 2 leg/thigh quarters and your choice of 2 sides. A Nashville hot chicken visit wouldn't be complete without a sandwich, so I ordered a sandwich with their SPICIEST level: Shut The Cluck Up.  The cashier warned me that their STCU spice level is comprised of habanero and ghost pepper seasoning/spice. I decided to proceed with my decision, hopefully something I wouldn't regret later if you know what I mean.  After a few pics, we dived right into our food, but more importantly, my sandwich.  Shut The Cluck Up is absolutely spicy for your casual spicy eater. In fact, when I eat something that's REALLY spicy, I start to hiccup almost immediately. I *almost* hiccuped, but it didn't happen. The spice started off pretty aggressively and the heat began to climb, but it never really got to a point where it was unbearable. I was able to finish my sandwich without any discomfort. If you enjoy spicy, I'd say STCU would be a safe/comfortable option.  We ordered our wings in the 2nd highest spice level and it was perfect. The skin and breading was the perfect amount of crispiness and flavor. The meat itself still full of juices and flavor.  Aside from the spice level of my sandwich, the sandwich itself was really good. A good, manageable sandwich size with cole slaw and comeback sauce. Overall something you definitely want to order. It comes with a side as well.  Speaking of sides, their potato salad was pretty mediocre. It's a little on the bland side, but some might like it that way considering how Nashville hot chicken is packed with flavor and plenty of heat. It'd be a good way to cool off your taste buds if need be. Their mac and cheese though was pretty good. Slightly on the runny side, but still good.  If you're not heading out to Nashville any time soon, I'd say Hattie B's in Vegas would be a good place to start. It's pretty filling, full of flavor/heat, and the portions are reasonable for the price.

-PZPb8PCGXlmXFzzyB1Qpw.text: Best fried chicken on the Strip. Best value too, it's in basically a high class food court but prices are very reasonable especially considering it's in Cosmo. I always get the Tenders with the Mac/Cheese and the greens as sides. Delicious quality and huge portions. I'm a huge 236lb man and I can never finish it. Highly recommended this place and for breakfast Eggslut next door is delicious!

WLsrLdlSrXwYEEpdYeK4NA.text: Found this new place in the Cosmopolitan Hotel on the strip. It's in a "food marketplace" which means you order at the counter then find your own seat.   I had the fried chicken and chicken tender with collard greens, fries, and coke slaw. I loved the chicken, thought the slaw was just ok (slightly bland), and really didn't like the greens. But I won't dock for that since there are other sides to select. Chicken can come in varying spice levels. The crust was crispy and meat tender and juicy. So good!  Price: Very reasonable for Las Vegas. Perhaps $14/person.  Location: If you're on the strip around Bellagio, Planet Hollywood, etc, then very convenient.  Food: Super good fried chicken.    I'd visit here again.

iVqA581qyzsj9rF7LXcdng.text: Solid place! It's located in cosmopolitan surrounded by other restaurants (food court area). This is the only place I saw with a line so I had to try.  There were about 10 people in front of me but the line went by pretty fast.   I got the sandwich and small dark medium hot (comes with leg & thigh) with fries, mac & cheese, and coleslaw.  This was enough to feed 3 people.  The spice level wasn't bad. It's not too spicy but it does have a kick! Everything was good. The only complaint I have is that they should give you one free sauce instead of charging you!   NOTE: They don't have cups of water only bottles for sale. This might be a Vegas thing ...

H-62FXfRva6Inr3n1c_cEA.text: My husband & I were curious to try this place because of the reviews. But honestly, we were not impressed. Fried chicken, fries and collard greens were too salty. Love their mac & cheese thou.
