G1HE8ocWMMBO7cPhntiDhw.text: I loved my two visits to Hattie B's last week.   First Visit -dark meat, hot. This was the perfect amount of heat. Very moist with delectable skin.  -MAC and Cheese. Delicious, tasted homemade. -Collard Greens. Perfectly cooked, but needed more flavor or smoke.  Second Visit -white meat, hot, extremely juicy and a bigger portion than the dark. -fries, crinkle cut, fresh and crunchy. Perfection. -Mac and cheese. Just as good as first visit.  -1 chicken tender, extra hot. Couldn't eat it, too spicy. But it was huge and looked nice.  Staff was friendly and efficient. Super clean. Good lighting. A+

M7oz2nyZB0Kx4oVW6f2TQA.text: The absolute best place to enjoy top notch chicken in LV! It does not matter what you order at this place, it will be the best you have ever had, hands down! If you're enjoying a week or weekend at the best hotel in Vegas, stop by Hattie B's you will not be disappointed.

2US9BYNh5og21MbHcKXTZA.text: Chicken is very good. Besides the fries I think the sides are just ok. But excellent chicken sandwich and tenders.

2ezVJAmxyEnwiIxzB8mdNA.text: I came here on 9/21 with a party of 7. We were all really excited to try their food because we're huge fans of the few hot chicken places in LA. All of us got sick in some form, and one of us ended up in urgent care. Overall, we regret our experience and are still feeling sick a day later.

wRJf2rbh1boWxpV6NhbmHw.text: The chicken is good only if you eat it right there, the sides not my favorite the greens are over cooked, the Mac n cheese needs more flavor but this time it did taste cheesier but just still missing something, fries are fries can't complain, potato salad had been blan every time I've had it, it needs salt and pepper maybe more seasonings and herbs, the banana pudding sucks it taste like corn starch and a little banana, I've had it at least 3 times, the chicken is good and crispy. I went tonight and ate some there and took some to go and I asked for 3 boxes and 2 bags the manager didn't want to give me 2 bags and I'm walking to vadara and the bag breaks my food goes everywhere it was embarrassing and a waste of money, but if your going to eat there it's really good. The cooks were fast and cashier was friendly but the manager was being stingy with the bags my bag broke!

XI5HjFibqs17RqDednQOSQ.text: Good stuff, even the collard greens are great. I had the Damn Hot and if you have a good tolerance for heat then it is no problem, just a nice warm feeling and good endorphins floating your way. Might even next time get the shut your mouth, but we will see.

5lzgdpSMyR3c9TtKQIywXQ.text: Relatively quick service. Less line up than Nashville. The taste is still good. Chicken sandwich for the win! Hot spice is what I recommend. They were out of some sides when we went, but it was a good visit nonetheless.

akt8Lbzz7laa44uqlpOp8Q.text: Chicken was good but my fries were cold and I should have asked for more but the wait in line was too long. I didn't like the potato salad a little to firm for my taste so I exchanged it for coleslaw which needed something maybe a lil spice and/or sugar cuz it was just plain. I might be back to try some hotter chicken but I need better sides... Lemonade was good but for $5 I need a refill or bigger cup pls.

LcSPuiKBd_v2taAtxeD-dg.text: Heard about this place when I was in Nashville for work. Unfortunately I was only there for a day and didn't get a chance to eat there. I was excited to see that there's a Las Vegas location, so dropped by as I was in town for business. I ordered the chicken plate and a tender with Mac and cheese and potato salad. The chicken was mediocre. I was expecting so much more after reading about the hype for the Nashville location. The seasoning was just ok and the meat itself was fairly bland. The sides were decent. Overall, I'd say don't believe the hype.

PL4_EyHULRjAvyLOLm5aZA.text: Yes, the best fried chicken we ever had, don't miss this place if you visit Las Vegas, highly recommended.

WkKJeuGxbpa30ROe_D52CA.text: The portion was perfect and I loved that it came with two sides.  The chicken was good and juicy.  What I liked most was the Mac and cheese.

CnuTLj6iLd79geRWsbC-vQ.text: THE BOMB! Best Fried Chicken in Las Vegas, Hands Down. The Fingers are good as well but the Chicken Breast on the bone was off the charts good as well as the Wing. I got my Chicken Medium on the Spice which was still pretty spicy and had sides of Mac and Cheese and Potato Salad. All very good. The white toast under the Chicken is a nice touch as well as the sauces on the side. I didn't have the crinkle fries but next time as they looked good. I highly recommend this place as the price is right as well as you get a lot for the money. To cool down you can get a fresh donut from the New Orleans bakery next to it. Also very good.

JgQKgAfOgBV9wF6ooWKF4w.text: Honestly, this the worst chicken i have ever had in my life! Overpriced, over seasoned, and overhyped!. It is impossible to mess up chicken tenders let alone fried chicken. It was slightly under cooked and full sodium. My wife and i couldn't even finish after the first couple of bites it was so salty. My blood pressure registered stroke levels. What chicken place does not offer bbq dipping sauce??. That should have been a deal breaker from the start.   Kfc chicken tastes better and thats bad chicken. Cane's I'm sorry i betrayed you. You will always be the best chicken! Hattie B's killer chicken, literally.

rVx8PikvCHR-q5Z6f0CPaQ.text: This place really isnt anything special. The first 2 bites are good. The flavor gets old fast. The chicken has a ton of breading on it so be prepared for a comatose after. The sides were ok but again, im just not getting the hype. Honestly, if chic fil a was next to it, i would be there.

Pa7-HY-c8-Mt20CONFcEqw.text: I lived in Nashville for 3 years and we know hot fried chicken.  We also know Hattie B's.  This place is comparable with Nashville's flagship restaurant.  I love how it is conveniently located in Block 16- a high end mini food court.  I had forgotten how much food Hattie B's gives.  I got 4 chicken tenders, macaroni, fries, and a slice of bread drizzled in hot sauce.  Definitely saved some of the chicken for later!  Hattie B's is loved in Nashville- you must try it in Vegas!

iogRXPOFwS5q5qQG6OSzrg.text: Such good chicken!! Spicy, juicy and made in front of you. The pimento Mac & cheese is awesome, so creamy with a hint of pimentos on backend. Just the thing to cool off the tastebuds until you take another bite of their awesome chicken. Great west coast-ish debut!!

obxikX3J3y0vn9GmBO30JA.text: Most delicious fried chicken I've ever eaten. Great portion sizes and well priced compared to other things in the area.

cjaVtXgOkkrxO_NH2_ZKJw.text: This place has only been open a few days, so I'm hopeful that it will only continue to get better. I got the chicken tenders (medium hot) with the pimento Mac and cheese and coleslaw. The chicken was juicy and flavorful with crispy batter. The Mac and cheese was super rich and enjoyable. I knocked off a star because the ordering process was a bit chaotic and the line was super slow. At one point, the line did not move at all for almost 10 minutes. They forgot my husband's side of fries, and the seating is sparse and pretty uncomfortable. Also the "side" of coleslaw that came with my chicken was seriously about 3 tablespoons worth of slaw... so tiny it was almost funny! A word of advice, the "medium" hot was pretty spicy. I like spicy food, but I'm glad I started with medium hot - it had my nose watering and my lips tingling for half an hour afterwards. They offer a range from no spice at all to the super hot. I will be back!

jiuKDL0sguooO0DfmIhXUg.text: Not a bad choice at late night.  Strong flavor in chicken. The serving size is enough for one person. A little bit too greasy

PuRLcXReyTcU178xl8-BHA.text: $5 sweet tea!  They lost prices in the menu for food, but not drinks.  The food prices are reasonable, the drink prices are not.  Definitely misleading!  Good chicken, good sides, but questionable drink pricing and strategy hurts!

3Hza13aYzRgJ-2tZk1dC4w.text: We got the medium half bird, 1 chicken tender, fries and pimento mac and cheese. The chicken and fries were way too salty. The pimento mac and cheese was good.

_u2svbamL_nZlmxVljHY6g.text: It's about time The Cosmo got some flavor in the building. YOOOOOOOOO!! I'm about to make this short a simple. I ordered the chicken sandwich with the red sauce and the shit was fire!!

kURlg3b-lhFiRPSWqRcElQ.text: Can of soda $5 (A CAN...not even a fountain drink...a $5 can). Mac n Cheese- no flavor at all,none. Might be the worst i've ever had. Chicken was good, nice size and when they say 'Hot' they mean HOT! Fries were excellent, hot, thick and crispy on the outside. Had to go once, but no need to return.

225V7lF2lRkx-t6FTLVlVw.text: Good chicken but I have to give a less than stellar rating for multiple reasons. No one likes to be forced to over eat. I already had a recent meal and just wanted a spicy little snack, but was forced to purchase 2,000 calories worth of food. Lame. Also lame that they sell spicy food but won't give you a cup of tap water to flush it down, you gotta buy an overpriced bottle of water if you wanna cool your grill. Basically you need to spend 20 bucks. To the person in charge, please be less obvious about your desire to make money, we get it. Food was 3 stars, overall was 2. Spend your money elsewhere.

QE1eiC_zV3jaLgHieAlRlQ.text: Amazing just amazing. First time eating there I had to get the chicken tenders so I could try three different heat levels. Of course I had to try shut the cluck up, the the one below it and below that one. Didn't try mild or medium. Had a side of potato salad and fries. Let me tell you the chicken was so juicy and good. The salad was very tasty and the fries were awesome. Now I love spicy things. Shut the cluck up is super duper spicy. Had me sweating up a storm. Again, it was super duper spicy lol. The 2nd time we had lunch there was our last day in Vegas/cosmo. I opted for the chicken sandwich, OH MY GAWD it was super delicious!!! The chicken was so juicy and the piece was huge!! This time I opted for the medium level heat and it was perfect. If you're in Vegas you must try this place. If you like hot please try the shut the cluck up it will not disappoint

Va0jVG7WAHT90nGKiag_zg.text: Wish I could leave half stars, would have given a 2.5. This place is ok at best. Chicken looks the part but doesn't taste the part. Yardbird still has the best fried chicken in vegas. It is just average fried chicken. Even yardhouse's Nashville chicken is better. This place doesn't even give cups of water!

OABsJUZjJenQhe-3sCoJsg.text: The Young lady that prepared my food for takeout had a horrible attitude she was not professional and extremely rude I waited over 15 minutes after my food was prepared for to be put in a box and was told  if I didn't want to wait I can do it myself ....this was unacceptable I will never be back to this establishment.

zq2S8Wpo0Cmg2ErjWCTcbA.text: Stopped here around 3am after a long night at the club. I'm from out of town, so it was my first time here. The food was fresh (even at 3am) and service was really quick! The chicken, greens, and mac and cheese were really good and a nice size portion. Will definitely try it again next time I'm in Vegas.

ml3Bixdw3zgxx7I5g9cZtQ.text: Food was great and fresh,  just took a lot to get to being located in casino on the strip.

bsiUEeaYgRnNWr4wkuW1tQ.text: So good! The pricing is really good too! In Vegas, eating is so expensive so to my surprise when I looked at the menu I was like omg yes! Not only is it cheap, you get so much for what you're paying for. A big huge piece of chicken, a side and fries. Totally worth it. Also, don't let the wierd smell around the restaurant fool you into thinking the food is nasty. I remember when I almost didn't order because the smell from the kitchen smelled like dog food or something but I ended up ordering and it tasted nothing like that lol

f-J9DH1R7N8qDYfBnH8Syw.text: The ordering process was easy and the food came out quickly with decent portions. I ordered chicken tenders and my girlfriend got the small dark chicken. The chicken tenders were decent, but the breading became too much and the amount of sauce they give is nowhere near a good amount. The Mac n cheese was bland with  nothing standing out. The same can be said for the Cole slaw. The potato salad was decent and had a creamy texture with some flavor, but it wasn't  enough to make this meal stand out. For restaurant prices, this place felt more like a fast food establishment with how little service there is. Lastly, the sweet tea is $5 for a small cup and tastes the same as other places serve it. I'll be sticking to a local fried chicken chain instead of coming back here.

bDIYNlu2IPDN2Dn2CWp64w.text: Looking at the pictures and reviews this place was at the top of our list to try. The line was not so bad, theres a lot of other places around it so you have a lot of options. The chicken was a dry but good seasoning. The mac and cheese had no flavor to it at all. The sweet tea is the best. It nice and refreshing, just keep in mind its about one cup for five dollars and no refills. If your going to have super hot chicken give out free water and refills. I get that in Vegas you need to have the mindset of spending a lot. They wouldn't even hand out water cups. So rather buying a five dollar small fiji water go down stairs and get a free trenta water cup from Starbucks. Service is great, the ladies up front have a great hospitality. We expected way more from this place than we actually got.

7NyQ98rOpOPR2qtymQqgFA.text: Went here last night for a quick meal before our flight back to New York, probably one of the best meals we had in Vegas and hands down our favorite fried chicken ever! Portions are HUGE. We got the tenders with greens and potato salad, a large thigh and leg platter with fries and Cole slow, banana pudding, and a lemonade! We got the "hot" chicken and it was incredible, perfect spice! Wasn't a huge fan of the greens, they tasted a tad bitter to me, could have used some hot sauce, but they did have ham/bacon. The banana pudding is a MUST by far the best I've ever had. Looking forward to coming back to HattieB's.  Like I said the portions are huge, we only finished half!

oBuQKsR-_aE7jRax7AyS7A.text: Great Nashville got chicken.  Seating is Extremely limited...  a few tables are shared by ALL of the Block 16 food options.   There are quite a few counter options for seating but they feel like they are "in the way" of heavy traffic exploring the food options.  We lucked out and grabbed a table as others were leaving.  Very clean, with constant staff attention to keep the seating flow rolling.     We got the medium strips and they were hot, but tasty.  Very reasonably priced.  Glad to see additional quick grab, less formal, dining option at the Cosmo.   We will be back!

V__tTZDFUBlJW9N4zGM0FQ.text: Loved it! A bit crazy (disorganized) to get your food. Great food. Priced reasonably for the venue.

gfTZYN0aPUz2K0U3YJt4dA.text: Simply amazing! I've had Hattie B's a few times now and it is always delicious. My go to is medium chicken tenders with fries and the mac and cheese. The chicken is always on point- moist with a crunchy breading and just the right amount of spice. Must try for sure!

LxeYlQ0MBXruqJOOa6Bfkg.text: Yummy! Great flavor! Def a place to stop for a tasty treat. Delicious! One of the best fried chicken stops and price is reasonable esp in LV!

l9sMiF8yt75Wr6HBRzhsXA.text: The chicken was fantastic. I've been to the original in Nashville and for whatever reason this one had the crunch that the Nashville location was missing. Paired with a PBR this is an excellent meal.

0Iv5dRg-w1zvuy16UfKcZA.text: Last time my balls got stuck in a plate of chicken grease was when chick-fail-a came to Oregon. Bring protection

vxe6gfZQliZC-IOonNQdCQ.text: It was wonderful.  Mac and cheese was the best.  Chicken was great !  My husband got it super hot and he said he could haven gone hotter.  He loved it and so did the teenager.

b-cVTohfdIQmhLgehwbIcg.text: So only hot chicken comparison I have is Howlin Rays in LA. I was afraid it'd be too spicy since medium level almost destroyed me in LA. However I had to give it another shot so I ordered medium level here. It is nowhere as spicy in fact it wasn't that spicy.  Perhaps they reduce the heat a bit in Vegas. Anyway in comparison to Howlin Rays the chicken was as flavorful. The heat at Hattie B's comes at the end so it sneaks up a little. If I go back I'll try a hotter level and see if that makes a difference but won't be anytime soon because it was disappointing.

rzLs_i3rZ3N4rymN_sXw5A.text: I spent about 20 minutes trying to find the restaurant within the confusing Cosmopolitan Hotel on the Strip. Fortunately, it was worth searching for. In fact, I believe that was the best fried chicken I ever had.  The chicken is served in mild, medium, hot!, and damn hot! versions. I chose the hot! version. It was decently hot, but nowhere near distressingly hot. The coating was crispy, but the dark meat was perfectly cooked. One thing unique to Hattie's is that after the chicken parts are fried, they are basted with lard containing cayenne and other seasonings. I can't argue with the results of that technique.  The collard greens were nothing special, but they did their job in making me feel less guilty of eating fried chicken, with lard no less. The crinkle cut fries were decent. A hidden find was a slice of bread that was found directly underneath my chicken, which soaked up some of the grease and flavoring.

Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My leg/thigh quarter (hot) with sides of collard greens and fries. Included is a slice of bread.

ynsvF-1wtXkULhM_JI8OdA.text: I have been wanting to try "hot chicken" for a long time. I found this place on yelp and it was a short walk from our hotel. The orders come out pretty fast. There's not much seating in the area but there's some standing high tables . I ordered the breast and wing hot level. The chicken was juicy and hot! This was the best fried chicken I've had in a very long time. The Mac and cheese was ok, I didn't enjoy i

Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m0myIvafyGzCF_MO2nKZ3A.text: Hattie B makes a great addition to the trendy food hall inside Cosmo. The line can get somewhat long but don't let that deter you-- it moved by pretty fast.  I have always been a fried chicken and chicken wing enthusiast so believe me when I say that Hattie B will not disappoint you. My boyfriend got fried chicken sandwich in spicy and I got leg quarter in medium. The meat was juicy and tender which is a crucial factor when it comes to fried chicken. I got the medium which honestly wasn't that spicy. Definitely level up if you like spicy food!

sWJXP2oSt1FLz6JeK-MA1Q.text: I love hot chicken. I've always wanted to make a trip to Nashville but have never had the chance. When I saw this place in The Cosmopolitan Hotel I knew I would find a way to have a meal. Came in for lunch and ordered the hottest setting with some extra sauce, Mac and cheese, greens, and banana pudding. BE WARNED the hottest setting is NO JOKE. Be prepared. Everything was excellent, seating isn't super plentiful because of all the restaurants but if you have someone get a seat while someone else orders you should be ok.

YvK0TN9gtpIC3LBPi5QNVA.text: Great place for a quick bite to eat without the fast food feel.  It's located in a food hall so it isn't ideal for large parties. Got the fried chicken with sides of cole slaw and potato salad.  Delicious!  Loved the sides.  The fried chicken was pretty spicy.  They don't give out water, you have to buy a bottle ... so we decided to drown the spiciness with Modelo and Moet.  The fried chicken is good but definitely not one of the best.  The skin is packed with heat.  Would come back to dine here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6rGvfVX4wcwn3fpiLipogA.text: So good! Portions are huge so I suggest sharing. Macaroni and cheese is delicious.   This is located inside the little cafeteria section of the cosmopolitan. The wait was a little long but that's because there was a large to go order in front of us, but what can you do, everywhere in Vegas is busy!  They had a frozen drink I wanted to try but I was too full.

B4of3ezMuoTpoWVe81lGQg.text: Hattie b Hattie b! Delicious hot fried chicken!  Located in block 16, foodcourt inside cosmopolitan.   Fried chicken platter or sandwich?  Mild, medium, hot, or hot hot? Crispy moist hot chicken minus a thick batter. The hot is a good spice level with a kick with an additional dry spice rub on it.  I love spicy food and the hot left me satisfied, not super hot but hot enough.  Coleslaw and pickles cooled it down a bit.  Got mac n cheese as my side with the chicken sandwich, which was cheesy and comforting.  Perfect for any hangover cures, any time of the day in Vegas.

WOJpeAI4g7pxpV05cY_c-w.text: Maybe this didn't compare well with Pok Pok Wings (which we tried at the same time), but we found this chicken a bit dry and lackluster.  The super spicy wings really are spicy though, which is nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

FbrdjxKpuTyRBEbVETSTtQ.text: Get the banana pudding! Yes, Hattie B's Hot Chicken from Nashville is now in Sin City at the Cosmopolitan's new Block 16 Urban Food Hall.  I'm not a fan of spicy food at all, but you can get your chicken at a mild ('touch of heat') level here.  I opted for the 3 jumbo chicken tenders plate with 2 sides: pimento mac n cheese and red skin potato salad plus a lemonade.  The plate combo is $11 and not a bad price for a Strip establishment.  I really enjoyed the tenders served on top of a slice of white bread; they weren't dry at all and the heat level was just enough for me.  You can get one sauce to accompany your chicken.  I chose the honey mustard and I found the meal to be very satisfying.  The pimento mac n cheese is quite wonderful!  My friends ordered the banana pudding which is not something that I would normally get for myself but the version here turned me around, it's that good.  It's served with Nilla Wafers and is chockfull of banana slices, plus more crushed up wafers on top:  amazing! I would brave the Strip again for a meal here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blurry pic of the amazing Banana Pudding
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 Tenders Plate with pimento mac n cheese and red skin potato salad
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ni1TW3WX2_aNZ2kCVWlliQ.text: Its a good fix for chicken sandwiches and glad its not a long line. That mac and cheese is to die for though!  If its too spicy get the smashville lemondade if you are 21+.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JgonnL-JEtSXAr9G8ciqDA.text: I'm going to be honest, this is the absolute best fried chicken I've had. I love it! It is crispy, flavorful, and tender. They do such a great job of serving quickly, so no waiting around. The mac and cheese side is amazing as well and I would highly recommend.   I typically order the tenders, and they're huge, I always have some leftover for another meal. The entire block 16 area is cute and you order up front and find your own table to dine at.   The pricing is great, considering the strip location. Each meal is about $12. This is my go to spot anytime after a concert or show here!

qtc4XYOE5Zhw-BvN4ISDTg.text: Love Hattie B's and was thrilled to see that there was one now in Vegas! I've only had it one other time while visiting Nashville. It definitely satisfied my craving! I will say... I got the tender plate with "medium" sauce and it was still pretty spicy! I was debating on getting the "hot" but I am so glad I didn't! The tender plate comes with 3 tenders (more than enough as they are huge), 2 sides (I got French fries and Mac n cheese), and a dipping sauce (I got ranch). The tenders were delicious and so big I only ate 2. French fries were cooked to perfection and had a yummy seasoning. Mac n cheese had pimento in it and was nice and creamy. My husband got the plate with dark meat (he had one "damn hot" and "hot"), 2 sides (greens and potato salad -both good), and ranch. I would say maybe the "damn hot" was too hot and not really enjoyable for my husband (I didn't try it) as he was tearing up and sweating due to the flavor lol. He took off some of the skin/breading and it was more tolerable.  Hattie B's is located in the cosmopolitan in a little food court area. There is open seating and we had no problems finding a seat.  Overall, I would come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tender plate with fries and Mac n cheese

erMmJpnZvcGl9gnTC0hO2g.text: Was so excited to try Hattie B's since hearing they open in Vegas last year. Boy was it a big let down. Went in today around 2:30 wasnt crowded at all. The menu is different than alot of the menu's posted here on yelp from the past. Ordered two small white combo meals medium spice. Waited 10mins just to be highly disappointed. Chicken was over cooked, no flavor at all and nit even a little spice . I am from California where we have Howling Rays Nashville Hot Chicken. Which is 10 times better than Hattie's. I dont understand how a place that actually started in Nashville Tennessee was this disgusting. I will never be back again .... $30 wasted

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was so disgusting.... small white meat combo medium spice .... nasty

RFaOohPXJuDVxGFV5n4zww.text: Best hot chicken on the strip. If you want Nashville hot chicken this is the spot. Just like the places in Nashville. No long lines like the original. Sever was nice and food came out fairly quick. Mus

5BAG02rJdDrT4aLOK7BlWg.text: Just plain ole extra seasoned fried chicken with some spiciness. Wasn't worth the $25. 1star because it was fried chicken, very overrated!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L4dvxbOZiIf8CRdwMYNNUQ.text: Hattie B's is located in a food hall in the Cosmopolitan, which makes it a great choice if you're planning a meal with a lot of people with different tastes.  Our group of 7 was able to get food from a few different spots and grab a table for a Saturday lunch with no problem.  I got a tenders plate with medium spice, and sides of southern greens and red skin potato salad.  Everything was pretty tasty.  The chicken had a fair amount of spice for medium and was fried well, and the sides all went great with the tenders.  It was plenty of food, and the price was more than fair, at $11 for the plate.

7bX6GPzcWupa3C9edmhosQ.text: Fantastic fried chicken and a great price! I had the 3 piece tenders (came with two sides). For $11 and you can't beat the price for the portion and flavor!  The chicken was fresh, juicy, crispy and well seasoned! Great portion sizes for a meal here. I got the Nashville sauce which was like a spicy mayo and it was great with the chicken. For sides, I had French fries (came from a big frozen bag and then fried, so not so special), they did season them well. Also had the cold red skin potato salad which was very good. Very simple and fresh, and no egg on it!  I would eat here again for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DLnEs6SDZoQaSPBftb6EsQ.text: Let's put this into perspective: if Chick-fil-A's chicken sandwich is the standard and Howlin' Ray's is the best chicken sandwich I've ever had, Hattie B's chicken sandwich is one step below Howlin's. That still says a lot about the quality and overall delicious meal you'll enjoy at Hattie B's!   The line was about 10 minutes for us but we came at an awkward hour so expect up to a 20-30 minute line. Sandwiches took about 15 minutes thereafter to be brought out.  Wow, this is a damn good sandwich! The chicken is a thicc boy with a golden, crunchy skin and the veggies compliment the chicken perfectly. My only complaint is that for "hot chicken," there's hardly much flavor on the crispy outside. While your mouth will burst (probably into flames) with flavor at Howlin' Ray's, Hattie B's chicken goes a step in the wrong direction which their hot chicken rub. I expected a little more oomph. Still though, claps all around.

Rkaqt479hJ8IVhDMIVb47g.text: Where you going to find enough fried chicken to place on this here table?  No I wasn't an improvisational jazz player on break from my set, but I do know and love fried chicken, and Hattie's delivers some tasty bird.  Forget the price, you're in Vegas.  And even if it is a bit more expensive than say, KFC or El Pollo Loco, it is better, and it is served up in the middle of a 3.9 billion dollar establishment, where you wouldn't expect to find fast food in the first place.  So just, dig in! and, enjoy.  (Sorry no pics taken, my hands were too greasy from eatin' to reach into my pocket for my phone.)  We split a half a bird with medium hot crust, which came with two sides (french fries and cole slaw) which at first the medium seemed like it might have been too spicy, but after our taste buds settled into the experience it tasted just about right (the heat comes from the battered skin only, so biting into the chicken itself allows for respite from the spice).  Although I usually prefer dark chicken meat to light, because it tends to be more flavorful and moister, Hattie's cooked our bird so well that the white meat, even the largest piece, the breast, was exceptionally good and even better than the wing or leg.  If you are a serious gambler you know that there are times, especially when you have just won a grip of money, that you get really hungry and aren't necessarily in the mood for a sit down elaborate white table cloth meal - and for these times, there is Hattie's.  Finding great fried chicken in the middle of a Las Vegas casino hotel was a pleasant experience.  So stop putting on airs! just because you are at the Cosmopolitan.  Try it!  You won't regret it.  But get plenty of napkins, and wash up well, afterwards.

MFoQ6V56PEdqcnKyXlRFIA.text: Hattie B's knows how to fry chicken right!   Block 16 Urban Food Hall opened up in the Cosmopolitan not long ago & of all the options, Hattie B's Hot Chicken's menu looked most appealing to me.   As advertised, the Hot Chicken Sandwich is indeed hot. The pickles & coleslaw provided cooling elements, but the spiciness still managed to overpower each painfully delicious bite. I tasted his crisp & juicy chicken breast, ordered with Medium heat level, & wished I'd asked for the same.   Attention to detail is paid, even in their sides. The cheese in their mac & cheese is pimento, a southern specialty. I could taste the individual ingredients that made up the fresh & refreshing red skin potato salad. Unfortunately, the crinkle-cut fries & lemonade were mediocre. A downhome southern meal wouldn't be complete without banana pudding. Hattie B's had four Nilla wafers sitting atop theirs. Those cookies bring me back to childhood, man. With a bottle of water, our bill came out to about $40.   Now I have a recommendation for when friends text me, "I'm in Vegas, know a good chicken place?!"

kTa5tTZqmWW0fcz18SKsxw.text: Really good fried chicken!! The chicken is perfectly fried. Crispy on the outside with good quality chicken on the inside. It's not overly fried at all, and is not too greasy. I had the chicken sandwich with mild heat (spice level). It was pretty spicy for a mild, but the spice is delicious. It came with a side--I tried the Mac and cheese, which was delicious. It was creamy and really cheesy with a bit of spicy kick, but not too spicy. Although on the pricier side ($14), it was a super filling meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

cyKc1YBZ9k5Q5jFVq7If3A.text: This place is so good. I recommend the chicken strips (hot) convenient location within Cosmo. I would say probably your best bet next to egg slut in that food area.

mJESfYmaz_Dn7qqWyPBM1A.text: Got the small white meat combo with the medium heat level. My sides were the Mac and cheeses and French fries. Chicken is seasoned perfectly and juicy   I've had Hattie's B's in Nashville and it was just as good as it is here in Vegas. Even if you do like hot food I wouldn't recommend getting your combo in the hottest heat level which is shut the cluck up just order a extra tender at that heat level

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shut the cluck up breast, Mac and cheese,collard greens and fries

s5dDJWb7dEYpMYdAV9FdkQ.text: This place has been on my radar for a while now.  I was very excited to find it in Vegas!  There seems to always be a line which is a good sign.  We had the dark leg and thigh medium and I added a spicy strip.  Our sides were fries and the coleslaw.    The strip was very spicy but I enjoyed the crunch and the flavor.  The leg and thigh medium was not too spicy.  It was also juicy and very flavorful.  The coleslaw helped balance the heat.    The fries are tossed in seasoning which seemed too salty and over the top with everything else.  Plain fries would have been better with the chicken.    Overall it was a really good first experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jQT1vjzcoT_gQ5c3yd20JQ.text: I am so happy to have tried Hattie B's for a  2nd time and it definitely solidified my feeling towards the brand! To begin, the food court that is on the 3rd floor of Cosmopolitan is super cute and upscale. This is the only restaurant that I have tried so far in the food court, but I will be back for a much more!   So, of course this is a newer trend of the "Nashville style" hot chicken. Of course I had to try the chicken breast sandwich in medium, I added the pimental macaroni and cheese as my side .    The chicken breast, to me, should have been more focused on being juicy, but it came off a bit drier with many tough chews and salty in Medium. (3.5/5)   The pimento Mac was delicious, spicier than the chicken in Medium and they perfect compliment with creaminess! This saved my meal. (5/5)   The person that I was with tried both and he ate most of the macaroni and cheese but only took one by of the chicken.   Since chicken breast can be a little bit drier, I'll definitely be back in try the dark meat in mild and my favorite dessert , banana pudding!  Price: 4/5 Ambience: 4/5 Food: 4/5

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken breast sandwich , pimento cheese mac, and a local brew!
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simple Menu

-NLOkgl1hRNjvi_q9sJ0jQ.text: Located in the food court area on the 2nd level of the Cosmopolitan hotel casino.  Situated with several other grab n go places.  There is seating in the immediate area.  Our family loves fried chicken so another mental note made during our recent visit to Las Vegas.  We decided to come for dinner around 6pm.  Ordered: *1 order of dark meat - drumstick & thigh that comes with choice of two sides & *2 orders of the 1/2 whole chicken with choice of two sides.  Select the heat level = mild, medium, hot, or damn hot.  We were scared.  We all went with mild which still had a little heat.  The chicken pieces were very generous as were the sides.  I got creamy cole slaw & pimento mac & cheese.  I was so full from eating my two pieces of chicken that I took the slaw to go.  They provide take out boxes with flatware and bags in case you've got leftovers.  Our daughter couldn't finish her 1/2 chicken and took most of it as leftovers.  She said it was just as good the next day.  Our order taker was very efficient.  She worked two registers at the same time.  And like I mentioned in another Yelp review, the Cosmopolitan's cash registers all have function keys with three different gratuity amounts that you select from.  It's added on to your total bill.    The chicken was moist and tender and prepared perfectly.  Made for a great dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 whole chicken with fries &amp; coke slaw
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thigh &amp; drumstick with cole slaw &amp; Mac cheese sides

pfqOfuNV6X4gF7TLzanqYA.text: This place has the heat!!!!!  If you want that has the heat come here chicken was so tender on the inside and side were dope I will definitely come back before I leave and it didnt take long to get food

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

S-p6hQobj6TJLVUzb_OXpA.text: This place is amazing! Located inside Block 16 at the Cosmopolitan, this chicken spot beats out the other food they serve. When I arrived, there wasn't that long of a wait in line, probably around 4 people ahead. I ordered the infamous chicken sandwich and within less than 10 minutes, I was already served my meal! I want to try other food they serve, but the chicken sandwich is unbeatable. I thought it was going to be small, but to my surprise, it was bigger than expected. The chicken was juicy and the batter covering it was fried to perfection. With all the hype on Popeye's Chicken, Hattie B's takes the title of the best chicken sandwich!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. MENU

90A_ZyWQFCHoA3nm58FqZw.text: Wooh! Now this chicken was HOT! I'm just going to start off with that. The menu has a wide array of options from dark to light meat, sides (greens, mcaroni and cheese, potato salad, etc) and the special chicken sandwich. I ordered the sandwich MILD and woohoo BABY! It had some kick. Not an unbearable kick but one that definitely surprised me because usually mild is just a teaser. The sandwich was crispy and the bun was beautifully soft, stacked with coleslaw and layered with pickles. The coleslaw was a little overwhelming for me so I took about half of it off. After that, it was great. If salt is a thing for you, I will say that it was a bit salty. I'm not sure if that was seasoning from the chicken or the hot pepper. The French fries were also perfectly crinkled and delicious. If you get a sandwich above mild, good luck and be prepared. It's definitely a nice challenge to accept.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

ULt-5pv48_goMEgQlRGzew.text: The chicken is good but not wait in a line for an hour good. That's exactly how long I waited in line because honestly I didn't have anything better to do at 8pm on a Sunday night. The line did not move for 25 minutes (I counted). If you find yourself in a similar position try one of the spots across the hall. They're equally good and worth a try.   As for the food that I eventually got (should have brought a sleeping bag) it was just ehhhh. I've been to another location before which ultimately was much better in terms of their small white meat platter. There were at least two other spots without a line at the time in the food court area where they're located. Sushi place looked good but couldn't do that because of my allergies. Would've tried the sandwich spot if I could go back in time.   All of that being said, they straight up need to give Hattie B's their own restaurant at the Cosmo. They need a proper kitchen to accommodate the West Coast masses craving real hot chicken. Give them their own space already!

L0GMqA0r0-v6pDxYK9BMEA.text: In the city of sin lies the hottest chicken -- I've had Hattie B's in Nashville bookmarked for awhile now but have yet to make a trip to Tennessee. Luckily for me, there's a closer location - Las Vegas, Nevada.  Conveniently located on the second floor of our hotel, The Cosmopolitan, Hattie's is surrounded by some other famous foodie spots in what appears to be a modern, bougie food court.   I'm not sure what's hotter, the heat in Vegas or the heat this chicken brings to the table. I definitely shed a few tears eating this thing, happy tears of course. Probably one of the tastiest chicken sandwiches I've ever eaten! There are 5 levels of spiciness to choose from when ordering your chicken. I went with the 'damn hot' which is one level below their hottest, 'go cluck yourself,'  I'm not sure I'd be able to handle the spiciest level, as I was struggling with the 'damn hot' itself. It was definitely a 'hurts so good' kind of a meal and I was still paying for it later but I would absolutely order it again even!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#39;Damn hot&#39; chicken sandwich with a side of Mac n Cheese

QQjE1B8H6MP1vRWHNP2uWw.text: Must try in Vegas! Expect the line, I've been here at 1pm and 3pm and the wait is the same even off hours! My boyfriend and I split the half bird medium spicy and it was perfect.. may have even been too much food. Came with two sides - we chose mac n cheese and fries. The mac n cheese was basic and the fries were fresh out the fryer and crispy. The chicken was absolutely perfectly seasoned and so tender! I don't usually go for the chicken breast because it could be dry and tough.. but not here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half bird

lb8NJs2R7LL7ECUINRNBsQ.text: I was expecting a lot, especially since Hattie B's is part of the reason Nashville is high on my "next visit" list and because of all the RAVE reviews.  Unfortunately, my experience at here was just A-OK.    We ordered the chicken fingers.  Maybe this is where we went wrong?  They aren't bad, don't get me wrong, but they weren't special.  I have the same chicken fingers in the cafeteria at my job.  The blue cheese sauce tastes like the chemicals that keep it shelf stable.  The collard greens are ok, not the best, not the worst I've ever had.  The coleslaw was the only thing I'd consider bad.  Super dry and flavorless.    The pickle was good.    I'd be willing to try the bone-in chicken as this does make a difference and maybe different sides but to be honest there are other delicious places to choose from in Block 16, I might just skip this one.

gdKmQS7IA3RM1hLCxrG7vw.text: Hattie B's serves Nashville Style Hot Chicken and is located in the Cosmopolitan Hotel/Casino on the Las Vegas Strip. This eatery is in the food court.   If you had chicken from the original Hattie B's in Nashville then you will be disappointed because the heat, flavor and texture does differ some. If you have never had this chicken from the Nashville Location then you will have a better experience.  We both ordered a small dark "HOT" platter because we both enjoyed that from the Nashville Location. We also tried a "Shut The Cluck" chicken fingers just for fun because it was only like $3.00.  I took a bite into my "Hot" chicken and didn't get the sting or aroma that the Nashville one had.....:(......./.This one seemed slightly greasier and with even less crunch.....The other differences was I got more sweet here and less cayenne taste and much less heat.  For fun we tried the chicken fingers and went for the hottest level called "Shut the cluck" besides being dry chicken the flavor and heat here wasn't like a "HOT" from Nashville....It was very disappointing.   Sides are about equal to most BBQ places....(not the best but ok)  Worth a try but not the same as from Nashville (less heat and flavor with more sweet)

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken finger was very dry
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small Dark Platter (HOT) with Shut The Cluck CX Fingers, potato salad and pimento Mac-n-chz
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small Dark Platter ordered &#34;hot&#34; with pimento Mac-N-Chz &amp; slaw

2aUOtZP2COBuWXzHUCnFyQ.text: I discovered Hattie B's accidentally as I was walking towards Marquee Nightclub since they're neighboring businesses.I was pretty excited to check it out since I haven't been to the original one in Nashville yet.  As an LA native, I have to compare Hattie B's to Howlin' Rays and this will probably strike some debate/controversy. With Hattie B's popping up in TV shows and people talking about how epic the original location in Nashville was, I had very high expectations.   I ordered the medium spicy hot chicken sandwich and objectively it was a delicious sandwich. The spices were fantastic and the breading was light and crispy. However, the reason it didn't rate so highly was because it was very clear that the fried chicken breast was fried way ahead of time and has been sitting around for awhile.   The mac n cheese was stellar though.  Verdict: Howlin Rays in LA is much better because it's freshly fried and the high turnover ensures the food being fresh and hot. Although I did prefer the lighter breading at Hattie Bs.

Z_Zh5NYhY3L0hnQv-UL6SQ.text: Super busy! This is part of the new food court type area in Cosmo. Line moves at an okay speed. Grab a spot on the counter to sit when one opens up. Had the hot chicken sandwich with fries for $14. Loved the sandwich - pleasant amount of heat, good flavour and moisture. Fries are okay. Good place for a quick meal at a low price for Vegas.  Tip: Bring your own water as there's no free water here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot chicken sandwich with fries

bIASMjnJSiSFsoqmlNDbAw.text: Chicken was pretty good but sides were very bland and disappointing (fries very incredibly salty- almost inedible) with all the food options in Vegas not sure if I'll be back. 2 stars for the chicken and 1 star for the solid craft beer selection.

10TNnc91zF_GY2_qm0PKoQ.text: I've been to many chicken places, as I have been on the hunt for the best chicken out there. My friend told me about this place called Hattie B's and that it was similar to that of another place I visited in Los Angeles, said that I would like it and it's very comparable to it.   His suggestion did not disappoint. This Nashville style chicken was delicious, the flavors were on point and the chicken was very juicy. It's hidden away inside one of the resorts, but I would definitely recommend coming by. The line was very short, menu was simple and the food was great.   Out of the places I've been so far, it probably ties for second. I felt like the sides were alright, the fries could've used a little something more, not sure what, the pimento Mac and cheese was alright. Overall, I would definitely come back if I were in the area.

t7f1JH24WiPloOe6ARAVjg.text: Came to this place to eat our first meal of the day. I order half of chicken in the spice level hot then I get to pick two sides I got mac&cheese with crinkled French fries. It was declicuous. I gotten so full couldn't even finish the rest of my sides and half of the chicken. I would say this order you can feed two people.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vPh405K54_yQt18unJ28jQ.text: Took my friends from out of town to the Strip, and we followed our nose to this place and were blown away! I got the Medium hot chicken and it was so spicy but in the nice way, not the intense way. Very flavorful and perfectly cooked & crispy, and it's expensive but you get a LOT of food for the dollar amount - I took home leftovers. The fries were so delicious, and my friends liked the mac & cheese also. Very convenient dining alcove right where you pick up your food, and they offer wet wipes so you can clean up lol. Definitely will be back here sometime whenever I want some spicy chicken!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sandwich meal with colelsaw, pickles and fries
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side view of chicken sandwich with lots of pickles.

Z0CdoprP0z0qsoSVkxRsFQ.text: Solid choice - Hattie's is one of my fav chicken joints, and this Vegas rendition does a decent job  Located on the 2nd floor of the Cosmo, Hattie B's is bunched with a few other small restaurants that share communal seating. The line at Hattie's is longer than any of the others, which should tell you something by itself! That being said, the line moves quickly and the food is to you within a few minutes. Unfortunately, seating is very limited, so you'll either have to wander off to eat somewhere else, or cut a B for a booth.   We tried a number of things from the menu, from the spicy chicken, what the pluck, half chicken, mac & cheese, slaw, fries.. they were all delicious, especially the Spicy Half Bird with Pimento Mac & Cheese. My mouth was on fire, though, and I couldn't get a cup of free water (had to pay $4)!? Not good.   On that note, prices are pretty high in general. To combat that, and given the size of portions, you can definitely share a plate if you're with somebody.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

62eijDTF_0hrf36Mns-1mg.text: I have only had Hattie B's at its original location but was super excited to see it was in Vegas!  Since Nashville is 2000 miles away from home I have been craving it for a few years.  My hope this Vegas location could live up to the original...well they do!  The chicken is perfectly and I do mean perfectly cooked!  Spicy crispy outside perfectly juicy in the middle.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small white - hot level...perfectly spicy!
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. After...banana pudding is a great way to end the meal and bring down the heat from the chicken!

GCXsMCoZV96djxeYOTZIqA.text: I was just in Nashville which is the the standard for hot chicken. Disclaimer, I haven't went to the original Hattie B's in Nashville.  There was a long line and the wait for your food took a while as they would call your name. The entire meal was okay. I mean it was decent, but I am being more biased because I had awesome hot chicken in Nashville. We all shared the sides in our group which were good. For the Cosmo on the strip, the prices were actually a good value at $12 with the exception of an over priced small Pepsi at $5.  I would give 3 1/2 stars if I could, but Yelp doesn't have that option. Nothing here was amazing, but just fair and not bad. I would go back to get my hot chicken fix, because there is no other choices in Vegas.

XsES157hzZjyo6RfOk4Ceg.text: Had a sandwhich  here and it was so tasty! Busy, but service was fast. Loved how spicy the sauce was!

s1IkNG67rI07_gzkX28hZw.text: I am somewhat disappointed with my experience at Hattie B's. While my chicken was good, the amount of nickle and diming this place does is unbelievable! They do not offer free cups of tap water - which seems unreasonable for a place that is known for their hotter than hot fried chicken. Almost a safety risk in my opinion. Anyway, I refused to pay for water and opted to find free water in the casino instead.  I did think the chicken was tasty however. It was moist and the medium I ordered was spicy enough for  me. My bf ordered the Shut the Cluck Up! because he loves the challenge of spicy food and he finished it! (Doesn't that deserve free tap water, Hattie's?) I wouldn't exactly say the chicken I got was the food highlight of my trip to Vegas, but it was above average food.  If I were to try Hattie B's again, it most definitely won't be at the Cosmopolitan location. This place is milking off us poor Vegas tourists. I know -- it's Vegas so I should expect Vegas prices, but the contradiction of being known for spicy food and not offering free water is too much for me.  Atmosphere: 3/5 - It's food court style, so nothing special. Food: 4/5 Service: 3/5 - My mom had trouble paying on the iPad and didn't receive much help from the staff here.

6bCrP5Zpjgr332jfIEd7HA.text: Delicious!!! The Mac and cheese is so good. The potato salad was great as well. I got the chicken sandwich in medium but it was a bit spicy for me. Next time I'll get mild but the food is super flavorful. One of the better hot chicken places I have tried.

e7BpeU1FSsP6dWRm1s2fCA.text: I love the chicken sandwich but I was hoping for it to be a little spicier than it was. I was honestly expecting it to completely destroy my innards but it only upset it a little haha. Weird thing to want but if you're advertising super hot chicken that's what I would expect!!  Anyway, our order also got lost somewhere in line so it took us a little longer to receive it but I asked for an update and when they realized they haven't gotten to our order, they expedited it.

NB2tSRoOJLH72U5K5eEGcA.text: I really liked Hattie B's in Nashville so when they opened in Vegas, I was super excited since I go to Vegas more often than Nashville. Unfortunately the food taste better at their Nashville location. The chicken in Nashville is full of flavor but at this location it was pretty bland.  They seem to keep forgetting to give the sauces people ordered. I saw a couple people coming back to ask for their missing sauces and when I got my food, it was missing also.  If you are ever in Nashville go visit Hattie B's there. I hope they improve at this location.

FL5hGVl58wiSuINOcgyWkg.text: Ok ok ok!!!! I've been dreaming about hattieb's for such a long time. I've seen pics of their sandwich all over and I just really wanted to try some REAL, fresh, Nashville Hot Chicken. And let me tell you this is definitely all that it's cracked up to be! The breast was cooked to perfection and was made of real meat. The bite was tender and juicy and every bit of the juice ran down my hands! I ended up getting heat level "Damn Hot" and it was SO DAMN HOT! I used like twenty napkins and my nose ran so much from the heat lol! I had to take breaks in between couple of bites from the heat. ( so good. And spicy) The macaroni was so delicious and had some red peppers which made the perfect zest! The sweet tea WAS SO GOOD and refreshing in 115 degrees Vegas heat. The only thing I'd say is that they need their own store front. The line was very long and the food is too damn good to pass up! @feli_Inayah

GnwM3oizOANrceRbrKjBAg.text: The first time I had hot chicken was in Nashville with Hattie B's and I LOVED IT. I was happy to see that a Hattie B's opened in a somewhat-closer-to-LA location in Vegas.  My friends and I went on a Saturday afternoon and there was no line but there was a 45 minute wait on food, which I thought was weird. I guess a big order came in? My friend, who has been to the Nashville location and this Vegas location before I did, told me that the spice levels were off between Nashville and Vegas; Vegas goes down one level in terms of spice. Her Nashville pick was medium so she got the hot here in Vegas. I should have listened to her because I ended up staying with the medium and it was really a mild flavor. For those who frequent Howlin Rays in LA, I would recommend going up a level when trying Hattie B's here in Vegas.  And I guess that's why my experience here is less than stellar than my experience in Nashville. The hot chicken just wasn't hot! But the chicken was still well fried and juicy. I also LOVED the mac and cheese. With my combo with two sides, I got two mac and cheeses, hehe. We devoured our meal in one of the many tables/booths of the dining area of that food hall.   Overall, we had a good experience, but the spice level was off (as it did not match the True spice level in Nashville) and the wait time was just way too long. I would definitely come back again though, especially since it's open late on the weekends!

m2T2HIaDrwBRkm6QsaKZsw.text: I absolutely love Nashville Hot Chicken and have been to Hattie B's in Nashville.  This was not the same IMHO.  I actually preferred the heat levels here, but the overall flavor is better in Nashville.  Seating is limited as this is in a food court.  Drinks are over priced, no tap water, and parking is not free.  I will probably be back because I love Nashville Hot Chicken and this is the only I know in town other than Skinny Fats, which changed their recipe and now that dish does not deserve to be called Nashville Hot Chicken.

B6A-OvEDurY-_8H-PnmDhQ.text: Updating to add another picture of my meal here! Loooove this place and will always come here for my hot chicken craving

Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The beautiful spread 10/10
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sandwich

9Rnu7gyjlI32CJkxQ5sgcA.text: My family decided to check out Hattie B for dinner on a Sunday night in October, The menu is similar to my favorite Howlin Ray in LA. It's located in food hall on 2nd floor of Cosmopolitan. We all ordered southern chicken sandwich. They precooked their chicken and fried it once not crispy with coleslaw and special sauce. The chicken is not huge in size unlike Howlin Rays. Just messy to eat. Although I love their crispy crinkle fries. The fried chicken looks like regular fried chicken (looking at someone's meal while waiting in line). No tables just stools facing the kitchen wall.  I wish the chicken was more crispy.

l5xb1Fzh5QU0fIjtrRrBqA.text: Chicken is flavorful, but I didn't really like the way that it tasted. It's just flavored a little differently, and I can't quite put my finger on what it is. But it didn't taste great. I know it was fresh, but maybe they need to change the oil, because that kind of tasted off because of that. Because the inside of the chicken was very juicy and delicios. Only the outer skin had an "off" taste.   We got the "southern" style large. The southern has no heat, and we're both wimps when it comes to heat and spice, so we opted for that.   For the price that you pay, it's worth it. No issue with the price.   The fries, however, has a very nice flavoring with a mix of spices. To me, the fries were better than the chicken, and I would go here just for the fries to be honest.

JBYep9JFIb9Wo8B4gIDaPA.text: Enjoyed the Damn Hot Chicken and didn't mind the line. Definitely will go there the next time that I am in Vegas!

RxIIqyggPR2sdB5-r1cNVA.text: Great fried chicken. Always delicious. Consistent. Good service. Reasonably priced. Recommended!

VstMN06CKAFVvKtt_5nrqw.text: Clucking good eats!  We're talking about some good Nashville hot chicken.  Juicy and tender inside from a soak in buttermilk infused hot sauce.  The telltale vinegar notes apparent.  Classic seasoning of onion powder, garlic powder, sweet paprika and cayenne.  Crisp but not crunchy on the outside.  Increased heat is achieved through chili oil infusions with a very forward heat.  You know immediately if you made a mistake in heat level.  You will feel the burn.  Mild, medium, hot, and damn hot; just remember, this isn't about proving your manhood, taste matters.  Medium is plenty satisfying.  Choose between dark (connected thigh / drum) or white (connected breast / wing).  Larger pieces creates different levels of spice and juiciness as you eat.  The dark meat is obviously juicer with more flavor.  All orders come with two sides;  OK, fast food style creamy cole slaw, well cooked but basic collards, crispy but salty fries, horrible, mushy, bloated mac and cheese.  That said, who cares.  It's about feasting on Mr. Clucky not the sides.  Fast food service still lacking efficiency and speed.  Part of the Cosmo's Block 16 food hall.  A worthy "cheap" eats option on the Strip.

pAWh4senooL_jv7iOgcgEg.text: I was so excited that I could try a taste of Nashville while staying in Vegas. The staff was friendly and helpful despite the long lines during lunchtime rush of a nearby convention. They offer pieces of fried chicken with sides like mac and cheese or greens, or a sandwich on a buttery bun. I got the medium sandwich with a side of mac. The mac and cheese was fantastic, although I didn't care for the greens. The sandwich was good but I felt the seasoning was a bit on the salty side. The chicken was perfectly cooked, juicy and tender with a nice crunch on the outside.

3f5RpdB0QKRgCV1-xqVjQw.text: Legit hot chicken. Just like how they serve it in Nashville. Thanks for not making my fly all the way to TN.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half bird with pimento Mac and cheese.

Iu7IrfSLQwrVfOqBueR-TA.text: Absolutely delicious! Great chicken and sides (I got greens and potato salad. Banana pudding is insane, sooo tasty. I also got their frozen spiked lemonade which I loved. Cool staff too, and good vibe in general. No brainer for lunch or a hangover meal.  This isn't quite as good as the original in Nashville and definitely not as hot, but it's still phenomenal.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quarter white meat hot, potato salad, collard greens, spiked frozen lemonade, and banana pudding. Everything was so delicious!
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hattie B&#39;s in the upscale food court area...love this food court addition by the cosmopolitan

0bqXOAr6NT3BotZuR2_BRg.text: Okay here I am again seeing what the hype is all about but this time I am in Vegas. I am an Orange County transplant and tried Jaybirds recently so I felt Hattie's was almost an exact replica. Who copied who?   Located in the cosmopolitan on the second floor is the lovely Hattie's which is in a small food court area.  Pricing is fair for Vegas especially since it's in the cosmo. I got the chicken tenders that were $12.50 for three with two sides. My hunny got the chicken sandwich for $14 which came with one side. Pricing for food was great but drinks not so much. I got a small bottle of champagne that only filled 1/3 of the cup for $15. I thought they would give a full cup not a small bottle. They also don't offer cups of water--lame so regardless you have to buy a water bottle for $8 or get a lemonade for $5. Otherwise, extra sauces are .25-.50 I believe.   Food is pretty good. I am always cautious about adding heat to my chicken so I added mild. Not the lowest but not the hottest either. It tasted delicious on my tenders. But what truly satisfied my belly was the potatoes salad--omg do not pass on this-it is sinfully delicious! I also ordered the Mac n cheese- it had a little spice kick to it but nothing to write home about. Otherwise, the crinkle cut fries were on point too.   Service was quick and nice enough. There was a line but waited 12 minutes at most. There was also plenty of seating available. Overall, pretty solid Nashville chicken dining experience along the strip. I recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chandon $15

38-1vMiaQsoXZ0ULnjl1Wg.text: If there is 2 of y'all, def get the 1/2 chicken platter. It's enough for both of you and plenty of sides.  We choose the medium heat for the chicken and it had a good kick to it. Not over the top hot but barrable for someone who can't take the heat. Crinkle fries were crispy and soft on the inside, perfectly fried. Also don't forget the ranch, you will need one for each person.  Price was overall reasonable. 20 bucks for the platter with no drink and two sides. Will be returning if I ever get another chicken craving.

8_hIEYPKdzpO9LDI0GjCMg.text: Food was overly salty. Chicken was dry. We had 3 missing items from our order. Overpriced food. +1 for the mac

ScX9sZHWQKl-OvqhBVYosQ.text: This place lived up to the hype for us, although my one regret was that we went for a medium instead of testing their hotter rubs.  For the Vegas strip, this place is a cheap eats god-send.  $14 or so gets you a platter with three huge chicken tenders with toast, pickles, sauce, and two sides.  We opted for the pimento mac and cheese (creamy, piquant, delicious) and the fries (crispy, salty, irresistible).  The chicken was the main attraction, and it did not disappoint.  Their dry rub and batter smell spicy -- you can literally smell it before you take a bite.  And that was just the medium!  We'll be back on future trips for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tenders combo

3U801RN0Jg58t4Eeb5LMuA.text: TLDR (too long didn't read): Overcooked, small, flavorless chicken. Creates more, unnecessary plastic waste with side containers for to go orders.  This is my second time eating here but this first time I wasn't super freaking drunk. I remember it being much better the first time around. Womp womp. I thought the hype was real! But slamming down shots of Jack makes everything better.   I will say that I was so unsatisfied that I asked JD very nicely the same night to take me to Popeye's. I started out this review with 3 stars, but I think 2 is really more like it and here's why.   What we ordered: The white meat plate, hot, with potato salad and coleslaw, a sweet tea and a side of ranch.  The piece of chicken we got was slightly over cooked, almost tasting a little burnt and small. And if I'm telling you it's small, it is. I buy that natural/organic/non hormone chicken so I get the difference between some beefy chicken breasts, too. It didn't have that great, thick crunchiness either. Hot? No. It was really like it had dark red colored oil all over it. The flavor and spice level weren't there. I read in another review that it was too salty. Polar opposite here. There was virtually no spice.  We ordered our food for here but sat next to a couple who had theirs to go. The containers the sides came in were at least 1/2 a size small than ours. Freaking cheap and wasteful on Hattie B's part. The paper bowls they use for the dine in orders are definitely the ones that are lid compatible. Instead, they create MORE plastic waste.   These reasons, coupled with the price point, are why I have this place 2 stars.

7L5IgHUKGaFUX0gtQeKMwg.text: I went to Hattie B's around 7 pm on a Tuesday. There wasn't a line and we were able to order right away. After ordering, food was ready within 5 minutes.   I got the small dark, which included chicken (for spice level I got hot) and two sides. I opted for the mac and cheese and southern greens. The chicken was not quite as hot as I expected - I generally do not have a high spice tolerance and I felt pretty comfortable eating the chicken. The mac and cheese was creamy and the southern greens were fresh.   While my overall experience was good, I feel like I need to try Hattie B's in Nashville to have a full opinion. My mind was not blown as I thought it would be, but I still had a positive experience and a good meal. In Vegas, it's a good opportunity to give it a try and see if the trip to Nashville is worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small Dark with Mac and Cheese and Southern Greens

1mRP-aR5TESM51vslwtspw.text: When my friends and I first walked through the Block 16 food hall, I was impressed with how good all of the different eateries looked.  However, while Pok Pok may have technically been the first thing we tried, Hattie B's was easily the one I was most excited for.  Funny thing is, I actually knew nothing about them until I was staring down their menu and looking up their reviews on Yelp.  Of course, neither did anything but raise my excitement - from what they had to offer to their Yelp reviews, everything I saw just screamed deliciousness!  What shame it fell short for me...  As you could probably deduce from their name, Hattie B's menu is all about (Nashville-style) fried chicken.  So, whether it's in the form of pieces, a sandwich, or tenders, don't expect to find much else, save for their selection of sides and dessert.  Although, I highly doubt anyone would be coming here looking for anything but fried chicken!    While I was tempted to try their fried chicken sandwich (the one I saw this girl eating nearby looked great), I figured their fried chicken was the way to go.  However, rather than have to choose between white or dark meat, I ordered the HALF BIRD PLATE ($19), which comes with a Breast/Wing and a Leg/Thigh with your choice of Two Sides (Pimento Mac & Cheese and Red Skin Potato Salad), Bread, and Pickles.  Being that their fried chicken is done Nashville-style (read: hot), you also choose the spice level you want (I went with "mild" since the worker said it still had some heat to it).  Now, I have to say - even though it felt a little steep to pay $19 for two pieces and sides, this was an impressive tray of food - the portions were generous (the pieces were huge!) and everything looked dope.  In terms of taste, the chicken was pretty solid; it wasn't all that spicy, but both were tender and moist and the batter wasn't super heavy (actually, I wouldn't have minded if it had been a little thicker).  Sadly, the sides were a little more uneven.  The mac & cheese was pretty good (I like the pimento cheese), but the potato salad was a little generic to me.  Along with my fried chicken, I also ordered their LEMONADE, as well as some of my friend's BANANA PUDDING ($6) and let me tell you...they were AWESOME.  Unfortunately, I don't have a photo of either one (forgot the first, wasn't planning on trying the latter), but that might be for the best with the banana pudding.  It wasn't much to look at, save for the cookies on top, but I loved how creamy the texture was, how it wasn't overly sweet, and how much flavor it packed.  As for the lemonade, it was super refreshing and had a nice balance of tartness and sweetness.  Based purely on my own order, I was torn on whether to give three or four stars overall.  The chicken was pretty solid, but the sides were rather underwhelming.  What's more, it's even harder to praise the experience when I think of what I could have got instead for the money.  After factoring in the banana pudding and lemonade though, it wasn't hard to give that bump to Hattie B's.  I can't say for certain if/when I'll be back to get the fried chicken again, but you can be damn sure I'll be returning for a drink and dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half Bird Plate with Pimento Mac &amp; Cheese and Red Skin Potato Salad

w_gOFysJB-VJGRPANn2RDQ.text: I had high hopes for this spot, but unfortunately, it did not meet my expectations. I love fried chicken and am always on the lookout for the best chicken.   The chicken, although tender, was insanely salty -- essentially inedible. I barely finished my meal since it was so salty. I'd ordered a lemonade, but the lemonade was incredibly sweet and artificial tasting, like they'd dumped a pound of sugar into their mix. I tried to trade off bites of chicken with the lemonade to balance the meal, but it was just disappointing. I hear that Hattie B's is a lot better in Nashville, so I guess I'll need to go try it there.   I'd avoid coming here, especially with the higher Vegas prices.

FYbwPV7B0rf893f9nKXTRw.text: Probably the longest line inside this delish food court. Not your typical corner of food but stalls of wonderfully from all over the states that you cannot get in Cali.   Lots of choices and levels of hotness. My spice level is really low. lol My order came out fast, but the chicken crisp was on point. The slaw had a lil spice and the brioche bun was perfect. Fries? not a soggy one in sight. Overall a good choice

Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kAr50-imahes2B-XjoQZWA.text: This was my first time trying a "Hot Chicken" place. We came here last weekend during our Vegas trip for some lunch. One of my friends said it was pretty good and he wanted everyone to have a taste. It is located on the 2nd floor of the Cosmopolitan Hotel. It is in a little food court with a couple other food places. I saw a thai food place, a sandwich place, a sushi place. There was definitely a variety. When we arrived, it was not too crowded and we were able to secure a couple tables for 11 people.  My boyfriend and I ordered a SM White and SM Dark so we can share and try both. I am a white meat lover and he is a dark meat lover. I was more of a fan of the white meat chicken breast and it was a pretty darn big piece. We were a little disappointed because my boyfriend's dark meat chicken piece seemed super small and it only came with one piece. (I am still convinced that someone walked by and stole his other piece). The side dishes were flipping delicious and very filling. We tried the Cole Slaw (refreshing), Mac & Cheese (SO CREAMY AND GOOD), and the Mashed Potatoes (just like momma makes them). It was decently priced for a Vegas lunch meal and it also comes with a piece of toast. Overall, it was a good simple lunch that filled you up.

QoQ4p-BElDYYVtWUN7OhcQ.text: This place busy, but pretty well organize. You order on one end then pick up on the other end. You get a good view of the assembling process from the cooking to the bagging. There are tables and chairs near the place . I got the wing thigh white meat with potato salad and mac n cheese. The wing was extra crispy from the hot sauce. It was a bit dry on the inside. The Mac n Cheese was pretty so creamy with a hint of spiciness to it. The potato salad was fresh and had a perfect amount of dressing on it. The chicken tender was perfect. It was moist, crispy and we'll seasoned. A bit pricy because of location. Probably, just come back for the chicken sandwich or chicken tender with sides

LcvA2pKd31FMKoGu_Yxn5g.text: This was the meal I was looking forward to most during my recent trip to Vegas. Hoping this would exceed howlin' rays in LA minus the wait. Unfortunately, it did not meet my expectations.  Ordered half chicken (mild), one tender (shut the cluck up) along with greens and cole slaw. Sloshy (alcoholic) and sweet tea. Banana pudding (definitely skip).  Only tip I have is don't order mild, get something spicier. The shut the cluck up flavor burned so bad but it was so tasty spicy.
