8HQqufnvhCjTFHhoeJHdTQ.text: I came here for the hot chicken but ended up eating one of the best pieces of fried chicken in recent memory.   My first order was the small dark meat with just the "hot" spice level, since I'd be sharing with my wife. It wasn't very spicy but the piece of dark meat was so juicy and tender and fried with perfectly crispy skin. It was glorious. The spices gave it some great flavor with just a hint of heat at the end. Just a fantastic piece of fried chicken.  My second order was the chicken tenders with the "shut the cluck up!!" spice level. First of all, I noticed that the chicken tenders were a lot dryer than the dark meat pieces and not nearly as flavorful. So if you have to make a choice, go with the dark meat. But man these were pretty spicy. Not kick your ass spicy like some of the levels that Howlin' Ray's has, but enough to make you sweat. If you enjoy spicy food as much as I do, get the dark meat at this spice level and you'll have yourself a mighty fine meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tenders - Shut the Cluck Up!!!
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small Dark - Hot.

DznqRhLvZtf5Rsad-BmJrA.text: Hattie B's is located within the Cosmo's small gourmet food court, Block 16. If you're not aware, this restaurant gained popularity and a big following from their original family-owned and operated Nashville location. It's comfort food to fill your belly.  The small meal comes with 2 sides and one sauce, and you can choose from white or dark meat. We went with the small white piece meal, medium spice. With 5 levels of spice you can be as daring as you want, but we played it safe and the spice level was perfect for us. I still had to drink a lot of water. The chicken was juicy and the breading was nice and crisp. I do have to note that it wasn't the best hot chicken that I've tried, but it was a super close second and I wouldn't hesitate to order it again. The Pimento Mac n Cheese is to die for!!! It's soooo cheesy and has great flavor. Next time I might even go for double sides of that!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small White Piece Meal

TB0QbJU-IxcLjak8oYQH4g.text: I think this spot might beat Howlin' Rays in Los Angeles! I love a good Nashville hot chicken sandwich, and the last two times I've been in Vegas I had to stop by here.  [LOCATION] This spot is located on the second floor of the Cosmopolitan Hotel, inside Block 16.  [WAIT] There was a line that wrapped around the stand both times I've been there but the wait time for both ordering and for our food didn't take too long.  [FOOD] I ordered the hot chicken sandwich and picked the mac n cheese for the side. The first time I ordered the sandwich I got it as Medium. It was the perfect amount of spice where it doesn't make your mouth burn. The second time I ordered I was drunk and decided to get Hot. Hot definitely left my tongue and lips stinging a little bit, so I would recommend getting the sandwich Medium.  The chicken was crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside, and just such a delicious, perfect bite with the crunch of the coleslaw. The side of mac n cheese was ABSOLUTELY delicious. I don't know what they put it in it but there is so much flavor in every bite and it's soooo creamy.  We ordered a lemonade too and it was surprisingly delicious for just a lemonade drink! Would recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uMQRmjNlAvQGVqaEz7DpDA.text: Delicious chicken. Large portions. I had the three tenders, Hot, plus one Damn Hot tender. Damn Hot wasn't, that part was a let down.  Terrific sides. The slaw was excellent, the fries were  Way better than crinkle fries had business being.  Fast and friendly service.  Not a ton of seating.  I look forward to trying the original location and based on my LV visit, my expectations are high!  Pro tip: There is a door with a donkey on it to the right of the cashier. Behind it, a secret tequila bar. Boom. Awesome!

M2s0UN575SmVNsYupyKEzg.text: This place is good.  However if you're comparing this to Howling Ray's please see below.   Price: We paid $14 for one chicken sandwich + fries combo.  Drinks are $5.  We paid a total of $35 for 2 sandwich combos & 1 drink.    Taste: The sandwich tasted great.  We did enjoy it as well as the fries.  If you like a little bit of heat I would go with the medium heat.  The mild tasted as if nothing was on the meat.  The fries were seasoned well. My husband had the medium heat but could have went up to the hot.  Environment: The place was loud with music playing in the background.   It was a fun experience and would be great to eat there with friends.   Not much seating available though.  Service:  The staff was friendly and we received our food extremely quick.  There was no wait time in line.    Location:   This was located on the 2nd level of the Cosmopolitan hotel.   Comparison to Howling Ray's:  In my opinion if you love Howling Ray's come to this place with an open mind not to compare the two.  Hatties is good but doesn't match H.R.  the heat wasn't there.  If you order mild at H.R. you will have to go medium here, maybe even hot.  Maybe the heat is watered down for the masses at Hatties.  The slaw is also better at H.R.  So please go here with an open mind because the food is good.

Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1st time eating here.  Let&#39;s see who&#39;s better.... Hatties or Howling Ray&#39;s

3Ic7iZ_pNpvbF5aLWbEtPA.text: Truly a place to visit if you're craving some fried chicken. Nestled in the second level of The Cosmopolitan casino amongst other fine eateries. There was a line but it went quickly. They're very efficient at order and delivery all within a few minutes. I opted for the Small Dark plate with my two sides as pimento Mac n Cheese and the Southern greens. I chose medium heat for my chicken. The chicken was crunchy and delicious and served on top a piece of white bread that soaks up the goodness. The Mac n Cheese was my favorite part of the meal...I could've eaten it for days. The greens were soft and good but nothing overly special. I also had the sweet tea that was very pleasant and not overly sweet. All in all a terrific experience, don't forget to pick up some wet-naps because you'll need them when you're done! Get ready to enjoy...now go ahead...get your chicken on!

5jKsbTsi0lP-4VjHzGvp-g.text: I got the Hot Chicken Sandwich and the wife got the Tender Meal. The food was outstanding. Good price, Great quality. My only complaint was the lack of seating. We literally had nowhere to sit. They need to figure that out.

O-_c7WGqhnPD_oPxfpTwjg.text: If you need a fried chicken fix, this is your place! And for the strip the prices are not bad either. All the chicken was perfectly cooked. We got the greens and fries as our sides, the greens were delicious and the fries were hot, crispy and more than enough for two people.

atudFMG_kXO5ulaUaCmtoA.text: Ok I'm sitting at the Aria, eating my cereal milk ice cream from the milk bar when these older women come and sit down next to me with their box of Hattie's B chicken. That smelled so good it ruined the vanilla Dairy Queen taste of the milk ice cream. Had to go try it out and it was soooooo good.  Why oh why did I waste calories on that stupid Milk bar????

Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5vp8VIbh1T3KFwL_GffN8A.text: What a fun surprise to see real Nashville hot chicken here at the Cosmo on the strip! We were staying a few days and decided to partake one evening because we loved hot chicken when we visited Nashville to view the eclipse!  We were definitely not disappointed. Hot and extra hot can bring the flavor and mild is safe for those that need it that way. We also enjoyed our southern sides, especially the collard greens. Yum!  Can't wait to return since we'll likely be in Vegas long before we're in Nashville again!

vZiAObKvKNh37XNHpUuhlA.text: I always have a soft spot when it comes to Fried Chicken... and I just couldn't be happier when we visited Hattie B's Hot Chicken. Located in the Cosmopolitan- Boulevard tower, precisely inside the new Urban 16 Food Hall. Easy to spot, thanks to the noticeably long lines.  For my lunch, I had the small dark meat chicken (hot) plus chicken tenders. The combo comes with two sides of choice. I picked the crinkled fries and the Pimento Mac and cheese. The fries was crispy but extremely salty and the Mac was just mushy and bland. Not a fan!   The chicken, on the other hand, was excellent! The tenders were meaty and good, but it was the hot chicken that whet my appetite and did magic for both my palate and belly - Juicy, peppery, salty and HOT!!  Overall, I found their menu to be appealing and generally good. Pricing wise, it was pretty affordable for Cosmopolitan's standard and portion is mostly big! The chicken is certainly the one you should not miss and I can't wait to be back for more hotness :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trying out everything :P

NsQt1XKlsv1ZiU8v-Yuovw.text: This new food hall at the Cosmopolitan rocks!  After reading some Yelp reviews and watching what people were ordering I decided to go with the three jumbo chicken tenders with medium spice, pimento mac & cheese, and  southern greens.  I was really close to adding a 4th chicken tender and I'm so glad I didn't because they're the biggest chicken tenders I've ever had (see photo).  They were freshly fried, perfectly spicy, and their ranch dipping sauce was the perfect accompaniment.  The pimento mac & cheese was unique as well as rich and filling so if you get it be sure to eat the chicken tender tenders first before filling up.  The southern greens were pretty good, I wanted more spice but for a place which prides itself on spice I was disappointed that I couldn't find any hot sauce bottles.  That's a first-world problem so don't let that stop you from enjoying this great eatery.

Y3zKxz7_nFdPvakF19SBog.text: Have a pile of napkins on your table to soak up the sweat from the heat. If you like to clear out your sinuses with spice, this is the place for you. Don't worry though, there are less spicy options for the babies as well. Hehe.   So excited to have Hattie B's in Vegas! Went to the original one during a visit to Nashville and haven't been able to have anything even close to comparable since.   A little pricy, but that's what we get for putting it smack dab in the center of the strip. Totally worth it. The mac & cheese, dipping sauces, fries, and of course the chicken. All so delicious and the ultimate comfort food. You haven't really had hot chicken until you have had Hattie B's. And if you can't get to Nashville, Vegas is the second best option. So stop by and singe off your eyebrows. It's fun, I promise.

vgoaou8aRagDYShZGkgIPw.text: So good. I got the chicken tenders (3 pieces) with two sides, I got Mac n cheese and potato salad. Everything was excellent and super fast and great service. Highly recommend you stop here for some chicken. I usually get medium and it is pretty Spicy already in such a good way.

7LrlRSxi5E0_6SZXpA7l0Q.text: wow wow wow, hot chicken! The hot is pretty spicy (if you don't eat spicy food regularly, I would avoid the hot option and go for medium or even a none). The chicken is super juicy and they do an excellent job on the batter. Its super crispy. The sides were just okay, they are were on the blander side. The star is definitely the chicken though!

d6nWbJHRNUbnYBbM9XIfHQ.text: Loved this place!!! It was delicious and nice a spicy!  The meat was nice and juicy! The skin was fried to a perfect crisp! Nice spice level I think we got the medium spice and it definitely had a kick to it.  The fries were amazing! You definitely have to get fries for a side! Got the Mac and cheese as the other side also but that was not nearly as good as the fries. The fries were nice and crisp and had a perfect seasoning to it!  Food came out hot and service was good however I will say not much on the service side since it was take your order and pick up your food.  Overall though definitely worth come to and get some delicious chicken in a casual setting!

ffHlEDfxZIcGuPNMThFzIw.text: Part of the Block 16 food hall concept, a collection of quick counter-service eateries with serious gourmet pedigrees. I got the chicken sandwich, $14 with a side. Soft brioche bun. Juicy chicken thigh. Very light breading. They offer several heat options. I got the Shut the Cluck Up, their hottest, which combined a flavorful Nashville hot seasoning with a heat that builds a little(?) but then it doesn't anymore. Overall? Good, but not great.  I got pimento macaroni and cheese for my side; it was soggy and flavorless. I'd been looking forward to trying this place for a long time but maybe it was a mistake eating here less than a week after having the best chicken sandwich on earth at Crack Shack in San Diego. Would I go back? I mean. I wouldn't say no if you were treating.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sandwich, pimento macaroni &amp; cheese

qqLWGfmGU1pT4uskkGY_gQ.text: Best fried chicken I've ever had.  We came here last naught after the beginning of a long holiday weekend starting at the Cosmopolitan.    We've been to Cosmo many times and we are glad that we've got more options.  We checked out a few different places inside the new Block 16 and decided to get the chicken here.   For $16 I got 2 huge pieces of chicken, some great coleslaw and greens.  Well worth the price and I've got leftovers too.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $16 for a lot of food.
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

o9JxSQbbgKyUIaY7BdGdYA.text: Best fried chicken sandwich I have ever had!! Such a generous piece of chicken, juicy & flavorful. I was skeptical at first, wondering if it was worth $14. But it definitely was. I asked for pickles on the side, and they gave me a full little container full of 'em.

YWnIsUJJ_dnikSJv6RuAwA.text: Came here for a fast lunch I have never had Nashville hot in chicken in Nashville so I'm by no means an expert however I truly enjoyed the chicken it was spicy as promised (I believe I ordered extra hot) and had a crisp exterior with a good flavor to the batter I do however wish they would let you order the chicken alone but all in all I would return

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PGUzJmtIKftz-Kkeod5fOw.text: I've been wanting to try Hot Chicken for a long time and I happen to be in Vegas for business so I tried the Dark Meat combo. The chicken was super crispy with a LOT of flavor. I was expecting more of a buffalo chicken flavor but it was more cayenne and a dry rub. Even the crinkle fries has a lot of flavor and heat. If you do not like spicy food, even the mild might be too hot for you. The mild is on par with medium at most wing places or medium heat at Chitpotle, to give you a sense. I like some heat and was glad I went with the mild. I was a little disappointed that my chicken was a bit dry and that the Cole slaw needed salt. Generous portions. You could split between two people if you're not a big eater. The Arnold Palmer was excellent. All around, it was still a great eating experience and I would recommend over any big chain you'll get in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rSXDQkyPlilmtYH8oX33MA.text: Best chicken ever!! I have had in Tennessee a few years ago and the recipe is still the same even in Vegas. The mac and cheese and greens are a great accompaniment to the chicken.

IY6KxtPV14KkCq5eCtZN7A.text: This is nothing like the original in Nashville.  The one in Nashville is outstanding.  This one really disappoints.  First of all, the service was slow.  Secondly, I ordered dark meat and when I sat down and took a bite, my tongue screamed, "WHITE MEAT."   I told the workers they got the wrong order.  They had the nerve to say, "Are you sure you ordered dark meat?"  Well I showed them my receipt and it clearly said, "Dark Meat" so they gave me a new order.  The chicken just didn't taste right compared to the Nashville one.  The collard greens were severely undercooked so it was very bitter, and I really like bitter.  I have to say the crinkle fries were great.  Overall, I was very underwhelmed.  The place failed to deliver.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crinkle Fries
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Collard Greens

l7HhvcWY-cNm_eeVqXr0CQ.text: Gotta be one of the best chicken places I have had. I couldn't stop eating it, even when I was full! The wait wasn't too bad and the service was nice. We had our luggage so we didn't want to sit and take up space, so we took the food to a secret spot within cosmo! Plenty of space for my wife and I to pig out and not be ashamed.   This place is similar to a chicken place in Los Angeles. But I think this is the original Nashville style spicy chicken. Got the half bird and it didn't disappoint. Sides were good.   Been craving this place, so will have to make the trek out again.

2zdo-OQpzsHShuJIODtWWQ.text: Ah - Hattie B's has my heart. I discovered them on a work trip to Nashville and was an instant fan. When I returned back to Los Angeles, I looked up Nashville Hot Chicken everywhere and found some disappointing variations. I really wanted my husband to try it but alas, couldn't find anything like it in LA. Then I stumbled across Hattie B's in Vegas and it's been a ritual every time we visit Vegas. It's just perfect in every way. If you can't tolerate spice though, I'd go with the mild. For my Indian taste buds that's very accustomed to spicy food, the hot was way too hot and had me sweating and my lips burning. I've decided the medium is just right for me. Not hot and packed with flavor. The fries are great, and the coleslaw is nice but the star is the chicken. You won't regret this place if you like fried chicken !

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SQjOsYRn_BK0hchqNtOcuQ.text: As good as the one at Nashville!!!! The chicken was so hot, jucy and flavorful. I just can it wait to travel to Nashville or las vegas to eat.

xS0Q7gbYe69BiBbZgnJWVA.text: Yay!!! Finally get to eat hot fried chicken without buying that plane ticket to Nashville!!! Ironically my husband and I were visiting Nashville two weeks prior solely for hot chicken and whiskey... and we decided on a last minute weekend getaway to Vegas and we ate Hattie B's every day. It's that good.  I must say though it is a bit different. It isn't as spicy as Nashville but everything still is really tasty. The line is also a LOT shorter!! My only gripe about this place is you can't just get the chicken and you're forced to get sides. The sides are really good too but I'd rather just eat the protein.  As for spicy level... here, I like it hot (and medium in Nashville). It's definitely toned down at this location.  I also loooove the banana pudding so I recommend getting that in the end, even if you're full. You can always refrigerate it and eat it later :)  I'm so glad Hattie B's is in Vegas so I don't have to make the trek all the way to Nashville now!

4jBPrQdnT0kFiITCL-CNXw.text: It's tucked away in the food court in the Cosmopolitan, but definitely worth the hunt...I liked the chicken, it was cooked perfectly and the sides were decent...the collard greens; I must say I did enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What the location looks like
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 chicken, collard greens, and Mac and cheese

9Y9Fj8GcpEb1ySO5CzjkWA.text: So I went back the next day to try the shut the cluck up seasoning and I highly recommend not doing that (unless you're doing it for shits and giggles a la blazin wings from BDubs). It was unbearably hot and gave me a stomach ache and made everything else not taste good. The seasoning itself didn't have a good flavor. Water in the entire food court is going to cost you $5-6. I had a milkshake from Gordon Ramsay's burger and it didn't help enough. Moral of the story: Go for the Hot seasoning. It's bombbb.

Q7vlXzHHUlfFMIelgDB17Q.text: After seeing Hattie B's in Nashville on tv I knew someday that I would have to try their chicken. Well a trip to Las Vegas surprised me with Hattie B's on the second floor of the Cosmopolitan in the new Block 16 food market. I love fried chicken and if your used to KFC or Popeye's then your in for a real treat. Hattie B's offers multiple levels of heat from no heat added to extreme. My wife got the no heat added and I went for the traditional hot. I was warned that it was not for the faint of heart and that it was packing serious heat, I accepted the challenge with open arms. I was very glad that I did, this sandwich packs a whopping amount of heat. But more importantly it has such a great coating and flavor that it wins you over. If you don't like your mouth on fire then stay away. Personally I felt that the coleslaw helped reduce the heat and worked well with the chicken. Sandwich was a little messy but that was an added bonus for me, I enjoyed the experience and having some leftover coleslaw to go with the chicken that was bigger than the bun. My wife got the chicken strips which were very large, flavorful, and juicy. We both really enjoyed how the chicken was breaded and the way that it added a certain crunch that we've never had with fried chicken before. Now let me address my personal favorite part of my Hattie B's dinner, their Southern Banana pudding. I am a total sucker for banana dessert and not that fake banana flavored crap. I seriously could have eaten 10 cups of this stuff and went back for more. It was definitely homemade pudding with fresh cut bananas in it and I'll be back for more the next time I'm in Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana pudding
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hattie B&#39;s sign

CzyPiy6d_trs9Uh8ozZrrA.text: The food was ok. It definitely was not worth what it cost. I think the food is over priced. This place is located inside the cosmopolitan which is nice, but for the price I will go elsewhere.

6VnXYqfAG_2W0QDfHncFUQ.text: Brace yourself this place is insane!   Crazy good chicken here. If you are a LA resident and familiar with Howlin' Rays this is very similar!   Great fried chicken!   The slushy machine infused with Alcohol is a must try!

ziaHagHswesvUDt0BrGLIg.text: Really good chicken. I tried the hot flavor and spicy but flavorful. The food is more of a sharing size. Didn't like paying $5 for a small water bottle but it's Vegas what can you expect.

h_LTUfBLpOF1T8Y2RtN7BQ.text: Chicken was just made.  Hot, fresh, delicious.  Medium was hotter than we thought.  The potato salad was delicious.  Would go back each time In vegas

rUQhU8C0J6Jlz5eykctRXg.text: Chicken was good.  I had the sm white medium and it had some serious spice.  Sides were a bit bland and boring.  Great food in this city but this place was fair.

q-rPv1QTI_b7ZI8zGAgXIQ.text: Really good chicken. I ordered mine hot and it was perfect. Just hot enough. I ordered the small white plate. Comes with 2 sides, bread and pickles. I was stuffed. The greens are very tasty but could be cut a little smaller. Fries were just ok. Not crispy.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small white plate. Nothing small here.

hv6kZO8KzR0i30lnxN1n7Q.text: Really fresh and delicious! You get a lot of food for what you pay for in my opinion. Chicken is hot and fresh, Mac&cheese is creamy, and fries are crisp to perfection!

tt747cfphMHm-hw_NfKutQ.text: Bringing the Nashville to the NV. Great stuff... love the sandwich and the tenders. Fries were super crispy and well seasoned. The Chef Brian and John were nice and told me all about the food while I waited for my food. Cant wait to return.

mYThXctJ3e9kwVJMCF5lrA.text: Pretty bomb, its like a fast food chicken joint. I was not brave enough to order the really hot chicken breast. But the meal really hit the spot. The breast is also a perfect size.

0YCoKMRl4mNfRveg3iE7fQ.text: While visiting Vegas recently we dined at Hattie B's.  I ordered the chicken tenders, which were absolutely HUGE. Accompanied by fries, which were cooked to perfection and the pimento Mac and cheese, which was out of the world!!! DELICIOUS, so rich and creamy.  Left me wanting more.  All this and sweet tea, which nicely complimented my meal.  The quality of the food and portion size was good value for the price!  We will definitely return!!

GO2qg2nRvcKmyulYWe5kOA.text: Chicken is Nashville HOT for sure. Great flavor - ton of crinkle fries. All was excellent. Would be good if they butchered the chicken into segments before batter/fry, but I get that it's their thing. Get plenty of napkins. Pricey should go without saying  -but- it's at the Cosmopolitan on the Strip. $$$

3So-zgYpcNmzo7d9voQvDw.text: Some very good chicken! Place is a counter and there are a few seats I guess spread around the cafeteria area, but since we were planning on to go, we didn't mind. Tip: if you wanna eat there, find a seat first before you order. The chicken was nice and crispy and the bread was an added bonus for making my own chicken sandwich. The chicken is a good sized piece. I wanted to try the spiciest but since I didn't have unlimited water I thought I shouldn't chance it. They do have water there and utensils if you eat there. Overall very good!

1wA2QuI7dtQ8XicBU0tQqA.text: Not bad but not great.  3.5 stars  I heard about this place when i visited LA. I was looking at the pics on yelp and it looked amazing but I never trust pics anymore since everything is just prepared for instagram presentation marketing now.   With one in Vegas, thought i'd give a shot. Around $10 for chicken leg/thigh and side. I got the medium hot and it had my nose running lol. The flavor was good at first but it got old quick. The chicken was just chicken. The macaroni is not bad but nothing great. I tried some greens too and they werent too bad but nothing great.   Overall the branding/marketing is exceeding the food quality. This happens. Its good but nothing wow. Prob wont be back.

qVeIptAqyLKsxRs4DPQvLg.text: Out of this world delicious! We ordered a large white meat plate with fries and Cole slaw. Everything was outstanding. The chicken is amazingly crispy and sooooo moist when you bite in.  I love how the "hot" flavor is definitely spicy, but still reasonable. Also, I think it's really a great value price wise, especially considering it's on the Strip.

LxR4VXfqtCnboB1vdDCrxA.text: Most amazing chicken I have ever had. So moist and temperature hot chicken. Pretty much perfect and worth the hype.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tenders hot

F0MOHhe7ZqpptqfY_DueYA.text: This place is amazing! By far the best fried chicken I've had in a long time. It's surprisingly a great deal as well. I had a difficult time finishing just the small plate. They let you choose how spicy you want the chicken. Also you get two really large sides. I would recommend that the 1/2 chicken with two sides is plenty for two people. They also had PBR in 20oz cans so I was really happy!

KNKB9NKR0SIDf_86nmwtQw.text: So i ended up at this pace because of the many reviews and was very disappointed ! I ordered the 3 chicken tenders with fries and greens . The chicken tenders weren't done all the way although they were extremely juicy which to me was disgusting i couldnt even finish them. The greens were nasty af as well they had no flavor which is surprising because they had bacon bits in them. My boyfriend orders the chicken sandwich with fries i guess he enjoyed his food he had no complaints. We also ordered an Arnold Palmer and Pepsi which were $5 each. Basically after spending close to $50 for lunch i will not be coming back .

mgVb74dQrImQidlbdHbZ9w.text: This is probably the most bang for your buck in the Cosmopolitan..they offer different levels of heat.. chicken was ok..nothing to write home about

BCxj-i_Hn4dd1cuuTpn2fw.text: I always visit Hattie B's in Nashville, so having a convenient location at Las Vegas inside the Cosmopolitan is a dream come True! This Hattie B's does a great job of replicating the original Hattie B's flavor and taste from Nashville. However, due to being in Las Vegas, their prices are quite inflated. We ordered one lemonade and two plates, which were the 1/2 bird and small white. The lemonade was draft and cost $5 for one cup (at least they give you one free refill). Anyways, for the plates, if you like a good amount of spice, then I would highly recommend getting the chicken Hot. This level is not too overwhelming and provides a good kick. Honestly, you can't go wrong with either plate because the chicken skin is very crispy, and the chicken meat is juicy. Also for the 2 sides that come with the plate, I highly recommend getting mac & cheese and french fries. The mac and cheese is very creamy and flavorful. Also, the fries have a good amount of seasoning and pair well with the honey mustard dipping sauce. Overall, I am really ecstatic that Las Vegas finally got a Hattie B's, and this is a great place to go once you've made a lot of money in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior shot!
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 a bird hot with Mac and cheese and French fries!

iq_R79blaqSfyGHfHaIiZA.text: I've had Prince's chicken in Nashville and compare to it, it's a close second.  Would definitely go back again to try different sides.  I got the medium and it was spicy, coming from someone who had to cut back on their spice.  I got the Mac and cheese and I would recommend that but the greens were "eh" so pick something else.  Other than the green, the chicken was good, cooked perfectly.

rTBQIsPlsqkWlwLCYPQ0Qw.text: It's hard to start up these kinds of satellite restaurants, but Hattie B's does a great job at it. Phenomenal quality chicken. Medium is probably a good spice for most, damn hot and above only if you are a mad man.

sbyTcCTsGrUpHVkRCbAToA.text: Food = exceptional Service/Getting my order correct = fail  Hattie B's closes at 11.  I was in line at 10:30.  Service was slowwwwww.  I wait in line for 20 minutes and when I finally get to the cashier I order dark meat chicken only to learn that they only had tenders available.  So I order a chicken tender meal (like I'm an 8-year old).  I wait another 15 minutes for my food.  When I get back to my hotel and open my box, I see that they gave me a ranch dressing that was already opened.  They charge you for sauces so the fact that they gave me an empty ranch container was extra irritating.    Chicken was great.  Mac and cheese was on fire.  Potato salad was meh.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empty ranch container.  I thought I was paying for an unused ranch.  Silly me.

HqyTB23Ywed6oxcyx2f86Q.text: I'd give this a firm 4.5/5...cool place at the cosmopolitan in Vegas.  Friendly staff(thanks Anthony). Great fried chicken. I love spice, but was told the medium is usually good and it was just the right spice (thanks Anthony). The mac and cheese is creamy goodness, loved the southern greens with great flavours and of course the chicken...omg!!! Definitely a must!! Great affordable price. Will be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1kRbtT-4HpG3iBPuEIw1WQ.text: Good flavor! I wish the chicken was a little more crispy which is difficult since it gets coated with sauce right away. The sauce has the right amount of spice and tang. I got a side of mac 'n cheese which was almost like mac 'n cheese soup, and not in a bad way because you could dip your fries in it. It's more like a cheese sauce.

3Qt1-naGbOarsbGJQ0kQHg.text: I had never had hot chicken before and was excited to try! We had the tenders in the medium spice level. I like spicy and even the medium was almost too spicy for me. The dipping sauces helped. They were out of lemonade, which was sad.  The Mac and cheese was good too, but it lacked a little flavor.  Line was quite long, but they move fast! Chicken was moist and juicy, packed with flavor.

y5GqGw2yE6rN45KAU16pkg.text: This unassuming eatery is located on the second floor of the high end Cosmopolitan in Vegas.  As a disciple of Hot food, I'm always on the trail for authentic, well prepared spicy fare and this place didn't disappoint.  The menu is simple, offering chicken in various forms including breast's, thighs, wings, tenders and a chicken breast sandwich.  They can be ordered in different gauges of heat from mild to "What the Cluck" which is made with ghost peppers.  I ordered the "damn hot" which came with one side and kosher pickles. It didn't disappoint as the heat was damn hot, but not to the point where there was just heat without flavor. Also, for the price point of $12 the quantity and quality of the chicken breast was amazing.  My spouse ordered the mild sandwich which had a hint of spice which was perfect for her non-heat palate.  My only disappointment was not being notified that you can order items with the different heat so you can enjoy the entire spectrum of spice. By way of example, you can get your three chicken tenders , mild, medium and What the Cluck. Wtf, I mean Cluck! Why didn't they say so?   Which brings me to my only stricture regarding Hattie B's. The workers at the register were totally clueless and were unable to guide the patrons through the complexities of the somewhat simple menu or even where to pick up your food. What the Cluck! Now that may be fine in Tennessee but won't play well in Vegas.  If not for a waitress named Azalea, we would never found where to pick up our food or found out that you can order the food with a variety of heat with your order. She was also knowledgeable about the history of the company which lended to the overall experience.   Lastly, all the sides were spot on, especially the Mac and Cheese.   So, if you're looking for high quality food with an array of heat levels at low prices, this is the place for you? Can't wait to go back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bwY1XaxFz4D8Npg1xMNy-w.text: My husband and I have been on this hot chicken kick. I had remembered hearing about Hattie B's in Nashville so I was super stoked that they had it in Vegas now! It is situated in Cosmo among other restaurants. We were lucky, we came on a Saturday evening around normal dinnertime and there was no wait. The service is pretty quick. You go up and order your food, then find a spot to sit and they'll call out your number for the order. The food came out super quick so you won't be waiting long to get your hands on some delicious hot chicken!  We were not super hungry so we wanted to share a meal which turned out to be the perfect portion for us. We shared 3 jumbo tenders with 2 sides (mac and cheese and fries) plus the Nashville comeback sauce. My husband is more of a spicy eater than me so thankfully we were able to split the spiciness level of the chicken. We ordered 2 medium and 1 mild. For me the mild had a nice little kick to it, making it enjoyable to eat. My husband loved his medium spicy. When I tried the medium it definitely was spicier than the mild, but it was as terribly spicy of a medium as other places where I need water or milk immediately after. However, I definitely wouldn't be able to finish a whole medium tender by myself. I had imagined the difference between the mild and the medium would just be the spiciness level, but there was a slight difference in flavor/spiciness kick between the two levels as well. The mild to me tasted a little bit saltier. The tenders were tender, juicy, and packed with flavor with each bite! The mac and cheese was delicious and creamy. The french fries were crispy and seasoned well. The comeback sauce was amazing! The perfect dipping sauce for the chicken or even the french fries.  I would definitely come here again to get the tenders again! It is a well portioned meal and decently priced especially for being in Vegas!

hns6L1rsOHy4iJWai4XTow.text: As a huge fan of Howlin' Ray's in LA, I was more than excited to NOT wait 2-3 hours for Nashville Hot Chicken in Vegas this past weekend.  They really nickel & dime you at this place: $5 for an iced tea and NO REFILLS (I only wanted one) while you're eating spicy chicken.  Also, no tap water.  If I may borrow the slogan above the cash register: What the Cluck?  You can say goodbye to Southern hospitality & hello to just paying rent at The Cosmopolitan.  I'll tell you right now that Johnny, the owner at Howlin' Ray's, is one of the generous owners & is always tossing in freebies/upgrades with a sweet smile   8 of 10: Fried Chicken sandwich.  The buns were cold (albeit toasted.... how did that happen?) but at least the chicken was piping hot & fabulous (so were the crinkle cut fries).  The taste was surprisingly bland with all that sauce & coleslaw in there.  Is it wrong to be thinking of Howlin' Ray's while I'm eating this?  8 of 10: Small Dark meat platter (think of the "small" size as a lunch/big snack, and the "large" as a full meal).  The chicken here is legit smaller, but at least the skin is nice & crispy.  If you want to maintain your girlish figure here in Vegas, I suppose this place is an option.  Enjoyed my mac-and-cheese, but wanted a do-over with this ill thought out coleslaw.  It's like the side dish that had to show up for work today & really didn't want to.  Ordered a medium spicy for both (and I LOVE spicy!), but it was probably a notch above what it should be for West coast peeps.  That said, I'll still be going the medium spicy route & just wanted to reiterate all the other comments on here.  For the quality/price/location here in Vegas, I would come back.  However, don't think of this place as a near substitute for Howlin Ray's!  It's the Khloe Kardashian of Nashville Hot Chicken.

72xRM40m0C6HiYHzusLQDA.text: This was inedibly salty. I don't even mind salty food, but I could only eat a few bites of this. My friend who ordered somthing different said the same thing. I ordered the chicken sandwich (mild) with fries. The chicken and fries were decently cooked though. You know it's too salty when you eat the pickle for a break.

ltx8DMq_BmNcNkTqaAUZGg.text: Basically gourmet Chick-fil-A. But their spice is legit. I ordered a chicken sandwich with medium heat, and that medium does indeed pack some heat. The food isn't cheap but seems to be of a good quality. The line was getting pretty long when I was finishing up.

JTUBerfimzu-Q_0-VOF98A.text: The fried chicken is worth coming here for! Its crispy, flavorful, spicy, and so so good. After eating expensive meals on the Vegas strip, it was nice that a good meal didn't cost me an arm or a leg. My friend and I came to eat on a Monday afternoon and it wasn't terrible crowded. They had a small bar/countertop area for you to sit and eat as well.

V-qXwyDaNBK8Xd0e0oeF7w.text: I've been dying to try this place since i missed eating here in Nashville. I was super excited to see they now had one in Vegas. I got the Nashville hot chicken sandwich with "hot" sauce on it and a side of fries. The hot sauce was definitely hot!!! It was delicious though. Definitely had that Nashville hot chicken taste. The place is conveniently located in the cosmopolitan hotel. Went on a Thursday afternoon and there wasn't a line and our food came out quickly. It is located in a food court so seating is limited. Price was typical Las Vegas pricing.

muncE2SPcfpBlh1JfPZrXA.text: Ugghhh....I really wanted to like this place. Full disclaimer : I live in New Orleans so I am constantly immersed in superior cuisine and Hattie B's is just not there yet. At least the Vegas location. The chicken was hot as described but not flavorful. When consuming spicy food you still want it to have depth. It tasted like bland fried chicken that some hot seasoning packet was thrown on as an after thought. The sides left me wanting for more. The potato salad was lack luster and the greens were made by someone's grandmas evil step sister. Lacking in flavor and stingy with the seasoning meat. 2 stars for decently fast service during the lunch rush and the handy paper menus to help decide on options before ordering. And maybe I just didn't order the right items but the chicken needs some work.

eaTdRgb9zlhITaMYSytkhw.text: This place is definitely worth trying and coming back to ! I ordered the 3 piece tenders with hot or mild I believe and it was great! Chicken was perfectly crisp/fried only bad thing I would have to say is they use a rub for the spicy seasoning, I didn't get enough of the seasoning but overall good. For the 2 sides I got red skin potatoe salad, and French fries . Would definitely come back next time I'm in Vegas!

uOg2WU1lKGTy3it_e2AkmA.text: This is the most perfectly seasoned and fried chicken that I've ever had.  I loved the medium hot which was still burning my month but it was good.  The sauces are very good too.  I would always hit this spot off the late night.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AiZCHBtZaqy04KXNXQTskw.text: This place is delicious! I see why the lines get long. I ordered mine to go. 1/2 medium spicy chicken. It stayed crispy and I couldn't finish it. I ordered it medium and it was still spicy for me.  It would be good for 2 people. I also had their fries and Mac n cheese. Everything stayed delicious to go. This place is a must have if visiting Vegas.

iRZ5N0-2frBuyOPDpmpmYg.text: First time I had the white order of  chicken it was awesome. The skin was so crispy, the meat was perfectly moist. That was around 7:30 in the evening.  I returned for a 2nd time, on a different occasion around 10:30pm. The skin was soggy, and the meat was dry. When I asked the ladies working on this Friday night, how long this chicken had been sitting for, they said it was made 20 minutes ago. I asked for fresh chicken and was told it would be another 20 minutes if they were have make me some. I guess they were getting ready to close. Not sure but 2nd one round was pretty disappointing. Not sure if I would go back a 3rd. Maybe try something different if at block 16 if it's not prime lunch or dinner time. Giving 3 out 5. First time was 5 outta 5 this time is a 2 out of 5

aOcagN-HpJW1-T7PTbD7UA.text: Super excited that my one of my favorite places to get fried chicken from came to Vegas. And I was not disappointed at all!!!   The chicken was juicy, the skin was crispy and the spice level was just enough to make you cry a little. (Although you can select your own heat level, it just seems right to get it spicy).   The only reason that I could give it a five star is due to something that's kind of not in their control. There just isn't enough seating for the amount of people that come to eat. It's one of the food places within the new food area in the cosmopolitan, but there just isn't enough seating for all of its guest.

Ccfovt7YQPDE1tpluZJXlA.text: Fire  did I say it was FIRE !! Fresh off the plane to Hattie B's !! Withstood the line which there is always one at the cosmo . It's only right tho that you take it in stride and know the wait will be worth it. The thing is that as you wait in line and see the chicken being fried up and the sides being put together your mouth is salivating with anticipation . Oh yea did I say this chicken is  flames. Once it's your turn from waiting you want to order everything to it all but I stick to the chicken with heat . I like spicy so this has a Lil kick to it. My side was the red potato salad and had to try the greens out. Both are ok but that chicken sandwich is  FIRE and melts in your mouth!! Had a Red ale beer to wash it down. If your at the cosmo check it out . I know this one will not disappoint

v3xPQQGS_GG2p3MFAD4BCw.text: I mean, it was alright...  So, I've heard stories of this place from friends having it in Nashville, and was hoping to have the experience to beat the first time I bit into a Howlin Rays Chicken Sando, but alas it was not.   Swung by here before opening on a Sat morning during a visit to Vegas, and there was already 12+ people in line, but it moved pretty swiftly. Put in my order for 5 chicken sandwiches along with each side, and a jumbo dark meat plate. Everything was medium level spice.   First bite. Hmm this could use more spices and actual flavor. Second bite.  I guess the cole slaw is alright. Third bite. This REALLY could use more FLAVOR, and why is this so bland? This was the general consensus from everyone in the room, and we were just staying upstairs in cosmo, so they were still fresh and only about 7 minutes old from the order being ready to our first bites in the room.   After all the hype about this place fell way short. Friends that had been to the original location with us on this trip had said the OG location was way better, and us newbies had compared it to being equal to a Chic Fil A Spicy Chicken Sandwich.   That being said we've gotta go back and try the Hot level in hopes of there being some actual flavor. We want to taste those spices.   For now Howlin Rays is still the top. This place is not it yet.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sandoooo
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumbo dark

YjY8TZX3svF6H40fGbjwxg.text: Everyone says to come try this place for their Nashville style chicken sandwich.   I enjoyed the sandwich. It was big, the chicken breast was spicy (medium), and the comeback sauce....let me tell you...the comeback sauce is sooooo good. I could put it on anything! I'm not too much of a fan about using chicken breasts instead of dark meat for the sandwich. The outside wasn't as crispy as I expected. But all the flavors were there.   It also comes with a side of your choice. I picked the greens and they came out hot and flavorful.   Overall, I would go back again. But maybe try the tenders next time. And extra extra comeback sauce! 4/5 because the coating on the outside wasn't that crispy.

I3Zygtj5wTQ9WJTyDuYzrA.text: This place was nutz around lunch time on a Sat.  The layout of the "food court" next to Marquee night club was pretty tight with not a whole lot of places to sit and enjoy your food.  But that didn't matter to us as long as the juice was worth the squeeze.    They offer 4 levels of hotness.  Mild, medium, hot, and "d" hot.  We decided to go with the medium.  But we all felt like we got the hot chicken since the wife and daughter can handle heat better than me.  Sadly we enjoyed the sides better than the chicken even though the skin was deep fried to perfection.  The Mac and cheese, Cole slaw, and potato salad were all excellent.     It's definitely an experience, so I recommend you all see for yourself if $17 for half a chicken, $6 sides, and $4-5 for sodas are worth a second visit.  Overall, 3.5 stars for us, so we rounded to 4.

Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u-IdhhXl_UF48vJv0fZpsg.text: Hattie B's Vegas location is better than the one in Nashville. There, I said it. My experience in Tennessee was marred by a long wait and "hot" chicken that wasn't even hot- apparently their spice scale is pretty lenient. And if you factor in the parking ticket I got there, the Cosmo parking fees are cheaper.  This location was better all the way around. There was a line but it was short and moved quickly, and food was out fast. As for the spice, the medium heat sando had cayenne coming off on my hands just picking it up- this isn't a complaint, medium was satisfyingly spicy, it's a comfortable heat level provided you had a drink. Rumor has it the spice scale is more aggressive here, complete with an exclusive "Vegas hot" level that I would not try myself.  The sandwich ($12 w/side) here was great, huge, juicy breast topped with slaw and pickles to help cool off. My go-to side here is the pimiento mac, which is creamy and cheesy with a nice little kick to it. Also shared a chicken tender plate with friends ($11, same heat level), with greens and potato salad, and I found that I prefered my original order across all items. Hankering to go back for that exact order as I type this up!

JjnstAVKA1hKGx-0hplTYg.text: Wow the chicken here is amazing...I knew right away when I bit into the crispy chicken sandwich it was better then anything I've had before.   The boyfriend thankfully just ordered the medium which was almost too hot for me as well, it was more of a lingering burning sensation that hits your lips after it's all gone....I will definitely be having the mild next time around.

Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8jPuyTevzzJw7Zvu0qFBmQ.text: My first review of 2019!! Just received my YES email and realized through the busy December month I was mostly absent here so I am going to kick the year off with some reviews of our most recent Las Vegas trip and get to a few others locally and in Calgary in the coming days.  There is an amazing "quick eats" food area on the second floor of Cosmopolitan that features Milk Bar, Egg Slut, Pok Pok and Hattie B's Hot Chicken, just to mention a few (Secret Pizza is up on the third floor). We were staying next door at The Bellagio and found ourselves looking for a quick bite a few times so I will start with the trio we ate at in the Cosmopolitan for starters today.  When I was in Nashville in late 2017 we tried hitting Hattie B's Hot Chicken but there was literally a line up down the street and our Uber driver suggested McDougals Chicken Fingers & Wings (I reviewed that a while back on here) so we ended up there. So seeing a Hattie B's had opened in Vegas was a no brainer when we were hungry.  Heather and I split an order of chicken tenders (added a fourth tender for an extra $3) with a side of crinkle cut fries, coleslaw and an unsweetened iced tea. We LOVE heat, and ordered the tenders as "Damn Hot" level. The tenders came a bit overdone, but the spice level was no joke. It's a dry rub/ seasoning and it had us dying (the way we like it). I had the hottest level McDougals could offer in Nashville (a sauce) and it didn't come close to this in terms of heat. The sides of ranch (Heather) and Blue Cheese (me, because Blue Cheese or GTFO... Ranch is for children) were used up entirely to save off the heat somewhat. They have a hotter level... "Shut The Cluck Up" and I can't imagine how hot that is... this was more than enough, even for two people that eat their food at ridiculous spice levels.   The sides were average and I found the side of "Nashville Comeback Sauce" tangy and underwhelming... it did not impress me. Had the tenders been cooked perfectly this might have been considered 5 star... the heat/ rub here will have me returning next time were in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Damn Hot!!!

zI2M_ULVLU5s7kH6qzGorQ.text: I was so happy to see they had a spot in the Cosmo during my recent trip to Vegas.  Having been at the Hattie B's in Nashville on multiple occasions, I can say it is just as good at this spot.  You do miss out on some of the experience you get in Nashville, but the food was just as I remembered.  I ordered the chicken tenders, spice level two.  They were spicy, fresh, and delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tenders, spice level 2

Lky6cGQAPRxKecAO00tzKg.text: There is no hot chicken place in the bay area. I HAD to go to Hattie B's during my trip to Vegas! My friends and I were already super full from dinner but we were passing this place and we had to try it!  I shared a small dark meat plate with collards and fries with my boyfriend. OMG the chicken is so moist and juicy!! We got the mild chicken and we could've went one step up the spicy level. SOOO good. The fries are also pretty good as well as the collard greens.  I wish I was more hungry when I went here. I would've definitely gobbled it down!  There was one cashier and she was using two registers at the same time. So fast and efficient!

AMpZHYsQ1h6vib_c3Jgl9Q.text: Vegas is basic and tacky AF.  I hate Vegas, but I love food.   These days I tend to visit Vegas for off strip restaurant gems and to explore nature.   I drove to Vegas just to eat at Hattie B's.   I endured horrendous parking and dodged annoying "Vegas-type" people to eat hot chicken from a chain from Nashville.  I ordered the dark chicken at the medium spicy level. It was everything I imagined it to be. The sides I ordered were a delight as well.   I ordered the spiked lemonade because it was hot AF in the desert. Just what I needed.   Makes me want to finally visit Nashville this year.   The best part was no crazy 4-hour line like the wannabe overhyped hot chicken in Los Angeles.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

v8fi_X7cksuNpiIPx-7_uQ.text: I recently joined some friends at Block 16 for a food crawl and Hattie B's Hot Chicken was my first stop.   My husband and I ordered a SM White Plate. The Breast Wing Quarter was good and packed the heat. The chicken was tender and delicious. For ease of eating I'd order chicken tenders next time.   I'm not sure what the heat level was of the chicken I received. Others in my group ordered medium like I did, but the chicken had completely different colors. Based on the color I think my chicken was the "hot!" and it was hot indeed. The medium tenders ordered by others were the perfect level of heat for me.   My favorite part of the meal were my sides. Red Skin Potato Salad was creamy and had a great tasting dressing on it. The cool dressing also helped cool the mouth in between bites of chicken. The winning side was the Pimento Mac & Cheese. I loved their mac and cheese and would return just for this. There weren't large noticeable pieces of pimento in the side, but it was present in the flavor.   The drinks were also great southern drinks. My Lemonade was delicious and refreshing. My husband enjoyed his Sweet Tea too. The servings are small on drinks so order more than one if you get thirsty. My husband killed his sweet tea in a couple of minutes and needed to find another drink.   I'll definitely return to Hattie B's next time I find myself needing a quick meal at The Cosmopolitan!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sandwich &amp; Plate Menu
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Heat level explanations sides, drinks, and dipping sauces.
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SM White Plate with Pimento Mac &amp; Cheese and Red Skin Potato Salad

7UT8xzX_0D0DYYPGk8wovg.text: Time for Chris V's take on Hattie B's.  Hattie B's Hot Chicken is a well-known Nashville institution that started in 2012 with a menu focused on the local specialty known as Nashville hot chicken. I haven't been to Nashville yet, but when I finally make that trip, I won't have to try Hattie B's because they added a location in Las Vegas with the debut of the Block 16 Urban Food Hall on the second floor of the Cosmopolitan on the Las Vegas Strip. Block 16 can be found next to Marquee and across from Holstein's, and Hattie B's is right smack in the middle of this food hall, on the other side of District.  I should've taken care to ask my friends to order mild chicken, and I do wish that I'd found the opportunity to try the dark meat too. However, I only tried white meat prepared to medium heat amongst the various dishes, including the Hot Chicken Sandwich ($12), Large White ($15 for 2 breasts and 2 wings), and Tenders ($11 for 3 pc).  The medium heat ended up feeling like a 5 out of 10. Unfortunately, that is more than I can handle comfortably for more than a couple of bites at a time. However, I liked the crunch of the breading and the moistness of the boring-because-it's-not-dark meat. Also, the side of ranch sauce helped to allay some of the fire. Portions seem reasonable even if the prices have an upcharge (from $0.50 to $3.00) compared to the original restaurant. It could be worse on the Strip.  The sides which I tried weren't bad. The collard greens have a bit of a challenging bitterness. The mac 'n' cheese was creamy. The potato salad was delicious and not too sauce-heavy. None of them stood out though, and the white bread presented with some entrees was very plain and hardly worth even taking a small bite.  Hattie B's feels like a 3.5 or 3.75 right now. I'll have to return to try the mild chicken with dark meat and perhaps the banana pudding, a dessert which we most likely skipped due to our desire to try the neighboring spots at Block 16.

vxZH7wM_VKIoP1ALBM-2cQ.text: This is mediocre lets say at the least the potato salad was good but its like they used one or two red potatoes and smash them up with like some ranch and other spices but yeah it was good. However the greens dont know what kind of meat was in there and was a little disappointed as to it being there because I dont eat pork or beef but it did look like turkey meat.  Now the chicken nooo it was good but it just wasnt like I would have thought it was fried so until the meat under the batter was over cooking and which made my bite hard with a chewy type of thing. Naw not good to me no real taste maybe I should have gotten the hot atleast it has some flavor

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two peice dark potato salad and greens.

p0y4qGdeNFPQ7dkriCP4Mw.text: Since the hot chicken craze started all we have wanted to do was try Hattie B's. Being from Southern California we were so excited to find out that it was opening up in Vegas. The first chance we got to make a trip we added Hattie's to our foodie list.   Let me tell you, it did not disappoint. We ordered the half chicken to share, which came with a breast, wing, leg and thigh w/ the pimento Mac and Cheese and crisscut fries. We ordered the chicken medium hot and added a side of their comeback sauce. Everything was delicious. The skin on the chicken was crispy and for us had the perfect amount of heat. The inside of the chicken was moist, including the breast, which of course is the perfect combo. The white bread and pickles take away the heat of needed and are the perfect southern touch.   Seating was a little harder to find. The entire Block 16 area in the cosmo is a tight space. Hattie's has its own bar counter seating and some shared tables. We ended up finding space at the bar counter, but only had one chair to share. The food more than makes up for it, but if you're looking for a place to sit, come earlier, have a look out person etc. We enjoyed our food and the space and even got to peek into the kitchen over the counter to see how the magic happens. Great time!

CPlGPdakC-Sf_ZxzGcbJEw.text: It pains me to say this but I was not impressed.  I ordered the hot chicken sandwich (medium) with fries and a banana pudding (to go).  Chicken sandwich was not bad by any means but it didn't live up to the hype.   My fries were overly salty. So much so that I could not finish them and I love fries :(  The only bright spot is that I didn't have to wait in any line.   Give me my calories back...

WqgPsUwRrm9kE9iQKkEEmQ.text: It was my partners turn to pick out lunch spot and he decided on here and boy it was a winner, winner chicken dinner ! I had the dark in get the cluck hot and it was extremely hot . I had underestimated the heat level as I have noticed what's considered hot in most American cooking is mild at most to my cultural heat level. Well, this one was definitely hot! Like Atomic at WingStop. The chicken was delicious and juicy. It came with two side and I got the greens which was delicious and fresh and the slaw which was fine. Also comes with 1 sauce . Drinks are $5 ( non alcoholic)and refills are included . Staff were nice and the prices are excellent for what you get. We will return here on our next Vegas trip and definitely recommend.

MlVa7Vf0P88P-rqWJ87mAg.text: Not as good as it is in Nashville...but still very good.  The biggest, most obvious difference is the chicken is already fried, not cooked to order. And while the mini food-court location in the Cosmopolitan has more seating options than Nashville, it's also more expensive and less atmospheric.  Despite being cooked in advance, my chicken sandwich was excellent, and the chicken more than up to par.   One sour spot-- they don't offer tap water, at all (despite any restaurant having to have running potable water). On the positive, they have an okay beer selection-- if you're paying for something to wash down your spicy chicken in Vegas, it might as well have alcohol in it!  Recommended.

Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sandwich

WfZ--a_WzRDLcBIm4JGI0Q.text: I have high expectations for hot chicken ever since I've had Howlin Rays in LA. My friends recommended that I come here to compare the quality of both. I ordered the chicken sandwich with Mac n cheese and the GF ordered half chicken with fries and cole slaw.   Chicken Sandwich 7/10: sandwich was fresh and the cole slaw gave it a creamy crunch, however, I felt it was lacking a little flavor.   Mac n Cheese 7/10: I thought the Mac n cheese was alright. Nothing to rave about.  Fries 8/10: Fries were excellently crispy but a little on the salty side.  Cole slaw 9/10: delicious, crunchy, creamy.  Overall, I like that you do get a side with the chicken sandwich and two sides with the fried chicken that didn't cost an arm and a leg. Had a decent experience here and would come back next time looking for a better time!
