Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bRULoJYceR1VmYLNlZNyiA.text: Glad there's finally a hot chicken spot in Vegas!   I'm no expert on hot chicken, but Howlin Ray's was the best hot chicken I've ever had so far. Their seasoning is literally like crack. I waited 4 freakin hrs on a Saturday there, and it was worth every second. Luckily, there was no line at Hattie B's when I went last Friday with my buddy.   I tried their chicken sandwich, and it was pretty good. I got the medium level spice, and it wasn't too spicy. The chicken breast was juicy and flavorful, and the crinkle-cut fries were excellent! I also got to try some of my buddy's half chicken with the "shut the cluck up" spicy level (which is the highest spice level), and it was pretty hot but manageable. The skin was really crisp, and the seasoning was great!   Hattie B's is thee spot for hot chicken in Vegas right now, but I still gotta give the hot chicken crown to Howlin Ray's.   Also, I asked for a cup of water, but they don't give cups of water. I think this applies to all the spots in Block 16 Urban Food Hall. Bottled water/bottled soda is $5.  Pro tip: Bring your own water/ soda if you can.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shut the cluck up half chicken

GjSbhjzdJU0c8Vj3GsKTMg.text: Hattie B's  I ordered the dark combo which is a leg/thigh quarter with Mac & cheese and fries. I ordered it mild. The chicken was juicy inside and the skin had a nice crispness to it. Mac & cheese was good also real creamy. Fries were perfectly cooked nice and crunchy. Only negative is the drink situation. A single can of pop is 5 dollars. Seems deliberate because I'm sure many come and want to try and get the spicer chicken options and the end up spending 20 dollars on drinks. Great place to eat just bring your own beverage.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dark meat with fries and Mac and cheese.

pArx9bFjU79wP_OxUH1Ntg.text: I had heard about Hattie B's Hot Chicken many times before in the past on TV shows. So I was very happy to hear that they had a location here in the Cosmo. I've previously been to a Nashville hot chicken place in LA so I kind of had an idea of how the food was but I really wanted to see what the original version is.  Overall, the food has fantastic flavor and the line isn't nearly as crazy so that's a win in my book.   I couldn't decide between a chicken platter or the chicken sandwich. And one of the girls recommended that I go with the sandwich.  The girl that was actually working the register was either too nervous or new where she didn't have much personality.  It was another girl at the next register over that recommended food items.  I went with the Hot spiciness, but in hind sight I feel like I should have gone with the next level up.  The seasoning and flavors was really good.  The chicken sandwich came with slaw and pickle slices in it so it plays off with the textures and temperature of the chicken itself.  The sandwiches come with 1 side and i went with the crinkle cut fries.  I was actually surprised how good the fries were, they were crispy yet not too dry and I also really liked the seasoning on it.  I also got the banana pudding that was highly recommended on yelp.  It's definitely a winner.  At first I didn't recognize it on my tray when I got my food and thought it was a side of potatoes or something but then once I opened it up I remembered what it was.  The presentation isn't eyegasmic or anything but it was definitely mouthgasmic.   So how the kiosk is set up, is that you order your food at the registers and they'll give you your drinks and your receipt and they tell you to go to the other end of the booth to pick up your food.  The food orders come out fairly quickly.  I only waited a little bit for my name to be called.   Can't wait to come back and try the other items here.  I'll have to try the platter next time with different sides.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana pudding
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet tea
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana pudding.  Tastes way better than it looks

jVmZ8MJgimFRad0fj2b2iQ.text: Service fast even with a line. Tenders are huge shared w/pimento mac n cheese and collard green sides. Mac was creamy but lacked a bit of flavor. The green were delicious the HOT really is hot.enough to share for a filling snack in between cocktail.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3gRGnNM3Bv5EBQJMbL1RSA.text: Ehhh. I couldn't wait to try this place out and to be honest I wasn't impressed we got the half chicken which was a lot, but my piece of chicken was ok skin and grease, I searched for white mean and I didn't even have any. It was wayyyy too greasy. The bread underneath was good. The side I chose were the Mac and cheese as well as the coke slaw. Cole slaw was good, nothing big but was good. I had high high hopes for the Mac and cheese but it was just ok. Not much flavor, I put a little hot sauce to get some flavor. I couldn't get over the greasy chicken, I mean it's fried, I know but it was too much grease. I got it off my bucket list but wouldn't go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3Rc9lb8_n9rUa9qVvVJpVg.text: Having been to the one in Nashville this location fell well below the bar.  Stopped here on mother's day and grabbed a 2 piece dark (medium) with fries and geeens. I also ordered a sweet tea.  The chicken was very dry and looked like it had been sitting around for a few hours. Also it lacked the flavor of the medium heat. The fries and greens were good. The tea was $5 for what equates to a small (they only have 1 size).  I left bummed out as it's been a minute since I've been to Nashville and was looking forward to some Hattie B's while in Vegas.  If you haven't been to their flagship locations you may dig this, if have been to their other locations you may be better off skipping it.

uZ8BtoJ583_Hx7fmGAJHdA.text: I was really looking forward to nice hot chicken in the Cosmo, but this was really greasy and I felt nauseous after like 2 bites since the chicken is soaked in oil. The spice levels are good, but I'll have to say the fries were the best part! The Mac n cheese was also pretty good, but honestly I was expecting better chicken. If you like nice tender chicken without being soaked in oil, you might want to skip this.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qm_QaiABSDz4Vp2uukaDFQ.text: So I don't have to go to Nashville to get Hattie B's Hot Chicken? YES!  Located in the new food court area at the Cosmopolitan Hotel & Casino, Hattie B delivers some of Nashville's famous Hot Chicken to Las Vegas. When I heard about this, I knew it would be a MUST on my next trip to Vegas.   Fortunately, it was this past weekend and wow was it amazing. The chicken was juicy, crispy, and perfectly flavored. For myself, I got the Large Dark and that was definitely a TON of food for 1 person. The anticipation worked up a big appetite, but I would say a Small size is reasonable for 1 person. It also comes with 2 sides (coleslaw, fries were awesome).   I enjoyed the dark meat, mild level of spiciness and the sides.   Things to know -  1. Limited seating, They have bar stools and some tables nearby. 2. Line can get long, but it also moves quickly. Don't get deterred.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12/1/18 - Large Dark with Fries and Coleslaw.
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12/1/18 - Inside
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12/1/18 - MENU

ONBfk33LCZymT1kAqmYy_Q.text: Located in Block 16 of the Cosmopolitan Hotel, Hattie B's serves up a variety of Nashville hot fried chicken.  I got the small white plate, which comes with 1 breast and wing pieces, 2 slices of bread, sliced pickles, and 2 sides. For sides, I went with mac and cheese and fries. I also added a chicken tender. The chicken I got was too greasy and oily for my liking. It's bathed in melted hot spices to give it that signature Nashville kick, but I found it to be overwhelming. The wing and tender were juicy and moist, but the breast was on the dry side.  The bread was just plain white bread that you can get at any grocery store. No attempt was made to dress it up in any way. The mac and cheese has some pimento peppers in it to bring some heat to the dish.  I really liked their lemonade, and it was a blessing that refills are free and unlimited. You're definitely going to need plenty of liquid to cool down your taste buds from all the heat that the chicken's packing.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u_EQElomAoewn9jgO9mTHw.text: Hattie has been on my list since Block 16 opened. It did not disappoint.  Your choices are a mix of breast/wing, thigh/drum stick, tenders, or half/whole bird. The plates include two sides.   Simple right? No. You choose from four levels of heat. I like it spicy, however Vanessa, the effervescent cashier, provided me with the barometer of spice.   Medium. It's not! Deliciously kick'n, I broke a small sweat. On the extreme end is the ghost pepper infused batter. Blaze'n must be an honest description.  The leg and thighs were moist and full of flavor. Add one tender and it was a filling meal. The pieces come on top of a slice of white bread.   Cole slaw, crinkle fries, mac'n cheese, potato salad, and collard greens are your sides.   I opted to have my protein and carbs with the greens. Decent with a hint of tang. I should have asked if vinegar was available in the True Southern tradition it would have been perfect.   $18 with a soda pop was good deal. I think strawberry soda would have been great. Sweet/unsweetene tea and lemonade are your options.  I will be back before I leave to bring a whole chicken home. My kid would love it!

_9r_pzOVrOjYyYKrxm_wiQ.text: I have been here twice. Second time, not by choice. I was excited to try it the first time I went. I love fried chicken and especially when they are spicy. However, nothing really stood out.   I've tried the dark meats and tenders. I also tried all the sides besides cold slaw. The sides were not bad but not impressive. As far as chicken goes, it is just okay for me too. I've had much better ones like Blue Ribbon, Yard Bird and unfortunately my family thinks even Popeye is better.   As far as the service goes, we got our food pretty quickly both times. That's a plus and how food court should be!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium hot chicken (3/5) potato salad (4/5), collard greens (3/5)
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tenders (4/5), fries (4/5), Mac and cheese (3/5)
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Damn hot chicken (3/5), Mac and cheese/collard green (3/5)

GOxysC44fLzOv6OtoDYl_Q.text: Found Hattie B's Hot Chicken while looking for potential eateries on the strip. Hattie B's is located in "Block 16" of the Cosmopolitan (2nd floor). Hipster upbeat vibe with plenty seats inside and outside of the block 16 area. Prices were very reasonable.   Chicken Tenders Plate ($11): Three pieces of chicken tenders with a slice of white bread and choice of two sides - fries & pimento mac n cheese. The tenders had a good juicy consistency but were a little overly salted. The fries were standard but they didn't jip on the amount provided! Mac n cheese had a subtle pimento flavor but the pasta was too soft to where it was almost mushy. Overall, a solid three stars for the food.   Service was pretty good. The guy prepping the food was energetic and friendly. Note - only bottled water available for purchase.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tenders plate
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dark meat plate

qKitYsT7AwzMGnjg-L3vew.text: I'm not sure what the craze is for this place. I went twice to try and give it an extra shot. I got "shut the cluck up" and I got the "hot" the second time around.   Meat is nice and moist and portion is out of control large but I definitely won't be coming again. The taste just tastes like they should replace the oil or something.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9eur6th2L5rcDcrPLt6DUA.text: Even Better than in Nashville    I usually take pics but we were so hungry when we got it and it looked and smelled so amazing we just scarfed it    The line can get long but it moves fast and they get the food out pretty quick. We went with the Hot and it had some Heat and a LOT of Flavor.   Highly Recommend and Definitely one of our comeback spots probably any and every time in Vegas. Hattie B's Rocks

Ya8Ttj-qiKXw3aINbDGmAg.text: Hot dang, if you're in the mood for a hot chicken sandwich that Hattie B's is known for, you wont be disappointed. Now I'm rarely in the mood for a chicken sandwich, but it was definitely a darn good sandwich.  The bun is soft and fluffy while the chicken is hot, crispy, and spicy. When they put their sauce and pickles in there, it's great. The pickles are nice to have something acidic in there to cut the rest of the chicken and sauce.   We got the fries to go with the sandwich and they're pretty good. Nice and crunchy- everything you want from a fry.  I'd be excited to return to try Hattie B's again and bring some friends to Block 16 not only for the food but also for the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sandwich cut in half

SPG7pteApthUGrK_dgiA4A.text: We were originally going to get eggslut but the line was too long and we needed something fast before we left for Tahoe. I'm so glad we stopped by here- it was delicious. The chicken was so juicy and pack with flavor. I wasn't a fan of the mad and cheese but that's entirely my boyfriends fault for getting me that lol!

gjwEHtia6xn9GN8uPZh1lA.text: Tip: Order up front then wait for them to call your name.  I was looking around Yelp to find a cute marketplace to eat at, and I saw  Block 16 Urban Food Hall. I decided to check it out since it was surrounded by other places like Eggslut, Milk bar, etc. (in case you decide not to eat there).  I came around 2pm on a weekend. There wasn't a long wait for me, but a big line started to form after I came. It was also the most packed compared to the 3 or 4 other little restaurants inside. I waited around 10 minutes for my fried chicken to come out, so it was not bad.  I ordered the small dark meat plate with fries and mac n cheese. The food came out fast, and the service was efficient. The food was soo filling! I shared it with one other person, and we were both stuffed. Even though it was just a small plate (for $9), I was full, so I can't imagine how the large plate is. The fries were really crispy, and the mac n cheese was cheesy and gooey. The fried chicken was also tender and crunchy. They provided a lot of fries and a good amount of mac n cheese. We were definitely starving before we ate it but came out stuffed afterwards.   The food, price, and service were all amazing. My overall experience was great, and I would definitely recommend this place to anyone getting their fried chicken fix on.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mC4nHLhsvB8EXYsaIdrglg.text: Okay this place is really good. So me and my boyfriend wanted Eggslut but that line was waaaaay out the door and we were on a time crunch. So we stumbled upon an this place that was located right across from Eggslut in the cosmopolitan hotel. There were like 5 other choices of food and we decided on this one and it was a great choice. So we decided to split the large dark meat, got fries and Mac and cheese for the sides. I am a wimp when it comes to spice so we got the mild (in my option still a little bit much for me but I still enjoyed it and ranch helped). The fries were the best, the Mac and cheese was rich and creamy, and the chicken was very very good. We throughly enjoyed our meal and we were very full afterwards.  We actually got really lucky because right after we ordered a line started to form and it got long (around 12:30). So I guess everyone else knows this place is good. The people were really nice and helpful. The cashier told us what we're good options, one of the cooks saw I was lost in looking for a tray and he gave it to me. It was just a nice experience. The eatery remind me of a Vegas version of "grand central market" in LA. So you have to find your seats anywhere there is a spot really. Most people are taking to go so there is a good amount of seating and options.   I also didn't know how popular this place was. I snap chatted my food and a friend was surprised I had this food. She knew exactly where it was from and she's wondering where I am so she could go back. Apparently it's a huge hit in Nashville. So if want a taste of Nashville in the heart of Vegas, this place is the bomb   Would I come here again? I'm grateful for this experience but there are so many other things to try (defiantly come at least once)

uTN5Fcbtydihs9cH0xfZ0g.text: I loved Hattie B's in Nashville, but this isn't quite the same. The heat is there (it's real spicy), but the taste and the crunch just wasn't. I'm not sure what's missing - spice mixture or the way they cook it, but the flavor wasn't as bold. Sides are good, though.  Also, they don't have tap water here. Make sure to bring your own water cause you'll need something to wash down the heat.

P0Qff6Y5UEBjaeJAvzawhA.text: Lives up to the hype and puts blue ribbon to shame. I had the tenders with Mac n cheese and coleslaw.   Tenders were amazing and had a nice kick (hot flavor)  Pimento Mac and cheese was really good and definitely creamy and full of flavor.  Only downside was a bottle of water was $5...

w8eSHSyIXf4JOzFsYxm7Ew.text: Solid option in the Food Haul that is reasonably price or dare I say cheaper option for being on the strip. Anyway, I had the original in Nash close to Vanderbilt and from my experience would be that the chicken here is up to bar in comparison to original. That is saying a lot considering how far out west Vegas is from Nash and at the time I tried them it had only been a few weeks they were open. The spices and texture of the breading were all on par, I was impressed how were they were able to replicate it. Since Vegas is a tourist town there are a lot of well known establishments such as Hattie B's that set up shop here in hopes of drawing those tourist crowds. With that being said they can sometimes be a hit or miss and Hattie B's is definitely a hit!

mUB0s9KFFn3O1706O5ubnw.text: Located on the 2nd floor of Cosmopolitan and surrounded by other food joints, these chicken tenders delivers a hot and spicy flavor to your taste buds. We ordered the chicken tender combo in Damn Hot. It's the kind of spice that sneaks in on you and stay there after the first few bites. There's some kick to it but very enjoyable as we do like our spice. Chicken was juicy and delicious!  The mac and cheese as the side was one of the best we've ever had as it was very creamy and thick. We ordered it togo and still enjoyed it when we got back to our room 30+ minutes later. Definitely worth trying if you love hot chicken. There is a good amount of food for the price! Would definitely come back when we're in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Got our Chicken Tenders with a Side of Ranch!

FuX7wE7gQY43DSMVw0xGkw.text: Grab a bite to go on the way back to my hotel. Got the Medium two piece dark, with Cole slaw and fries. I threw in one HOT chicken strip for my daughter and a boozy Jack Daniels slush for me. Delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 Piece Dark
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boozy Slush
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SQ0eQoBlCmG1Uxw7Tt1iQA.text: My mom and I had the pleasure of eating at Hattie B's at the Cosmopolitan in Vegas on 1/18/19. I ordered the small dark chicken, which came with two sides. I had the Pimento Mac & cheese and coleslaw. The coleslaw was okay, it could've been a little sweeter. But, I understand everyone makes theirs different. The chicken was superb. It was seasoned and fried just right. We were very pleased with our meal and we will be back. No complaints here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small dark chicken (leg &amp; thigh), coleslaw, Pimento Mac and Cheese with and Arnold Palmer. The meal also came with a slice of which bread.

ik5sHE2_cGv3MXlNrCGHEw.text: This chicken is awesome. I had the chicken sandwich with fries and I had it the second to hottest spiciest. The sandwich is awesome. It's seasoned so well and if you like chicken, particularly spicy chicken, you'll love this place. Portions are huge and the side of curly fries is huge. I definitely recommend!!

pyjlQOxRAKIS0l2xCYvhYA.text: Me and my fiance ate here last night. We have been to the location in Nashville and fell in love with hot chicken. Food was ok- but not Nashville-caliber.  We also both got very sick last night when we got home. Did anyone else who ate here last night also get sick?

ZNIgqXonobyLEfFcJBjY7g.text: This chicken was the absolute best!! The food was excellent the pimento Mac and cheese excellent!!! I walked all the way from Treasure Island you o the Cosmopolitan to get some Hattie B's and it was well worth my feet aching!! I will check them out the next time I'm in Nashville

_D_scOu4Yyc5RfdMd0zgLQ.text: First and foremost, I did have VERY high expectations for this Chicken spot, the "Hot Chicken" is slated in its name.   I'm from Los Angeles and yes we have many renditions of the "Hot Chicken" and some of them are excellent, meanwhile some are just okay. Hattie B's Hot Chicken was on my list due to the overwhelming Yelp reviews I've seen. I have tried many chicken places and specifically I love Hot Chicken. Unfortunately, Hattie B's is not what it is reviewed to be, I simply do not understand the high ratings. Maybe people are just too drunk to know what's good?   The Chicken is 3/5 at best, a bit too chewy and not tender at all. The Batter/Seasoning is 0/5, how can you even use "Hot Chicken" when the flavor profiles is predominantly just salty and spicy (no flavor). I'm sorry this is the truth. The Comeback sauce is 3/5, can't really go wrong with this sauce anywhere but nothing special.  Sorry as someone who loves chicken and eats a lot of Hot Chicken, this place is simply a 1 star. If we are looking for a decent chicken sandwich, sure, why not, it's Vegas. But if you're looking for actual chicken pieces or tender, this place simply serves a 2/5 chicken. Don't expect too much

I-SMN9lYH9kIabWho1M5pA.text: Nashville hot chicken in Las Vegas. Simple menu. The hot option was pretty . The beer is expensive. No pricing. Goes well with the food. Portion was big (sandwich) shareable for most. The Mac n cheese  compliments the protein. I would try again. The prices should be a little lower on some menu items or have a combo bonus.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot Nashville chicken sandwich 14.00 includes 1 side

N3looi2u1FanyapzsnCctA.text: Have the hot chicken sandwich! With so many places to eat in Vegas we ended up here for something a little lighter and its situated with other small food outlets allowing us all to grab something different. Small queue but worth the short weight.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot chicken sandwich

lj2Xq4yL8kgTJjTFGOSvTg.text: Great chicken, not great service. The chicken is nice and juicy and the favor is great! However, service was not the greatest. We ordered an order of hot chicken tenders then medium heat small dark meat chicken, we received two orders of hot chicken tenders. When we told the chef, they remade the food and gave us medium heat chicken tenders, not what we ordered and didn't even read the receipt even tho we gave it to them!! Not sure if we would go back just because of this experience

FVBKUkplq0c9bYEX2etvLg.text: Overall it was just barely okay...  Pros-  service was quick once I ordered.  Staff was friendly.  Cons-  Food was blah.  Chicken tenders were decent, but the cole slaw and mac and cheese were completely flavorless.    Pretty disappointing meal.  If you're a foodie- avoid this place.

ACziTVLGsQKvKtdJZ9iHZA.text: I was lucky enough to come by here on a weekday night with no wait time! It's located in a the little "food court" section of The Cosmopolitan. Near the center - but big signs will point you the right way :)   I got the leg+thigh w/ two sides - This feeds TWO people for about $14 (As long as you're not starving for 24 hours). Not bad at all for Strip food pricing.   The chicken was super tender and juicy. No dry pieces! Got the mild since I don't do spicy and it was delicious. Potato salad had the big chunky potato pieces, 4/5. Mac and Cheese had a slight heat to it, but it wasn't overpowering 5/5!  I can see how if it gets super busy the line could get long as well as seating issues - but I wouldn't mind getting this to bring up to my room.  Will definitely come back again!

zjwSL2PU4JLwbiFQWRhNkg.text: Try the spicy chicken sandwich!  You may not be able to use your taste buds for awhile, but it's well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Try the spicy chicken sandwich!

NZlNtEFQzVFG_yZByDEZ0A.text: This place is NOT messin around. They were so efficient in taking our order. There was a bit of a line, as to be expected. The cashiers were super speedy and nice.   Mac and cheese- on point.   Fries- YUM  Chicken- Hell Yeah  I had never been. My bestie insisted we go. I'm so glad he introduced me to my next regular food stop while in Vegas.   Thanks for the tasty late night food!!!

JPDRsZl8wBK8Hhf4AyB6TQ.text: I let the server pick my order and got the 3 piece tenders. They were very flavorful. I ordered no spice and it still had a kick to it. I enjoyed the potato salad as well.

arSgYFNcMbK_r8ZcQGZ9fQ.text: I have had a chance to FINALLY try Hattie B's in Las Vegas! I was definitely excited to to try it out since I haven't gotten to go in Nashville. There was definitely a line for Hattie B's but honestly grew behind me as I stood in line. The line does go through pretty quickly since you are ordering with a cashier. Luckily Hattie B's doesn't have an overwhelming amount of options so people could decide pretty quickly what they wanted. I decided to get the Chicken Tenders( medium spice level) with french fries and mac-n-cheese. Lets just say I was satisfied. They definitely give you the right amount of food. The tenders were delicious and flavored to perfection. I love crinkle cut fries so that was a winner with its crispness! The mac-n-cheese was my favorite and I definitely loved the way they did it! It can be a very much a hit or miss at some restaurants for me but Hattie B's did it well! the sweet tea was perfect, but it is a bit pricey. But, go figure it is Las Vegas where everything is a bit much. You can get refills but they don't advertise it you just have to ask.  Definitely check out Hattie B's if you are in the Cosmopolitan Hotel.

t_sHL8TfRkTdjDRKXkfWNg.text: This location serves some amazing fried chicken! The wait was not that long and there were a lot of people ordering take out. We ordered 1/2 bird with Mac & Cheese and fries. Medium heat level was perfect for a decent amount of spice without being too hot. The chicken was perfectly fried, seasoned, crispy and juicy. The Mac & Cheese was rich and creamy. Fries were average. Lemonade and iced tea finished off the meal nicely. Meal was just under $30.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Draft lemonade ($5) and draft ice tea ($5)
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac &amp; Cheese and fries
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 bird plate ($17) with ice tea ($5) and lemonade ($5)

ncN3ZIuBOPLzwCTHscyUWg.text: It's okay. I've tried Hattie B's in Nashville and it's no shock that it's better there than in this Vegas "food court" location. I've had Howlin' Ray's in Los Angeles, which is extraordinary, and there are long lines there for good reason. Not quite sure what it is, but the chicken here seems a lot greasier, and the hot levels seem a bit tamer -- not sure if that's intentional for the Vegas tourist crowd. Overall, nice to have Hattie B's in Vegas as an option if I'm ever craving Nashville hot chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small white medium spice
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h2osYFGANTWpvoODHWnX5A.text: This was by far the most disappointing offering I've had , probably in all of Las Vegas.   Ordered a chicken sandwich (mild) with a side of mac n cheese.    The sandwich came out pretty quickly, the staff was Friendly and helpful and portion was nice.  The chicken was extremely spicy and I'm one who very much enjoys heat but doesn't like when it overpowers the taste of the food. The bun was mediocre at best (on the hard side), the slaw and pickles were the best of the ingredients.   The chicken itself was extremely DRY, and really inedible. Taking bites and having to tear pieces out of your mouth because it was not chewable and dry af... this was a disaster in a bun!!  Next I had the mac and started out thinking it was at least pretty decent and semi enjoyable.  When nearing the end of the small side, I nearly puked finding a effin HAIR mixed into the mac and cheese.    As much as I wanted to enjoy this, it was a huge huge disappointment and I will without doubt, not return!  DISASTER!!

rFEPh0r8LHRnsFqqVG23eg.text: This was my favorite meal of the Vegas trip. Hands down.   I've heard such rave reviews of Hattie B's so I was looking forward to trying it and it left me happy and wanting more!  We were the first in line. It was about 20 minutes prior to them opening and I was starving already. I almost grabbed a sandwich close by but the amazing smell of the chicken frying made me wait for it. Oh so worth it.   My friends and I shared a few pieces of chicken and plenty of sides to devour. The meat had so much flavor and the crispy skin had great crunch and texture. I was pleased.

-HbEhUnKUr3UMR1oZHXM_Q.text: Literally the pictures serve it no justice, the food is the bomb. Gives you that southern feel in your tastebuds with every bite. I got the tenders and chicken sandwich and it was incredible. I loved the sandwich more but the best part is that it's very reasonable to be located in the Casino. Only thing I didn't like was that my wait was a little too long compared to everybody else. Get the sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JFokg7xRvzfskZUaK8RcuA.text: Wow, that was the most expensive fried chicken I have ever had. To have chickens with two soft drinks cost us 50 bucks. The portion was huge. Unusually huge! A huge bird like this must've had tons of hormones to be this size. A chicken tasted good and it was well cooked. The place was loud playing rap music.   There was not a lot of southern side options. No corn bread no barbecue sauce and the usual sourhern options.

DRM3ty9PKDAKEEdR7FjWRA.text: Seems pretty faithful to the Nashville branches which I have visited a few times. The hottest version is definitely endorphin rushing, sweating hot, but it doesn't linger too long, just the way I like it. The sides are big so the the regular white/dark dinner combos are very filling. If I were with someone else, I think we could just split a large rather than ordering two separate...

q-D6ivm0gMDhbK66Bc-ZtA.text: Amazing chicken sandwhich + first class service. My wife got a medium chicken sandwhich that was too spicy for her, they replaced her whole meal and drink at no extra charge. Great staff that really strives to take care of their customers.

_3iEu7Xhg240RSUaDsQhEw.text: A bit pricey but it's on the strip and didn't disappoint as far as taste. Would go again for the slaw, Sammie and even potatoe salad.

z5CUOm9GWwr175NPOASoFQ.text: The chicken was cooked perfectly and was really moist.  Though I asked for mild there was still a bite to the chicken.  The dark meat choice really is a quarter of a chicken that includes the back.  A dipping sauce comes with it but I say don't ruin the chicken with a sauce.  The chicken is served on top of a slice of white bread to absorb the oil.

Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

34TPKLgN6TF2I1WRdup97g.text: I ordered dine in but they bagged it for takeout to establish dominance, which I respect. I kindly tipped them my weight in sunflower seeds and ate my meal in a booth with some strangers nearby. The spiked white drink was tasty. The unsung hero of my meal was the bread dipped in ketchup - highly recommended on their "secret menu". All in all I liked it - it would have been nice to know that they don't have bbq sauce and they don't like to talk about it. They got kinda scared and quiet when I asked. No biggie tho just a little weird.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ApCSb1As_E-sXxwA7vZYjQ.text: I thought the chicken I had was good. I ordered tenders Southern style. Next time I will try a step up on the spice. The chicken was indeed hand breaded and fried right in front of my eyes. The service was friendly. I was shocked that a plain 12 oz. Lemonade was $5. That is excessive, even for Vegas.

fajSrobqhSJHqO7y0056_A.text: I was Uber excited to check out Hattie B's in Cosmo! It was a 20 minute wait at the time that I went. I ordered a mild fried chicken and a side of Mac and cheese. As I received my order, I took a max of 3 bites and realize that this sandwich was nothing special. The Mac and cheese also tasted bland. I went back to counter to request a box to go. As I received my boxes, I quickly placed my food inside of it only to get reprimanded from one of the worker for utilizing the counter space. Da fuq? Howlin Rays and Chick-Fil-A would never!   If you want the best fried chicken in the world, go to Howlin Rays. If you want impeccable customer service, head elsewhere.

D47lK3qkq81ILWQLA0i5dg.text: I came back for my 3rd visit. This was the 2nd time we ordered sauces on the side and they failed to give them to us... they also forgot fries for 1 of the orders, and 2 of the 4 people in my party had 2 swap sides because they missed up the plates. I dont understand why it's so complicated but the food is really good so I guess that makes up for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mild

ojVv4rRll4cx721hQmd5aA.text: Ordered the med dark leg and thigh.  It comes with 2 sides for $14 even.  Got it on the medium spice level abs it was just right for my palate.  Their breading and flavor was pretty awesome.  I would eat there again.

1b4euPTtPl6vZ9Sz8vYZpQ.text: Very nice chicken from eastern side here in Las Vegas. It's so good and you can design how much spicy you need. Here at The Cosmopolitan Las Vegas 2nd floor.

CDBfMAybyfkpX86fyMR5tQ.text: I am a huge fan of chicken sandwich's.  Decided to check out hattie B's.  Got the chicken sandwich medium with a side of Mac n cheese.    Wow. Amazing.

2oe4MXQF6mNqAnoTh4GWtw.text: Good chicken hot and fresh and juicy.  Mild even had a kick.  Just gotta make sure you eat it right away when its hot.

NRNYJMF8zwsVcK69jmhcAQ.text: Best spicy chicken sandwich ever. Get it the hottest they offer! Damn Hot I think they call it! Even though I have this little cut on my lip, the pain is exquisite!! Just know their cold drink sizes aren't real huge if you like a cold drink with a hot spicy habanero sandwich!! It's sloppy good! So grab yourself a gang of napkins!!

NbTBwBhGM69Ge9T2klplzg.text: Staff was fast and efficient, and it tastes just like the original location in Nashville. Excellent!

w-o43zdiKGT3XmLlSbbV5w.text: Had the opportunity to try 4 of the new concepts at Block 16. I brought a friend and our clear favorite was Hattie B's!  It was a mock service, so the lovely cashier made the order for us. She gave us -   -medium-heat bone in chicken breast/wing quarter, served on a slice of white bread -side of mac n cheese -side of cole slaw -sweetened ice tea  -CHICKEN- DELICIOUS. Seriously. So good. Crispy breading, perfect heat, juicy on the inside, incredible flavor! I forgot to grab blue cheese when I picked up the order, and honestly didn't even miss it.  I don't crave fried chicken very often, but I'm already craving it. It was that -I could go back today and happily and guiltlessly eat it again- good.  -MAC N CHEESE- It was fine, not the best I've had, but tasty.  -COLE SLAW- Perfectly refreshing with the spicy chicken. I'm not a huge fan of slaws, but the friend I brought loved it!  -ICED TEA- Good sweetened tea, smooth and fresh with no bitterness in the aftertaste.  Definitely recommend Hattie B's!

raSe2FOokRzoVd8cnbMYlQ.text: This place is amazing. We loved the tenders. So juicy. I would highly recommend stopping by.

6KA8ZKz9uKm6cwhS5TEn-w.text: Food was great but they were very busy and forgot about my bread pudding. Seemed like they were short handed on a busy Sunday night.

WAGigRe2MDn9xvGijwC4EQ.text: This my favourite hot chicken joint. Worth the long wait!!!! Must visit in Nashville.

9rCWQwRcbiK2XB2fYbXHIw.text: I just loved the menu .  You had the opportunity  to order your hot sauce level and side of dipping sauce .  The chicken was extra crispy and delicious . The fries were great !! Also I ordered the collard greens and coke slaw both delicious .
